0.title: Relating to providing additional state minimum salary for certain teachers
0.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an additional $5,000 in state minimum salary to fully certified math and science teachers who teach in these subjects in grades seven through twelve and to certified reading specialists.

1.title: Creating the criminal offense of failing to supervise a child
1.description: This bill creates the offense of failing to supervise a child; it provides affirmative defenses; allows a court to order payment of restitution; provides that a court may give a warning and suspension of imposition of sentence for first offense; allows a court to order, for second offense, parent and child to complete a parent effectiveness program in lieu of fine; and punishes violations by a maximum fine of $1000.00 or community service.

2.title: Increasing the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the public employees retirement system
2.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the public employees retirement system from 2 to 2.25 percent.

3.title: Regulating telemarketing for quasi-state agencies
3.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate telemarketing by quasi-state agencies.

4.title: Income tax deduction for gifts to West Virginia charities
4.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit deductions from federal adjusted gross income, for personal income tax purposes, for contributions to religious, educational or charitable organizations.

5.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
5.title: Requiring abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures
5.description: The purpose of this bill is to require abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures.

6.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
6.title: Income tax exemption for veterans who locate in West Virginia following separation from service
6.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from state income tax, for five years, veterans and their spouses who locate in the state following separation from military service.

7.title: Relating to variable premium adjustable life insurance policies
7.description: The purpose of this bill is to require insurance companies who provide variable premium adjustable life insurance polices to issue annual statements which include information related to how long a particular policy will remain in force under specific circumstances related to the payment and nonpayment of premiums relative to any existing principal amount accumulated for investment purposes under the policy.

8.title: Preventing a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five
8.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five.

9.title: Providing a one-time supplement to certain public employee retirement system annuitants
9.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement to the retirement benefit of certain annuitants or their beneficiaries in the Public Employees Retirement System, as the case may be.

10.title: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers
10.description: The purpose of this bill is to give retired state personnel and retired teachers a 5% a year increase in retirement benefits over the next 3 years.

11.title: Providing for the use of neck braces by football players
11.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission to adopt rules to provide for use of neck braces by football players in interscholastic athletic football events.

12.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
12.title: Making the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice in certain instances
12.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice by employers who have employee stock ownership plans.

13.title: Requiring mine operators to provide notice of hazardous chemical substances and lead exposure to its employees
13.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mine operators  to provide notice of hazardous chemical substances and lead exposure to its employees.

14.title: Changing the time for periodic valuations and assessments of real and personal property
14.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the time for periodic valuations and assessments of real and personal property from every three years to every five years and provide a ten percent cap on any increase in assessment in any one year.

15.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
15.title: Requiring that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area
15.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area.

16.title: Providing that identity theft is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime
16.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the crime of identity theft to provide that it is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime.  Current statutory language limits the felony to persons who commit the crime with the intent to fraudulently represent themselves as another person for purposes of making credit or financial transactions.

17.title: Increasing the required bond for certain businesses regulated by the Division of Motor Vehicles to fifty thousand dollars
17.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of the required bond of certain businesses regulated by the Division of Motor Vehicles to $50,000.00

18.title: Relating to a tax exemption on certain sales of clothing
18.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the consumer's sales tax on sales of clothing.  The tax commissioner is authorized to propose rules to further the intent of the article.

19.title: Prohibiting the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings
19.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

20.title: Removing the "within two years" time restriction in which an application by a former police officer or firefighter, thirty-five years old or older, who previously resigned, may submit an application for reinstatement
20.description: The purpose of this bill is to change from "within two years" to "within ten years" the time restriction in which an application by a former police officer or firefighter, who previously resigned, and who meets other criteria set forth in the law, may submit an application for reinstatement and may be appointed by reinstatement without a competitive examination.

21.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
21.title: Establishing the crime of partial birth infanticide
21.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the crime of partial birth infanticide.

22.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
22.title: Requiring that abortion providers notify the parents of a minor seeking an abortion forty-eight hours before performing the procedure
22.description: The purpose of this bill is to require forty-eight hours notice to the parents of a minor seeking an abortion before performing the abortion.

23.title: Providing a penalty for employers failing to withhold an employee's income for child support obligations
23.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a $100 a day penalty for employers failing to withhold an employee's income for child support obligations.

24.title: Prohibiting mandatory arbitration clauses in consumer loan agreements by regulated consumer lenders in the state
24.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit mandatory arbitration clauses in consumer loan agreements by regulated consumer lenders in the state.

25.title: Relating to conditions of bond for defendants in cases of crimes between family or household members
25.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide certain specific statutory conditions of bond in cases involving crimes between family or household members in lieu of allowing the issuing authority to set conditions of bail.

26.title: Requiring that certain records maintained by the clerk of the county commission to be preserved
26.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that certain records maintained by the clerk of the county commission to be preserved, and to remove the statute of limitations on certain personal actions.

27.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
27.title: Prohibiting the exposure of any game that has been gutted or cleaned from the public's view when possible
27.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish McKinsie's Law by prohibiting the exposure of any game that has been gutted or cleaned from the public's view when reasonably possible; and to provide a penalty.

28.title: Designating urban mass transportation authorities as transportation coordinating bodies for their service areas
28.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate urban mass transportation authorities as transportation coordinating bodies for their service areas.

29.title: Authorizing paid municipal fire departments to investigate suspicious or illegal fires
29.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize paid municipal fire departments to investigate suspicious or illegal fires and to gather evidence at scenes of suspicious or illegal fires set or existing in or around public rights-of-way or otherwise within a municipality.

30.title: Reducing the term of Public Service Commission members from six to three years
30.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the term of Public Service Commission members from six to three years.

31.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
31.title: Exempting public works projects receiving federal assistance and subject to federal labor standards from the state prevailing wage laws
31.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt public works projects receiving federal assistance and subject to federal labor standards from the state prevailing wage laws.

32.title: Authorizing county tax assessors to choose not to impose the property tax in a county on businesses for property that is business inventory intended for resale
32.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county tax assessors to  choose not to impose the property tax in a county on businesses for property that is business inventory intended for resale.

33.title: Providing that the term "impersonation" of a public official or employee includes the act of operating a motor vehicle which falsely displays an official emblem or other marking
33.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the term "impersonation" of a public official or employee includes the act of operating a motor vehicle which falsely displays an official emblem or other marking  connoting government sponsorship.

34.title: Creating the offense of sexual battery
34.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the offense of sexual battery; and to provide a penalty.

36.title: Reducing the corporation net income tax
36.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the primary rate of tax on corporations to eight percent and to reduce the rate ½% a year for 4 years so that the corporation net income tax rate will be 6% at the end of 4 years.

37.title: Reallocating the proceeds from limited video lottery by increasing the percentages payable to counties, municipalities and retailers
37.description: The purpose of this bill is to reallocate the proceeds from limited video lottery by increasing the percentages payable to counties, municipalities and retailers.

38.title: Relating to deferral of court costs and fees when collecting delinquent emergency ambulance bills
38.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the deferral of filing fees and costs incidental to bringing actions in magistrate court for the collection of delinquent ambulance bills by county ambulance authorities or county commissions.

39.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
39.title: Permitting miners fined for noncompliance with mining statutes to pay the penalty or complete a training course in lieu thereof
39.description: The purpose of this bill is to discourage nonpayment of individual personal assessments levied for noncompliance with current mining statutes and rules by permitting assessed individuals the opportunity to either pay the penalty within the prescribed time or to complete a training class in lieu thereof.

40.title: Establishing a program for reprogramming cellular telephones and distributing to seniors for making emergency calls
40.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a program for collecting cellular telephones to be reprogrammed and distributing to seniors without a cellular phone for making emergency calls.

41.title: Prohibiting individual county board of education members from acting on behalf of the board in an individual capacity unless authorized by law
41.description: The purpose of this bill is to recusal of board members during certain votes and prohibit individual county board of education members from acting on behalf of the board in an individual capacity unless authorized by law.  The bill also assesses personal liability for violations.

42.title: Lowering the threshold required for reporting certain information about individuals, firms, associations or committees contributing to a campaign
42.description: The purpose of this bill is to lower the threshold required for reporting certain information about individuals, firms, associations or committees contributing to a campaign from two hundred fifty dollars to one hundred dollars.

43.title: Exempting from personal property taxation, the equipment, inventory and raw materials of crafts people who have had their work evaluated and accepted or juried and accepted by the West Virginia arts and crafts guild
43.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from personal property taxation, the equipment, inventory and raw materials of crafts people who have had their work evaluated and accepted or juried and accepted by the West Virginia Arts and Crafts Guild or by a similar organization.

44.title: Transferring the office of emergency medical services from the department of health and human resources to the department of military affairs and public safety
44.description: The purpose of this bill is to transfer the Office of Emergency Medical Services from the Department of Health and Human Resources to the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety.

45.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
45.title: Requiring that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air
45.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air.

46.title: Establishing a mandatory drug and alcohol testing program for coal miners
46.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a mandatory drug and alcohol testing program for coal miners.

47.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
47.title: Requiring the department of health and human resources to enforce specific abortion clinic regulations
47.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Department of Health and Human Resources to enforce specific abortion clinic regulations. The bill also prescribes a criminal fine for violations of the section.

48.title: Making available to retired participants in PEIA the optional dental, vision, and audiology and hearing-aid services insurance plans that are available to current participants
48.description: The purpose of this bill is to make available to retired participants in PEIA the optional dental, vision, and audiology and hearing-aid services insurance plans that are available to current public employee participants.

49.title: Requiring a seller or a seller's agent at closing to disclose the names, addresses and telephone numbers of all utilities providing service to the real estate involved in the transaction
49.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a seller or a seller's agent at closing to disclose the names, addresses and telephone numbers of all utilities providing service to the real estate involved in a real estate sales transaction.

50.title: Increasing the foundation allowances for professional educators to fifty-five and service personnel to thirty-seven for each one thousand students
50.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the foundation allowance of professional educators per one thousand students from the current 53½ to 55 and to also increase the foundation allowance of service personnel per one thousand students from the current 34 to 37.

51.title: Increasing the amount of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management
51.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the limit of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management from $75,000 to $125,000.

52.title: Authorizing lateral transfers for deputy sheriffs
52.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize lateral transfers for deputy sheriffs.

53.title: Requiring accumulation of certain historical instruction before high school graduation
53.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the accumulation of one and one-half years of instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other founding American historical documents, including the Bill of Rights, before high school graduation. The bill also requires that students study the historical, political and social environments at the time these documents were generated and it prohibits study of social problems, economics, foreign affairs, the United Nations, world government, socialism or communism until basic courses in American state and local geography and history are completed.

54.title: Relating to drilling  gas wells near active coal mines
54.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish when a permit for a proposed well near a permitted mine shall be refused; to add definitions; and to require every pipeline company to file facility maps of its various pipelines.

55.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to promulgate rule implementing a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools
55.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to implement a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools.

56.title: Requiring schools to post and make available to the public the schedules of teachers and staff
56.description: The purpose of this bill is to require every school to post and make available to the public the schedule for every teacher and staff personnel for each school, and if a school fails to do so, the principal of that school and the county superintendent of that school shall be fined five hundred dollars each.

57.title: Changing the compulsory school attendance for children in the state from sixteen to eighteen years of age
57.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the compulsory school attendance age for children in the state from sixteen to eighteen years of age.

58.title: Limiting the right of a jury trial in misdemeanor cases in certain circumstances
58.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the continuation of misdemeanor prosecutions in cases where a defendant is charged by complaint with both a felony and misdemeanor.

59.title: Exempting nonprofit organizations from paying an annual motor vehicle registration fee
59.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt nonprofit organizations from paying an annual motor vehicle registration fee for vehicles used exclusively to carry out its goals and purposes.

60.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
60.title: Allowing pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure
60.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as an abortifacient or that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure.

61.title: Allowing family court judges to carry concealed deadly weapons without obtaining a license
61.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow family court judges to carry a concealed deadly weapon without obtaining a license.

62.title: Requiring color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle
62.description: The purpose of this bill is to require color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle and to provide penalties for violations of this section.

63.title: Defining the offense of trespassing on a railroad track
63.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the offense of trespassing on a railroad track and to make trespassing on a railroad track a misdemeanor.

64.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
64.title: Authorizing county commissions to enact ordinances prohibiting cats from running at large
64.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to enact ordinances prohibiting cats from running at large.  The bill also authorizes county dog wardens or others to seize and impound cats under authority of an ordinance while requiring notice to owners of impounded cats.  Finally, the bill provides that owners of cats causing damage while running loose are liable for the damage.

65.title: Providing teacher retirement eligibility, with full pension rights, when a member's age plus years of total service equals or exceeds eighty
65.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide teacher retirement eligibility, with full pension rights, when a member's age plus years of total service equals or exceeds eighty.

66.title: Prohibiting persons from soliciting contributions on public highways
66.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit charitable organizations from soliciting contributions on public highways and providing a penalty for violation.

67.title: Reducing the federal adjusted gross income for motor fuel expenses incurred in commuting to and from one's occupation
67.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a modification in the state personal income tax by reducing the federal adjusted gross income for motor fuel expenses incurred in commuting to and from one's occupation at the mileage rate allowed at the federal income tax level by the federal Internal Revenue Service.

68.title: Directing one half of any budget surplus in a fiscal year equally to every West Virginia family or individual within two hundred percent of the poverty level
68.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct one half of any budget surplus in a fiscal year equally to every West Virginia family or individual whose gross income is within 200% of the poverty line in the form of a tax rebate to be mailed on July 1, 2007.

69.title: Ensuring victims' rights to testify at sentencing in criminal cases
69.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the rights of victims to testify at sentencing in criminal cases.

70.title: Creating the West Virginia Transportation Oversight Commission
70.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Transportation Oversight Commission.  The bill provides for the designation of five transportation districts with the selection of members of the commission from each district.  The bill provides for compensation and expenses of members and funding for a part-time support staff person.  The bill sets forth certain powers and duties of the commission and requires the preparation of an annual report to be submitted to the Governor and Legislature.

71.title: Promoting contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state parks
71.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a deduction from the adjusted gross income of a taxpayer for contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state, county and municipal parks.

72.title: Making armed assault or conspiracy to commit armed assault upon school property or school personnel or students a felony
72.description: The purpose of this bill is to make armed assault or conspiracy to commit armed assault upon school property, or against school personnel or students who are on school property, a felony punishable by 25 years imprisonment and a $10,000 fine.

73.title: Crediting a deceased teacher's sick leave toward continued insurance coverage for a surviving spouse and other dependents
73.description: The purpose of this bill is to credit a deceased teacher's sick leave toward continued insurance coverage for a surviving spouse and other dependents.  The bill provides that if a surviving spouse or other dependents are not covered by the deceased spouse's public employee insurance, that they receive the monetary value of the accumulated sick leave.

74.title: Changing compulsory school attendance until age eighteen or until the student graduates
74.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the compulsory school attendance until age eighteen or until the student graduates.

75.title: Prohibiting county farmland preservation boards from purchasing land without the permission of the county commission
75.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit county farmland preservation boards from purchasing land without the authority of the county commission.  The bill prohibits the use fees for tourism purposes, historical preservation, or maintenance or management by the county farmland preservation board.

76.title: Changing the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment benefits
76.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment compensation benefits, without it changing the benefits received, from $60 a week to 40% of the person's weekly benefit rate.

77.title: Providing that student residents of this state who commute to school in another state are eligible for the PROMISE scholarship program
77.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that student residents of this state, who commute to out of state institutions approved by the board, which have similar reciprocal provisions for awarding scholarships to students attending eligible institutions in this state, may be eligible for the Promise Scholarship Program if the out-of-state institution is not more than fifty miles from the boundary of this state and the student commutes to classes from his or her home in this state.

78.title: Allowing a state employer or other public employer to contribute to deferred compensation plans to match employee contributions
78.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a state employer or other public employer to contribute to deferred compensation plans to match employee contributions.

79.title: Providing for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto
79.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a death penalty and procedures and standards applicable thereto, and automatic review of the penalty, for commission of murder in the first degree.  Procedures for carrying out the death sentence are established.

80.title: Community volunteer enrichment programs in the public schools
80.description: The purpose of this bill is to recognize the Appalachian Education Initiative promoting the role of art education in the public schools.

81.title: Exempting magistrates from the licensing requirements for carrying a concealed weapon
81.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt magistrates from the licensing requirements for carrying a concealed weapon.

82.title: Requiring county boards of education to establish the daily observance of a minute of silence in all county schools
82.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county boards of education to establish the observance of a daily "minute of silence".

83.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
83.title: Banning partial birth abortions in instances when the unborn child is capable of survival if delivered
83.description: The purpose of this bill is to ban partial birth abortions in instances where the fetus could survive if delivered.

84.title: Funding the PROMISE scholarship program
84.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide increased funding for the PROMISE scholarship program.

85.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
85.title: Providing rape victims with reliable emergency information regarding pregnancy and abortion, and providing those victims with emergency contraception if they desire
85.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide rape victims

86.title: Allowing municipalities to regulate the hours of operation of private liquor clubs by ordinance
86.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow  municipalities to regulate the hours of operation of private liquor clubs by ordinance.  However, the regulation may not allow hours of operation which are in conflict with hours of prohibited  operation set by rule by the Alcoholic Beverage Control Commissioner.

87.title: Requiring that parents whose parental rights are terminated continue to be responsible for support of the child until the child is adopted, reaches age of majority or is otherwise emancipated
87.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that parents whose parental rights are terminated continue to be responsible for support of the child until the child is adopted, reaches age of majority or is otherwise emancipated.

88.title: Making it unlawful to offer for sale or sell products created wholly or in part by county or regional jail inmates
88.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it unlawful to sell or offer to sell products made with inmate labor.

89.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
89.title: Prohibiting abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion
89.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion.

90.title: Relating to a no telephone solicitation contact (Do Not Call) list
90.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that telephone subscribers and telephone service consumers, desiring to be placed on a "Do Not Call" list, indicating that the subscriber or consumer does not wish to receive telephone solicitations, may pay a modest fee to be placed on the "Do Not Call" list maintained by the Public Service Commission.  The bill also provides penalties for violations of the "Do No Call" list.

91.title: Defining "the deceased" for purposes of prescribing that a deceased victim includes unborn children under first and second degree murder
91.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "the deceased" for purposes of prescribing that a deceased victim includes unborn children under first and second degree murder.

92.title: Eliminating a gap in employment for certain Alcohol Beverage Control Commission employees subject to a reduction in force and who are reemployed
92.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate a gap in employment for certain Alcohol Beverage Control Commission employees subject to a reduction in force and who are reemployed and reenter the public employees insurance plan.

93.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
93.title: Exempting the retrieval of a dog turned loose on Sunday from offense of hunting on Sunday
93.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the  retrieval of a dog turned loose before 5:00 a.m. on Sunday from offense of hunting on Sunday.

94.title: Establishing a requirement that voters identify themselves prior to casting a vote
94.description: Establishing a requirement that voters identify themselves prior to casting a vote

95.title: Providing that a firefighter who is medically disqualified from service in the Air National Guard shall not be discharged as a firefighter if he or she  has been cleared to return to work by a physician
95.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a firefighter who is a member of the Air National Guard and who is medically disqualified from service in the Air National Guard shall not be discharged as a firefighter if he or she is able to perform the essential tasks of his or her employment and has been cleared to return to work by a physician.

96.title: Providing that all persons have the right to be free from violence
96.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that all persons have the right to be free from violence without regard to the motivation behind the violence.

97.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
97.title: Requiring the collection of statistics relative to abortions performed in the State
97.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the collection of statistics relative to abortions performed in the state.

98.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
98.title: Relating to exemptions from workers' compensation and surveyor licensing requirements for certain surveyors
98.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from workers' compensation and surveyor licensing requirements for surveyors with more than thirty years of surveying experience with one employee over the age of sixty five. It also exempts from surveyor licensing requirements retired surveyors over the age of sixty-two with no employees.

99.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
99.title: Relating to parental notification requirements for abortions performed on unemancipated minors
99.description: The purpose of this bill relates to parental involvement in the minor's decision to obtain an abortion.  The bill requires abortion providers to obtain proof of age prior to the performance of an abortion on a pregnant woman.  The bill provides for a judicial bypass.  Abortion providers must provide actual or constructive notice to parents of minors, and maintain certifications of such notice as well as parent's proof of identification for a minimum time period in the medical file of the minor.  The bill creates civil liability, criminal penalties, and mandates certain reporting requirements.

100.title: Creating the "Supplement to West Virginia Veterans Education Benefits Program Fund"
100.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "Supplement to West Virginia Veterans Higher Education Benefits Program Fund."  The bill provides that resident veterans honorably discharged, who were residents at the inception of military service, may receive a $50.00 per month stipend if they attend a state institution of higher education. The bill creates a funding source and a commission to carry out the purposes of the legislation.

101.title: Authorizing county commissions to create a special fund for the purposes of posting bond for certain individuals
101.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county commissions to establish a special fund for the purpose of paying certain bail bonds.

102.title: Equalizing the number and alternating the selection of juror strikes in a felony trial
102.description: The purpose of this bill is to equalize the number and alternate the selection of juror strikes between the prosecuting attorney and the accused in the trial of a felony. The bill also corrects a spelling error in existing code.

103.title: Prohibiting discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of having filed claims under the uninsured and under  insured coverage of an automobile policy
103.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of having filed claims under the uninsured and under insured coverage of an automobile insurance policy.

104.title: Providing a base starting pay and retention salary increases for Division of Protective Services law-enforcement officers, excluding the Director and Deputy Director
104.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a base starting pay and retention salary increases for Division of Protective Services law-enforcement officers, excluding the Director and Deputy Director.

105.title: Encouraging state and local government entities to display the national motto, "In God We Trust"
105.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage state and local governmental entities to display the national motto, "In God We Trust."

106.title: Requiring a public hearing and county commission approval prior to the issuance of an initial or transfer license for a private club
106.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner to hold a public hearing and obtain approval from the county commission prior to issuing a first-time license for private club or upon the transfer of a license to a private club at a new location.

107.title: Imposing an excise tax on the sale or rental of obscene materials
107.description: The purpose of this bill is to produce revenue by imposition of a tax upon the sale or rental of obscene materials.

108.title: Assigning benefits directly to providers based on the patients assignment of benefit form
108.description: The purpose of the bill is to allow covered persons to assign their benefits to providers and establishes criteria.

109.title: Increasing the required minimum liability insurance required on a motor vehicle
109.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the required minimum liability insurance required on a motor vehicle.

110.title: Relating to requiring lien holders to notify the sheriff's office via written instrument and to record a release in the county clerk's office within sixty days after the lien has been satisfied
110.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lien holders to notify the sheriff's office via written instrument and to record a release in the county clerk's office within sixty days after the lien has been satisfied; require that the lien be removed from record upon satisfaction; and provide penalties for failure to notify the sheriff and county clerk of satisfaction.

111.title: Justifying the use of deadly force by a pregnant woman when she reasonably believes that her unborn child's life is threatened
111.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide justification to use deadly force when a pregnant woman reasonably believes that her unborn child's life is threatened, even though the pregnant woman does not fear for her own life.

112.title: Prohibiting the use of a person's credit history in insurance transactions
112.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a person's credit history in insurance transactions.

113.title: Relating to credit card solicitation on college campuses
113.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a misdemeanor penalty for violations of law and rules on credit card solicitation on college campuses.

114.title: Creating sales and use tax exemptions for purchases of design and engineering services and materials and equipment directly used in construction of new or replacement amusement rides
114.description: The purpose of this bill is to create sales and use tax exemptions for purchases of design and engineering services and materials and equipment directly used in construction of new or replacement amusement rides or for leases of amusement rides to qualified operators in long established West Virginia amusement parks having historical character.

115.title: Providing that alleged victims of domestic violence or abuse have the right to have a person of their choosing present when they are interviewed by law-enforcement officers or the prosecuting attorney
115.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that alleged victims of domestic violence or abuse have the right to have a person of their choosing present when they are interviewed by law-enforcement officers or the prosecuting attorney.

116.title: Creating the criminal offense of harassment of a participant of a neighborhood crime watch
116.description: The purpose of this section is to create the criminal offense of harassment of a participant of a neighborhood crime watch.  Toward this purpose, the bill defines applicable terms and provides a criminal penalty.

117.title: Providing that candidates for statewide political office belonging to the party with the most registered voters in the state be placed in a preeminent position on the election ballot
117.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that candidates for statewide political office belonging to the party with the most registered voters in the state, or in the case of congressional elections, then belonging to the political party with the most registered voters in the congressional district, be placed in a preeminent position on the election ballot.  The bill also charges the Secretary of State with the duty of determining officially which party has the most registered voters.

118.title: Creating the joint commission on technology and advanced communications
118.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Joint Commission on Technology and Advanced Communications and include nonlegislative members.

119.title: Relating to the unauthorized acquisition of data that compromises the security, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information maintained by the data collector
119.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure upon the unauthorized acquisition of data that compromises the security, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information maintained by the data collector.  The bill requires that consumers be notified of a breach of information security maintained by the data collector.  Civil penalties and other remedies are provided for violations.

120.title: Providing a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology
120.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology.

121.title: Including persons who participate in or who contribute to taking a person's identity with fraudulent intent
121.description: The purpose of this bill is to include persons who participate in or who contribute to taking a person's identity with fraudulent intent under the provisions of the criminal offense of taking the identity of another person.

122.title: Prohibiting solid waste authorities from duplicating or competing with private recycling businesses
122.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit solid waste authorities from duplicating or competing with private recycling businesses.

123.title: Providing a criminal penalty for transmitting bulk electronic mail messages which are unsolicited
123.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a criminal penalty for transmitting bulk electronic mail messages which are unsolicited.

124.title: Providing that personnel carriers used to transport miners must be maintained at the working section
124.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that personnel carriers or trip cars used to transport miners to a working section must be maintained at the working section and must have sufficient capacity to transport all miners out of the working section in the event of an emergency.

125.title: Providing for the continuance of medical coverage for the spouse of a deceased retired public employee for any period previously purchased with accumulated leave
125.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the continuance of medical coverage for the spouse of a deceased retired employee for any period previously purchased with accumulated leave.

126.title: Exempting certain start-up businesses founded by West Virginia college or university graduates from various state, county and municipal taxes
126.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt start-up businesses founded by West Virginia college or university graduates from various state, county and municipal taxes for the first three years of operation.

127.title: Increasing the penalties for child abuse
127.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for child abuse.

128.title: Requiring that the State School Board ensure that no class size for grades seven through twelve be greater than twenty-five students to every one teacher
128.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all classes in grades seven through twelve in public schools to be no larger than twenty-five students to one teacher.

129.title: Providing that United States flags fly at half-mast for three days whenever a state resident soldier is killed by hostile fire or when an in-state law-enforcement officer is killed in the line of duty
129.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that United States flags fly at half-mast for three days whenever a state resident soldier is killed by hostile fire or when an in-state law-enforcement officer is killed in the line of duty.  In furtherance of this purpose, certain provisions of the bill require the Secretary of Military Affairs  and Public Safety to send notice to all appropriate state and local governmental agencies directing them to fly flags at half-mast for three days, commencing two days prior to the funeral.

130.title: Creating new felony offenses of malicious wounding with the use of a firearm and unlawful wounding with the use of a firearm of a law enforcement officer and providing for mandatory jail sentences
130.description: The purpose of this bill is to create new felony offenses of malicious wounding with the use of a firearm and unlawful wounding with the use of a firearm of a law-enforcement officer and providing for mandatory jail sentences for said offenses of at least ten years.

131.title: Exempting county school boards of education school buses from paying tolls for transit over the West Virginia Turnpike or any parkways authority project
131.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt county boards of education school buses from paying tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike and any parkways authority project.

132.title: Clarifying the penalty provisions regarding battery on a police officer
132.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the penalty for  battery on a police officer.

133.title: Providing a statutory good faith exception to the exclusionary rule when evidence has been obtained during an execution of a search warrant, arrest warrant or capias
133.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a statutory good faith exception to the exclusionary rule when evidence has been obtained during an execution of a search warrant, arrest warrant or capias, which is later determined to be invalid, as long as the officer obtaining the evidence has relied in good faith on the search warrant, arrest warrant or capias.

134.title: Relating to granting campus police officers law enforcement powers at private institutions of higher education in this state
134.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant campus police officers law-enforcement powers at private institutions of higher education in this state.

135.title: Relating to the denial of course credits for unexcused absences in school
135.description: The purpose of this bill is to deny course credit for a designated number of unexcused absences in a semester or year.

136.title: Business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of West Virginia coal
136.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of each ton of coal mined in West Virginia by "small mining operations."

137.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
137.title: Relating generally to mine inspectors
137.description: The purposes of this bill are to require the Director of Miners' Health, Safety and Training to consult with the Legislature when dividing the state into mining districts and divisions; to require the director to consult with the Mine Inspectors' Examining Board when establishing the minimum number of inspectors and instructors that will be necessary to carry out the provisions of this code; to clarify the meaning of "practical experience" as it relates to eligibility requirements for vacant exempt positions; to revise work experience requirements for mine safety instructor applicants and to revise minimum passing scores for inspector and instructor examinations.

138.title: Prohibiting employees of higher education from assisting students in securing abortions
138.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit employees of higher education from assisting students in securing abortions.

139.title: Increasing supplemental benefits to certain teacher retirement annuitants
139.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living increase to certain annuitants under the teachers' retirement system.  The supplement is equal to the percentage increase in the consumer price index or three percent, whichever is less, multiplied by the first eighteen thousand dollars of the retiree's annual annuity.

140.title: Requiring the secretary of the department of environmental protection to adopt the federal regulations governing surface coal mining activities
140.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to adopt the federal regulations governing surface coal mining activities.  The bill further provides that any legislative rules proposed by the West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection for the purposes of permitting and regulating mining operations may be no more stringent than the federal regulations promulgated by the office of surface mining reclamation and enforcement.

141.title: Relating to assessments of real property
141.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit increases in the assessed value of real property which is located in a county where a maximum excess levy is in effect, the property has not changed in tax classification and the increased value is more than two percent over the assessed value of the same property for the previous year.

142.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
142.title: Providing that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home
142.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home.

143.title: Creating incentives for encouraging West Virginia workers  to obtain the GED
143.description: The purpose of this bill is to create incentives to encourage West Virginia workers to obtain the GED and incentives to encourage West Virginia employers to allow their employees to prepare for and obtain a GED.

144.title: Expanding the counties covered by West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties; and increasing the number of members
144.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of members on the West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority from twenty to twenty-six and expand the Authority's territory to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties.

145.title: Prohibiting the reclassification of Class II real property for a period of two years if the estate has not been settled
145.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the reclassification of Class II real property for a period of two years if the estate has not been settled.

146.title: Providing that accident report forms are conclusive as to the issue of the accident's cause, unless a court rules otherwise
146.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that accident report forms are conclusive as to the issue of the accident's cause, unless a court rules otherwise.

147.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
147.title: Requiring a physician to receive written consent from at least one parent or legal guardian before an abortion is performed on an unemancipated minor
147.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a physician to receive written consent from at least one parent or legal guardian before an abortion is performed on an unemancipated minor; and provides for a penalty.

148.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
148.title: Providing for a pilot project intended to divert low-income residents from early institutionalization
148.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a pilot project intended to divert low-income residents from early institutionalization in nursing homes by providing personal home care in their communities.

149.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
149.title: Authorizing the Governor to appoint an additional member to the Surface Mine Board that represents the interest of labor
149.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of appointments to the Surface Mine Board by one member and to require that the additional member is appointed from a list submitted by the major union representing coal miners to represent the view point of the working miners.

150.title: Increasing the minimum annual disability benefits amount for a state police officer injured in performance of his or her duties
150.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase both the minimum annual disability benefits amount for a State Police officer and the minimum annual death benefits amount for a surviving spouse of a deceased State Police officer from six thousand dollars to ten thousand dollars.

151.title: Creating a criminal offense for picketing or disrupting funerals or memorial services
151.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a criminal offense for picketing or disrupting funerals or memorial services.

152.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
152.title: Prohibiting subsidies to entities that perform abortions
152.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit subsidies to entities that perform abortions.

153.title: Providing a cost-of-living provision for certain persons retired under the teachers retirement system
153.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living provision for certain persons retired under the Teachers Retirement System.

154.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
154.title: Providing an employee the right to decline to work more than forty hours in a workweek
154.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that an employee has the right to decline to work more than forty hours in a workweek.

155.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
155.title: Requiring employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on-call on the employer's premises
155.description: The purpose of this bill is to require employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on-call on the employer's premises.

156.title: Creating the West Virginia Literacy Council
156.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Literacy Council.

157.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
157.title: Establishing the hospitals infection disclosure act requiring hospitals to disclose hospital-infection rates for the public
157.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Hospital Infections Disclosure Act which requires hospitals to disclose hospital-infection rates for the public.

158.title: Prohibiting the willful obstruction or impediment of a funeral or interment service
158.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the willful obstruction or impediment of a funeral or interment service, and to  prohibit demonstrations at a funeral or interment service within one thousand feet of the funeral home, church or cemetery.

159.title: Relating to the use of checks, bank account debit authorizations, or share drafts as security for loans or cash advances
159.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent the taking of either checks, similar instruments or authorizations for electronic account debits in order to guarantee loans or cash advances by payday lenders or others.

160.title: Providing service credits for service in the West Virginia national guard and reserve for public employees retirement system and civil service examinations
160.description: The purposes of this bill are as follows:  (1) To provide for service credits, for purposes of public employment retirement, for service in the West Virginia National Guard and Reserve; and (2) to provide for the award of additional testing credit points in civil service examinations for members of the National Guard and Reserve who are applying for state employment.

161.title: Requiring the Attorney General to comply with certain requirements when entering into contracts for legal services
161.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Attorney General to comply with certain requirements when entering into contracts for legal services to be performed by persons other than full-time Assistant Attorneys General or other full-time employees of the state as well as modifying current statutes to require greater legislative and executive supervision of these types of contracts.  Toward these ends the bill includes the following provisions:  (1) Requiring the Attorney General to report to the Governor and the Joint Committee on Government and Finance relative to these contracts; (2) requiring the Attorney General to report to the Governor and Joint Committee on Government and Finance upon the conclusion of such services, including a statement of fees involved on an hourly basis; (3) prohibiting the payment of fees to such persons in excess of $500 per hour; (4) requiring the joint committee to study the new provisions and to report recommendations for further changes to the full Legislature before the 2008 session; (5) requiring the Attorney General to submit  semi-annual reports to the Governor and the Joint Committee on Government and Finance while requiring the inclusion of information concerning the nature of these contracts; (6) requiring all attorney fees or costs awarded the Attorney General to be deposited into the State Fund; and, (7)requiring that contracts proposed by the Attorney General be approved as to form by the Secretary of State.

162.title: Providing that the reduction in the tax rate provided in this section applies to mines operating before the effective date of the applicable provision
162.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the reduction in the tax rate provided in this section of the West Virginia Code applies to mines operating before the effective date of the reduction.

163.title: Providing Good Friday as a state legal holiday
163.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that "Good Friday" is a state legal holiday.

164.title: Allowing comparable credit at trade or vocational schools approved by the State Board to count towards service personnel pay rates
164.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to make section consistent with previous amendments that allows comparable credit at trade or vocational schools approved by the state board to count towards certain service personnel pay rates.

165.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
165.title: Requiring the Department of Health and Human Resources to maintain information for public dissemination relative to judicial bypasses to the requirement of parental notification relative to abortions performed on minors
165.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Department of Health and Human Resources to maintain information for public dissemination relative to judicial bypasses to the requirement of parental notification relative to abortions performed on minors.

166.title: Eliminating fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau to the State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments
166.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau of the West Virginia State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments.

167.title: Relating to minimum grab bar standards for hotel and motel rooms that are specifically designated or intended for use by handicapped or disabled guests
167.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the maintenance of sufficient grab bars in hotel and motel rooms which have been set aside or designated to serve the needs of disabled patrons, to reduce the prospect of injury caused by falls in tubs and showers.

168.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
168.title: Relating to a child's right to nurse
168.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect a mother's right to breast feed a child in any location where the mother and child are otherwise authorized to be.

169.title: Making it a misdemeanor to fail to provide a woman with information regarding all available reproductive alternatives
169.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor to fail to provide women with all available reproductive alternatives and to provide criminal penalties for violations.

170.title: Giving local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel in its jurisdiction
170.description: The purpose of this bill is to give local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel.

171.title: Requiring bids under state contract to disclose the location of work to be performed or risk state  termination of the contract
171.description: The purpose of this bill is to require bids under state contract to disclose the location of work to be performed or risk state termination of the contract.

172.title: Adding a magistrate to those serving Putnam County
172.description: The purpose of this bill is to add a magistrate to those serving Putnam County.

173.title: Prohibiting the Division of Natural Resources from approving or rejecting any certification issued under the provisions of 33 U. S. C.  section 1344
173.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the Division of Natural Resources from approving or rejecting any certification issued under the provisions of 33 U.S.C. §1344.  It also prohibits the director from requiring additional mitigation as a condition of certification by the state when mitigation is already a required component of the permit issuable by the United States Army Corps of Engineers under the provisions of 33 U.S.C. §1344.

174.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
174.title: Creating the Self-Employment Assistance Act
174.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Self-Employment Assistance Act.

175.title: Creating the "West Virginia Joint Coal Owners Trust and Conservation Act"
175.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a new article which proposes to provide a less complex, more expedient way for a party controlling the majority interest in a coal tract securing a coal lease to develop and recover the coal.  This new article provides for a court-appointed trustee who will recommend a coal lease and administer the lease to assure the proper distribution of coal royalties to defendant joint owners.  Unknown owners will be represented by a guardian ad litem.  Parties will no longer need to  file partition actions in circuit court.

176.title: Relating to the justifiable use of force, including deadly force, in the protection of persons and property
176.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a person to use force, including deadly force, against an intruder or attacker in a dwelling, residence or vehicle under specified circumstances; to provide, under certain circumstances, that a person may stand his or her ground and meet force with force, and has no duty to retreat; providing criminal and civil immunity for using deadly force.

177.title: Relating to cases involving the Office of the Attorney General
177.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the Joint Committee on Government and Finance approve any proposed settlement involving the Office of the Attorney General while, additionally, providing that any proceeds received in any civil action involving the Office of the Attorney General be deposited in the General Revenue Fund to be appropriated by the Legislature.  In addition, the bill requires that the Attorney General seek bids from private attorneys when seeking outside legal assistance.

178.title: Prohibiting law-enforcement officers from asking crime victims if they have insurance coverage to cover losses occasioned by criminal activity
178.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit law-enforcement officers from asking crime victims if they have insurance coverage to cover losses occasioned by criminal activity.  The rationale for the proposal is that law enforcement have less incentive to solve crimes and recover lost property when they believe insurance coverage exists to compensate a victim.  The bill excludes criminal investigations in which law-enforcement officers have reasonable suspicion to believe that a crime has been staged or falsely reported.

179.title: Providing West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside this state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the student's desired field
179.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside the state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the student's desired field.

180.title: Relating to allowing bus operators for county school systems to carry-over years of experience operating buses for purposes of determining seniority
180.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow bus operators for county school systems to carry-over years of experience operating buses for purposes of determining seniority.

181.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
181.title: Prohibiting a business or organization from performing abortions in a public facility
181.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit businesses or organizations from using a public facility to perform abortions; and providing for a penalty.

182.title: Relating to calculating child support under the extended shared parenting plan
182.description: Relating to calculating child support under the extended shared parenting plan

183.title: Imposing misdemeanor penalties for obstructing or giving false statements to a law-enforcement officer
183.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that making a false statement to a law-enforcement officer in the conduct of an investigation is a misdemeanor offense.

184.title: Allowing nonprofit organizations to hold up to two charitable Texas hold'em tournaments per year
184.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for nonprofit organizations to hold up to two charitable Texas hold'em  tournaments per year.

185.title: Requiring purchasers of real estate subject to tax liens to pay for notices to redeem
185.description: The purpose of this bill is to end the practice of county clerks offices paying for tax lien real estate purchasers' required notices to redeem, by requiring purchasers of real estate subject to tax liens to pay for each and every notice to redeem.

186.title: Salary increases for public employees based upon residential housing costs
186.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for state employees based upon residential housing costs.  The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

187.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
187.title: Establishing a special sidelock black powder rifle deer hunting season
187.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a special primitive black powder muzzle-loading rifle deer hunting season and requiring a stamp therefor.

188.title: Providing correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service
188.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service.

189.title: Notifying persons from out-of-state who issue worthless checks in this state and who, fail to pay the check and applicable fine or fail to appear in court, that a notice of their failure will be sent to the Division of Motor Vehicles
189.description: The purpose of this bill is to notify persons residing out-of-state who write worthless checks in this state and who after being served with a summons upon a worthless check complaint fail to pay the check  and applicable fine or fail to make an appearance in magistrate court, that a notice of their failure will be forwarded to the Division of Motor Vehicles to be dealt with in accordance with existing law.

190.title: Relating to transferability for certified law-enforcement officers from one department to another throughout the state
190.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow certified law-enforcement officers to transfer to other departments in the state and retain all civil service status from the previous department in which they were employed.

191.title: Providing that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked
191.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear, the person shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked.  The bill also provides that the Division of Motor Vehicles mail notice of the revocation to the state wherein the person who wrote the bad check holds a driver's license.

192.title: Increasing salary increments paid to principals and assistant principals
192.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the state minimum salary increment rates for principals and assistant principals.

193.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
193.title: Requiring a certified person to examine underground mines after cutting and welding has been performed
193.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a properly certified person to examine underground mines after cutting and welding has been performed to determine if there are any hot spots not previously undiscovered.

194.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
194.title: Making the senior citizens discount on campground rental fees at state parks available year-round
194.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the fifty percent discount on campground rental fees at state parks for West Virginia senior citizens available year-round, instead of during the "off-season" only.

195.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
195.title: Establishing the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers and requiring certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States
195.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers; to require certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States; to establish customer's right to know a customer sales or customer service call center information; and providing a penalty.

196.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
196.title: Providing a ten percent discount to residents at state parks and forests
196.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreational activities at state parks and forests.

197.title: Providing for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades one through six
197.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for increased compensation for aides and paraprofessionals with large numbers of pupils in kindergarten and grades 1-6.

198.title: Allowing state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conference for their children
198.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conferences for their children.

199.title: Releasing the name and identification of any juvenile adjudicated or convicted of a crime to the victims
199.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the release of the identity of juveniles adjudicated or convicted of a crime to the victim of the juvenile offense.

200.title: Providing that adultery shall be a bar to alimony in a divorce proceeding
200.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that adultery be a bar to receiving alimony in a divorce proceeding.

201.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
201.title: Requiring the superintendent or owner of a mine to sign the fire boss record book daily
201.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the superintendent or owner-operator of the mine to sign the fire boss record book each day along with the mine foreman.

202.title: Establishing threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual
202.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish threshold quantities of certain controlled substances to trigger prima facie evidence of intent to deliver if possessed by an individual.

203.title: Empowering certain county and municipalities to deny a development activity if adequate public facilities, assets and services are not available to support the activity
203.description: Empowering certain county and municipalities to deny a development activity if adequate public facilities, assets and services are not available to support the activity

204.title: Authorizing county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income
204.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income.

205.title: Extending unemployment compensation benefits when special circumstances exist
205.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the Governor authority to grant an extension for unemployment compensation benefits when special economic circumstances exist.

206.title: Allowing the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program for qualified inmates sentenced to a regional jail facility
206.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a work program for qualified inmates sentenced to a regional jail facility. It includes provisions specifying minimum requirements for the program and the distribution of money earned in the program.

207.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
207.title: Requiring faith-based, abstinence-only and antichoice facilities to have written policies and procedures
207.description: The purpose of this bill is to require faith-based, abstinence-only and antichoice facilities to have certain written policies and procedures.

208.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
208.title: Requiring any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program
208.description: The purpose of this bill is to require any faith-based facility that counsels women regarding contraception, abortion or pregnancy to maintain a quality assurance program.

209.title: Changing the PROMISE Scholarship Program to the PROMISE Forgivable Student Loan Program and establishing deferment and forgiveness conditions
209.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the PROMISE Scholarship Program to the PROMISE Forgivable Student Loan Program and to establish deferment and forgiveness conditions.

210.title: Providing that utility trailer registration plates are midsized relative to automobile registration plates and motorcycle plates
210.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that utility trailer registration plates are mid-sized relative to automobile registration plates and motorcycle plates.

211.title: Lying to a deputy sheriff or municipal police officer who is conducting an investigation of a felony, is a misdemeanor
211.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that lying to a deputy sheriff or municipal police officer who is conducting an investigation of a felony, is a misdemeanor.

212.title: Clarifying that the sheriff is the appointing officer with respect to deputy sheriffs who have resigned and thereafter seek appointment by reinstatement
212.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the sheriff is the appointing officer with respect to deputy sheriffs who have resigned and thereafter seek appointment by reinstatement.

213.title: Increasing the penalties for discarding trash on land and in streams
213.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for discarding trash on land and in streams and make fines community service mandatory.

214.title: Requiring the use of helmets by skateboarders
214.description: The purpose of this article is to require the use of helmets on skateboards.

215.title: Prohibiting municipalities from imposing user fees on persons who reside outside the municipality
215.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit municipalities from imposing user fees on persons who reside outside the municipality.
