216.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
216.title: Authorizing medication administration by unlicensed personnel of nursing homes
216.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize medication administration by unlicenced personnel of nursing homes.

217.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
217.title: Requiring licensure of pharmacy benefit managers
217.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the licensure of pharmacy benefit managers and to establish related regulatory requirements.

218.title: Preventing political subdivisions of the state from selling goods in competition with private businesses
218.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent political subdivisions of the state from selling goods in competition with private businesses.

219.title: Allowing school service personnel the opportunity to vote on giving transfer preference to employees from a merged school
219.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow school service personnel the opportunity to vote on giving transfer preference to employees from a merged or consolidated school or school facility.

220.title: Allowing the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a one hundred dollar motor vehicle inspection facility application fee
220.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Superintendent of the State Police to charge a fee of one hundred dollars to process a motor vehicle inspection facility application.

221.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
221.title: Exempting one motor vehicle owned by a resident of this state on active duty in the United States military from ad valorem taxes for any taxable year the person is in the military
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt one motor vehicle owned by a resident of this state on active duty in the United States military from ad valorem taxes for any taxable year the person is in the military.

222.title: Relating to equally compensating all state magistrates
222.description: The purpose of this bill is to equally compensate all state magistrates at the higher tier salary schedule.

223.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
223.title: Prohibiting certain employers from  meeting and communicating with employees regarding the employer's political, religious, or labor organizing activities
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain employers from  meeting and communicating with employees regarding the employer's political, religious, or labor organizing activities.  The bill also provides a civil remedy for violations.

224.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
224.title: Prohibiting sale at full retail price of any damaged container or canned goods
224.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the sale at full retail price any damaged container or canned goods.  It further adds a penalty, if convicted, of $100 per damaged item that is deliberately placed with undamaged goods.

225.title: Redirecting fines for cemetery vandalism back to cemeteries to be used for damage repair
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for repairing cemeteries, etc., damaged by vandals, by redirecting fines for cemetery vandalism back to cemeteries to be used for damage repair.

226.title: Removing the exemption from planning and zoning restrictions for mining and manufacturing activities and uses
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the zoning exemption regarding existing uses for mining and manufacturing activities.

227.title: Capping premium increases for Public Employees Insurance Agency retirees at five percent
227.description: The purpose of this bill is to place a five percent cap on all premium increases for Public Employees Insurance Agency retirees.

228.title: Providing that actions in which the state is a party be brought in the county which is affected or related to the controversy
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that venue properly lies in Kanawha County in relation to certain controversies involving the state.

229.title: Establishing a secure residential school for juvenile status offenders
229.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a secure residential school for juvenile status offenders; and to provide an alternative school for children who are expelled or suspended from regular school by permitting them to attend evening classes or night school.

230.title: Limiting the exemption given to buildings used wholly as dwelling houses for no more than two families to those buildings only when owner-occupied
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the Fire Commission Rule adopting the Fire Code. The bill limits the exemption given to buildings used wholly as dwelling houses for no more than two families to those buildings only when owner-occupied.

231.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
231.title: Prohibiting certain nursing homes from using state funds for activities unrelated to the provision of health care services
231.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain nursing homes from using state funds for activities unrelated to the provision of health care services.  It also requires reporting and establishes civil actions and penalties.

232.title: Allowing mental hygiene commissioners to carry concealed weapons
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow Mental Hygiene Commissioners to carry concealed weapons.

233.title: Uniform Premarital Agreement Act
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Uniform Premarital Agreement Act.  This Act allows parties to a marriage to contract prior to marriage with respect to property rights, actions to be taken upon dissolution of the marriage, rights to insurance proceeds upon death of either party, choice of controlling law and any other matters not in violation of criminal statutes or public policy.  Child support cannot be adversely affected.

234.title: Requiring the Department of Environmental Protection to remediate any waste tire pile in the state consisting of more than twenty-five tires
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Department of Environmental Protection to remediate any waste tire pile in the state consisting of twenty-five or more tires.

235.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
235.title: Prohibiting the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.

236.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
236.title: Requiring physicians performing abortions take steps designed to save the life of any aborted live fetus
236.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to take steps designed to save the life of a child delivered alive during an abortion procedure.  The bill also prescribes criminal penalties for violations of this section.

237.title: Requiring that a criminal defendant's right to a jury trial in misdemeanor cases is forever waived unless requested within twenty days of initial appearance
237.description: The purpose of this bill is to require, under all circumstances, that a criminal defendant's right to a jury trial in misdemeanor cases is forever waived unless he or she requests it within twenty days of his or her initial appearance in magistrate court.

238.title: Limiting the purchase of handguns to one gun per month
238.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the purchase of handguns to one gun per month.  The bill exempts law enforcement, correctional facilities, and private security companies from the limitation while providing criminal penalties.  Finally, it exempts

239.title: Excluding certain employment-related expenses from the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support
239.description: Excluding certain employment-related expenses from the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support

240.title: Requiring that employers perform criminal history background checks for employees involved in the installation of home security systems
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that employers perform criminal background checks of employees who are to be involved in the installation of home security systems.

241.title: Requiring businesses which use scanners at the checkout counter to post prices on the shelf
241.description: This bill requires businesses which use scanners to price items at the checkout counter or register, to post prices on the shelf, legibly and in a conspicuous manner; and if the price posted differs from that on the scanner, then the consumer may buy the item at the lower of the two prices.

242.title: Making the state's criminal and penalty laws applying to the use of alcoholic beverages in motor vehicles conform to federal law
242.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the consumption of an alcoholic beverage as well as the possession of an open alcoholic beverage container in a motor vehicle.

243.title: Establishing school service personnel class title and pay grade for the positions of "Administrative Assistant" and "Legal Secretary"
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the school service personnel class title and pay grade for the positions of  "Administrative Assistant" and "Legal Secretary."

244.title: Exempting funeral-related retail sales from the consumers sales tax
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the consumers sales tax any sales of burial or funeral goods sold at retail to the public by a licensed funeral home or director used in connection with the funeral or alternative for the final disposition of human remains.

245.title: Allowing a school service mechanic to have experience, training and certifications considered towards his or her pay rate
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a school service mechanic to have experience, training and certifications considered towards his or her pay rate.

246.title: Providing that members and staff of the Legislature shall automatically receive one-fourth of the required continuing legal education for each regular session worked or served
246.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that members and staff of the Legislature automatically receive one fourth of the mandated continuing legal education for each regular session he or she works. The bill also clarifies that mandatory continuing education should never have applied to those persons who were already admitted to practice law when the requirement was promulgated.

247.title: Relating to increasing the environmental protection advisory council membership to nine members
247.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the membership of the Environmental Protection Advisory Council from seven to nine members.  Under the bill the new members represent agricultural and forestry interests.  The bill also provides for meetings on the call of members, appointment of technical advisory committees and it specifically allows the council to submit suggestions to the secretary of environmental protection for proposed legislative rules and amendments.

248.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
248.title: Providing for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff
248.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the adequate staffing of nursing homes and training of nursing home staff.

249.title: Relating to members choice of beneficiaries
249.description: The purpose of this bill is to:  (1) Remove the ability of a  member to choose a beneficiary who has an insurable interest, other than his or her spouse or disabled dependent child, to receive an annuity; and (2) allow a member or former member to choose to have the preretirement death benefit paid in a lump sum amount to any beneficiary or beneficiaries he or she chooses.

250.title: Providing criminal penalties for negligently or carelessly shooting and wounding or killing a human being while hunting under the influence of alcohol or drugs
250.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide criminal penalties for negligently or carelessly shooting and wounding or killing a human being while hunting under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

251.title: Providing for reexamination of drivers holding valid drivers licenses who are observed by police officers violating traffic laws or who appear to have caused accidents as the result of negligence or inadequate driving skill
251.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure in which a driver may be required to be reexamined for purposes of maintaining his or her driving privileges after a police officer, upon reasonable grounds, determines that a driver, as the result of an accident or by otherwise committing a driving violation, has exhibited negligence or inadequate driving skill.  To this end, the bill requires that every accident report include a check-off square for an officer to mark when the officer believes a driver should be reexamined.  The bill includes provisions respecting a driver's right to due process in the event a police officer opines that the driver needs to be reexamined.

252.title: Providing limited immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to public health departments
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to a Public Health Department.

253.title: Providing that a judge becoming eligible for retirement is not required to contribute to the retirement system
253.description: Providing that a judge becoming eligible for retirement is not required to contribute to the retirement system

254.title: Relating to salary increases for teachers based upon residential housing costs
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for a teacher  based upon residential housing costs.  The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

255.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
255.title: Amending certain provisions involving dental hygienists
255.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide settings in which a dental hygienist may perform their duties without direct supervision.

256.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
256.title: Increasing the percentage of the "license fund-wildlife resources" derived from license fees that may be used for capital improvements and land purchases for benefitting state wildlife
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the percentage of the "license fund-wildlife resources" derived from license fees that may be used for capital improvements and land purchases for benefitting state wildlife from ten to twenty percent and  to correspondingly decrease the amount from these fees that are budgeted for the Wildlife Resources Division by ten percent.

257.title: Relating to increasing supplemental benefits to certain teacher retirement annuitants
257.description: The  purpose of  this  bill  is  to  provide  a cost-of-living increase for the 2007 and 2008 years to certain annuitants under the Teachers' Retirement System.  The supplement is equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index or three percent, whichever is less, multiplied by the first eighteen thousand dollars of the retiree's annual annuity.

258.title: Prohibiting persons from impersonating a public official by copying or imitating the markings of a public agency or official on a motor vehicle
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the term "impersonation" of a public official or employee includes the act of operating a motor vehicle which falsely displays an official emblem or other marking  connoting government sponsorship.

259.title: Increasing the salary increments paid to principals and assistant principals
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the state minimum salary increment rates for principals.

260.title: Relating to authorizing the police to impound a motor vehicle and auction it to the highest bidder when the owner has been convicted of driving with no insurance three or more times
260.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the police to impound a motor vehicle and auction it to the highest bidder in the event the driver of the vehicle has been convicted of driving without insurance three or more times.  The bill also provides for the use of funds collected from the sale of impounded cars while prohibiting operators of motor vehicles who do not have insurance coverage from instituting lawsuits for damages.

261.title: Prohibiting operators of motor vehicles who do not have insurance coverage from instituting lawsuits for damages
261.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit operators of motor vehicles who do not have insurance coverage from instituting lawsuits for damages.

262.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
262.title: Prohibiting employers and labor unions from requiring employees to become or remain members of labor unions as a condition to employment
262.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit employers and labor unions from requiring employees to become or remain members of labor unions as a condition of employment.

263.title: Providing a two thousand eight dollar salary increase for each employee of the Division of Corrections
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $2008.00 salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections.

264.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
264.title: Relating to the removal of the exemption for government employees performing electrical work on government property from having to possess an electrician's license
264.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the exemption of government employees doing electrical work on government property from having to possess an electrician's license.

265.title: Prohibiting a person convicted of any felony from holding public office
265.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit convicted felons from holding public office.

266.title: Creating the Student and Family Privacy Protection Act
266.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Student and Family Privacy Protection Act.

267.title: Allowing for more teachers to be reimbursed for approved course work
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for more teachers to be reimbursed for approved course work by limiting the amount of course work for which any one teacher may be reimbursed and removing a division between reimbursement for certification renewal and additional endorsement courses of the available funds.

268.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
268.title: Prohibiting pharmacists and other persons involved in dispensing medicines from refusing to fill prescriptions
268.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit pharmacists and other persons involved in dispensing medicines from refusing to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance without a valid reason. It provides for complaints to the Board of Pharmacy and a civil cause of action.

269.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
269.title: Requiring mandatory alert when natural gas or other petroleum product pipeline facilities are observed in a damaged state during commercial activities in the vicinity of pipeline facilities
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mandatory alert when natural gas or other petroleum product pipeline facilities are observed in a damaged state during commercial activities in the vicinity of pipeline facilities.  The proposed legislation, additionally, provides civil and criminal penalties for violators.

270.title: Increasing certain county boards of education personnel salaries
270.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase service personnel salaries by six percent and to rectify inequities in their salary schedules and pay grades by upgrading the pay grades of cooks and custodians and adding pay grades to the bus operator classification. To clarify when aides should be considered supervisory employees for purposes of receiving pay at a higher pay grade and to provide that classroom aides in kindergarten classrooms which have more pupils than the maximum pupil/teacher ratio receive additional compensation as to professional personnel in the classrooms and to allow service personnel to retain their seniority for purposes of reduction in force when they move from one classification to another.

271.title: Salary increases for school service employees based upon residential housing costs
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide salary increases for school service personnel  based upon residential housing costs.  The employee shall receive an annual salary increase of two percent of the employee's regular salary for every ten percent that residential home prices in that employee's county exceed the statewide average for residential homes.

272.title: Augmentation to any salary increase for any public employee, teacher or school service personnel
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to augment any salary increase received by a public employee, teacher or school service personnel by 5% of the increase for every 1% the employee's or teacher's resident county's per capita income exceeds the average county per capita income for the state.

273.title: Providing that attendance of college by a noncustodial parent may not be used as grounds to modify a child support order
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the attendance of college by a noncustodial parent may not be used as grounds to modify a child support order.

274.title: Increasing the distance that a beer licensee must be located from a school or church
274.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the distance that a beer licensee must be located from a school or church from three hundred to one thousand feet.

275.title: Requiring mandatory blood tests from drivers involved in motor vehicle accidents that result in death or bodily injury if suspected of being under the influence of drugs, alcohol or both
275.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mandatory blood tests from drivers involved in motor vehicle accidents that result in death or bodily injury from the accident if a law-enforcement officer has reasonable grounds to suspect a driver is under the influence of drugs, alcohol or both.

276.title: Prohibiting out-of-state persons or business entities from soliciting business by written advertisement in this sate under certain circumstances
276.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit out-of-state persons or business entities from soliciting business by written advertisement in this state by appearing to be a local or in-state person or business, unless the advertisement shows where the person or business entity is located.  This is to prevent out-of-state businesses from advertising locally with 800 numbers to solicit customers and then contracting with a local company at a reduced rate to provide a service without paying sales tax.

277.title: Rectifying inequities in the salary schedule and pay grades for service personnel by upgrading the pay grade of cooks and custodians
277.description: The purpose of this bill is to rectify inequities in the salary schedule and pay grades for service personnel by upgrading the pay grade of cooks and custodians.  To clarify when aides should be considered supervisory employees for purposes of receiving pay at a higher pay grade and to provide that classroom aides in kindergarten classrooms which have more pupils than the maximum pupil/teacher ratio receive additional compensation as to professional personnel in said classrooms.

278.title: Providing an exemption from estate taxes and the Consumers Sales and Service Tax for certain expenses of any infant who dies before reaching one year of age
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from estate taxes and from the Consumer Sales and Service Tax for certain expenses of any infant who dies before reaching one year of age.

279.title: Relating to disclosure requirements for political campaign advertisements
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide disclosure requirements for political campaign advertisements. The bill also provides criminal penalties and civil remedies.

280.title: Providing for the Public Employment Relations Act
280.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the Public Employment Relations Act, designed to require public employers to recognize and engage in collective bargaining with labor unions representing public employees.

281.title: Requiring the Secretary of the Department of Administration to propose a rule implementing public employee acceptable use standards for the Internet
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of the Department of Administration to propose a rule implementing public employee acceptable use standards for the Internet.

282.title: Prohibiting the sale of candy or fruit-flavored cigarettes in this state
282.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the sale of candy or fruit-flavored cigarettes in this state.

283.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
283.title: Requiring employers to provide health insurance to employees working on public improvement projects
283.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that workers on public improvement projects be provided health care insurance as a benefit of employment.

284.title: Prohibiting the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History
284.description: Prohibiting the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History

285.title: Requiring that all houses, dwellings and businesses located in a district where public water service is made available for the first time after July 1, 2008 be connected to the public water service
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all houses, dwellings and businesses located in a district where public water service is made available for the first time after July 1, 2008, be connected to the public water service.

286.title: Providing an exemption from gross income for certain members of volunteer fire departments, for state personal income tax purposes
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow members of volunteer fire departments who have successfully completed required training and who have two years of service to exempt five hundred dollars from their gross income, for state personal income tax purposes.

287.title: Providing that the assignment and transfer of real property for research and development at institutions of higher education for economic development purposes includes housing projects
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the assignment and transfer of real property for research and development at institutions of higher education for economic development purposes includes housing projects.

288.title: Authorizing counties and municipalities to enact ordinances regulating the locations of limited video lottery machines
288.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize counties and  municipalities to enact ordinances regulating the locations of limited video lottery machines and other gambling games and devices including the size, type and location of the building in which the limited video lottery business is located notwithstanding the authority of the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner.

289.title: Relating to liability of physicians who render services to youth camps and programs
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the liability of medical and osteopathic physicians and those that may work under their supervision or direction, as volunteers to provide medical care at a youth camp or program.

290.title: Salary increase for sanitarian employees of the division of health
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a 25% across-the-board salary increase for sanitarian employees of the Division of Health to bring their salaries into parity with county sanitarian employee salaries, and to additionally provide for an annual cost-of-living salary increase.

291.title: Prohibiting any person convicted of any felony from voting in an election of state and local officials
291.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit any person convicted of any felony from voting in a state election.

292.title: Increasing the criminal fines for conviction of the crime of making a false bomb threat and providing that a minor accused of making a false bomb threat shall be tried as an adult
292.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the criminal fines for conviction of the crime of making a false bomb threat and to provide that a minor accused of making a false bomb threat shall be tried as an adult.

293.title: Creating a presumption of compensability for cardiovascular injury or disease or pulmonary disease suffered by a professional  firefighter
293.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a presumption of compensability for cardiovascular injury or disease of professional firefighters employed by municipal fire departments.

294.title: Creating an affirmative defense for certain civil and criminal actions arising from the sale of certain alcoholic drinks and nonintoxicating beer by licensed private clubs to persons under the age of twenty-one
294.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a defense to licensees civilly or criminally charged with selling alcoholic liquors, nonintoxicating beer or wine to minors when the licensees have responsibly used scanner technology to verify age.

295.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
295.title: Establishing a volunteer litter reporting program
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a volunteer litter reporting program.

296.title: Reducing state income tax for state correctional officer retirees
296.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the State Income Tax for State Correctional Retirees by exempting state correctional officers' retirement income from the federal adjusted gross income for calculating adjusted gross income for state income tax purposes.

297.title: Authorizing the commissioner of department of highways to set certain speed limits
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles to set lower speed limits in certain circumstances.

298.title: Changing the definition of "substantial change in circumstances" for the purposes of a modification of child support from a 15% change to either a 15% or seventy-five dollar change, whichever is less
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of "substantial change in circumstances" for the purposes of a modification of child support from a 15% change to either a 15% or seventy-five dollar change, whichever is less.

299.title: Making it a felony offense for stealing lottery tickets
299.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a felony to steal lottery tickets.  In addition, the bill makes it a felony offense to steal anything of value from the Lottery Commission or to profit from cheating a video lottery machine at a racetrack.

300.title: Requiring voter approval prior to closure and consolidation of certain schools
300.description: The purpose of this bill is to require voter approval prior to closure and consolidation of certain schools with grades eight or below when new building construction or addition of two or more classrooms are involved and the closure or consolidation was not included in a local bond issue approved by the voters.

301.title: Increasing penalties for financial exploitation of an elderly person or incapacitated adult
301.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for the financial exploitation of elderly persons and incapacitated adults.

302.title: Granting the public land corporation the authority to condemn certain abandoned structures in the waters of the State causing or contributing to flooding or erosion
302.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Public Land Corporation to condemn abandoned structures located in waterways that it finds inhibits water flow and exacerbates flooding or stream-bank erosion and to grant the Corporation enforcement authority.

303.title: Requiring manufactured housing, fuel oil and propane tanks and other items to be properly secured when in flood plain
303.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect the health, safety and welfare of the citizens of this state by reducing the opportunity for unsecured or improperly secured buildings, manufactured housing, propane and fuel oil tanks to impede water flow during and after a flood.

304.title: Relating to flood plain management and flood debris generally
304.description: The purpose of this bill is enact measures to assist local and state authorities in flood plain management and flood clean up.

305.title: Including education related child care expenses in the child support calculation, and eliminating the 25% reduction to the child support adjustment
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to include education related child care expenses in the child support calculation; and eliminate the 25% reduction to the child support adjustment.

306.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
306.title: Ensuring Patient Safety Act
306.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure patient safety by establishing minimum direct-care registered nurse to patient ratios.  It provides for creating an "acuity-based patient classification system" and requires annual nurse staffing plans and certifications and daily posting of nurse staffing plans, consistent with the minimum standards.  It requires an annual audit to be submitted to the Bureau for Public Health and prohibits mandatory overtime or on-call policies except in cases of declared emergency.  It prohibits assignment of unlicensed persons to perform registered nurse functions, requires a full-time registered nurse executive leader and provides for quality assurance.  It also requires appropriate orientation and competence in clinical area of assignments, with documentation to be maintained in personnel files.  Finally, it provides for violations, penalties and posting notices of violations.

307.title: Allowing the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a "School Choice Zone"
307.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a School Choice Zone which would enable students residing in the designated area to attend school in a neighboring county if they wish.

308.title: Providing meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments
308.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide meetings and conference rights for members of municipal fire departments. The bill also creates duties for the firefighters' Civil Service Commissions.

309.title: Defining "fill material" in the Water Pollution Control Act
309.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "fill material" under the provisions of the Water Pollution Control Act.

310.title: Relating to motor vehicle inspections and eliminating the headlight adjustment provisions of the inspection fee
310.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the free headlight adjustment provisions of the inspection fee.

311.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
311.title: Requiring contractors awarded state public works construction projects to meet time restrictions for the completion of a public works construction project
311.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that each state public works contract include a provision requiring a definitive completion date and that contractors awarded such contracts be required to meet the time restriction.  The bill also defines "public works construction contract" and provides a monetary penalty for failure to complete a public works construction project on the agreed-upon completion date.  It also provides exceptions in which extensions may be granted while providing limitations upon an increase in the contract price or extension of time to complete a project in the event of change orders.  Finally, it directs the Secretary of the Department of Administration to propose legislative rules designed to implement the law.

312.title: Exempting from the sales and use tax special equipment installed in a motor vehicle for the use of a person with physical disabilities
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the sales and use tax special equipment installed in a motor vehicle for the use of a person with physical disabilities and to exclude the value of the equipment when determining the value of the vehicle for imposition of the tax on the privilege of effecting the certification of the title of the vehicle.

313.title: Enabling a consumer to direct a consumer reporting agency to place a "security freeze" on his or her credit report
313.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable a consumer to protect his or her credit against identity theft by permitting a consumer to put a credit freeze on his or her credit report, prohibiting access to and dissemination of information in a consumer's credit report without his or her express consent.

314.title: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System and the Teachers Retirement System; and providing a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years.

315.title: Authorizing the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue an identification card to West Virginia residents who already possess a valid driver's license
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue an identification card to West Virginia residents who already possess a valid driver's license.  The bill also makes technical changes to the section.

316.title: Creating a registry containing names of employees from any agency under the authority of the department of health and human resources who have committed acts of abuse, neglect or misappropriation of property
316.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a registry containing names of employees from any agency or organization under the authority of the Department of Health and Human Resources who have committed acts of abuse, neglect or misappropriation of property against any person under the care, custody or control of the agency or organization.  In conjunction with the creation of the registry, the bill also contains provisions addressing the following:  (1) Providing definitions of certain terms; (2) requiring that each organization and agency under the authority of the department maintain individual employee forms for recording personal information as well as information related to allegations of abuse, neglect or misappropriation of property; (3) addressing how complaints are handled and investigated; (4) providing for appeal by persons determined to have committed any act of misconduct under the provisions of this article; (5) requiring employment screening of applicants for employment; (6) setting forth the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Resources' duties under the article; (7) prohibiting the employment of persons whose names are contained on the registry; (8) setting forth the standard of proof to be applied in contested matters involving allegations of misconduct; (9) providing that, pending final outcome of contested matters involving allegations of misconduct, records are not accessible to the public; (10) providing that information contained on the registry is public information; (11) providing a mechanism for removal of names from the registry for good cause; (12) requiring the secretary to propose legislative rules for rehabilitation and behavior modification of persons whose names are included on the registry; and (13) requiring mandatory reporting by employees and others of instances of abuse, neglect or misconduct they witness subject to the provisions of this article.

317.title: Relating to the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support
317.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude certain employment-related expenses from the definition of gross income for purposes of determining child support.

318.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
318.title: Establishing in the state treasury a targeted minority economic development fund to address economic issues of minorities and minority communities
318.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish in the State Treasury a targeted minority economic development fund to address economic issues of minorities and minority communities.

319.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
319.title: Providing a mechanism whereby unused, unexpired nonnarcotic drugs previously owned by a deceased nursing home patient or resident may be donated to free health care clinics in the state
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism whereby unused, unexpired nonnarcotic drugs previously owned by a deceased nursing home patient or resident may be donated to free health care clinics in the state, provided that the family of the deceased patient or resident has given consent for the donation.

320.title: Making the offense of failure to wear safety belts a primary offense
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the offense of failure to wear a safety belt to a primary offense.

321.title: Waiving the requirement that a training course in handling and firing handguns must be completed prior to the issuance of a concealed weapons permit for veterans who served during a period of armed conflict
321.description: The purpose of this bill is to waive the requirement that a training course in handling and firing handguns must be completed prior to the issuance of a concealed weapons permit for veterans who served during a period of armed conflict.

322.title: Providing that the Board of Banking and Financial Institutions have the authority to approve acquisitions of out-of-state banks by WV state banks
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the Board of Banking and Financial Institutions with the authority to consider applications by West Virginia state banks and bank holding companies to acquire out-of-state banks.

323.title: Expanding the membership of the Racing Commission and reorganizing the administrative functions
323.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the membership of the Racing Commission from three to five members and reorganizes the administrative functions of the West Virginia Racing Commission by establishing a State Racing Office and creating the position of  Director of Racing.  The Director of Racing will be a gubernatorial appointee and will be responsible for the daily management of the authorities and responsibilities of the West Virginia Racing Commission.

324.title: Establishing county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers
324.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish county and municipal authorities to provide for and maintain facilities to house Child Advocacy Centers.  Under the bill, a Child Advocacy Center is a safe place for multidisciplinary members to interview abused and neglected children at the same time.

325.title: Providing a tax credit to landlords who rent to parolees
325.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a tax credit to landlords who rent residential property to parolees.

326.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
326.title: Excluding disability income received from a veteran for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude disability income received by a veteran from the U.S. Department of Veterans' Affairs for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support.

327.title: Creating the institute for increased postsecondary education participation
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the institute for increased postsecondary education participation.

328.title: Providing a two-tiered personal income tax credit for parents who provide home schooling
328.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a two-tiered personal income tax credit to parents or legal guardians who provide home or private, primary or secondary education for their children.  The tax credit will be effective upon the completion of a school year and available at a rate per child of $500 for home schooling and $1,000 for private schooling.

329.title: Increasing the homestead exemption for low-income taxpayers
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the homestead exemption for low-income taxpayers who qualify for the homestead exemption for ad valorem property taxation purposes by ten thousand dollars.

330.title: Eliminating the severance tax and the health care provider tax on behavior health providers
330.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the severance tax and health care provider tax on behavior health providers.

331.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
331.title: Requiring nursing homes to publicly post staffing information and granting rights to family councils
331.description: The purpose of this bill is to require nursing homes to publicly post staffing information and to, additionally, grant certain rights to family councils.  It requires nursing homes to post, each shift, the names of licensed and unlicensed staff with direct care responsibilities. It establishes the type of information to be provided and the manner in which it must be posted.  The bill grants privacy and organizational rights to family councils and requires nursing homes to respond to a council's concerns and questions regarding facility administrative decisions which affect the lives of residents in the facility.  The bill also sets forth resident?s rights violations while including civil penalties for noncompliance.

332.title: Castle Doctrine Act, authorizing the use of force, including deadly force, against an intruder or attacker
332.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of force, including deadly force, against an intruder or attacker in a dwelling, residence, or vehicle under certain circumstances.

333.title: Relating to the delivery of controlled substances on or in an educational facility
333.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the delivery or distribution of illegal drugs to students in and around the schools of the state, which includes drugs that are not listed as a controlled substance as defined in Article 2 of Chapter 60A of the West Virginia Code.  Also this bill establishes the offense of delivery of drugs as a criminal offense when taking place on or near a school.

334.title: Allowing a political candidate to place campaign signs within highway rights-of-way
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a political candidate to place temporary campaign signs within highway rights- of-way in a candidate's political district.

335.title: Imposing certain conditions of probation of sex offenders convicted of failing to register
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose certain conditions of probation of sex offenders convicted of failing to register.

336.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
336.title: Requiring the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to ensure that stocking trout are evenly distributed
336.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the director of the Division of Natural Resources to ensure that stocking trout are evenly distributed throughout the state.

337.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
337.title: Prohibiting the establishment of methadone treatment programs and clinics except those operated by comprehensive community mental health centers
337.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the Commissioner of Health shall prohibit the establishment of a new methadone treatment program or facility after July 1, 2007, except those established at comprehensive mental health centers.

338.title: Relating to the issuance of driver's licenses and disposition
338.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement to send surrendered driver's licenses back to the original state of licensure, to require applicants for an instruction permit to pay for each attempt to successfully pass the written test, and to  include the organ donor option already in statute in this section as well.

340.title: Allowing municipal police and fire pension plans to use the actuarial examination by the State in lieu of obtaining its own actuary
340.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that where the state actuary has examined a Municipal Pension and Relief Fund for a particular year that fund may opt to use that actuarial valuation in place of any other actuarial valuation mandated by state law.

341.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
341.title: Requiring notice of an abortion to be provided to the father of the unborn child
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that a woman contemplating an abortion provide the name of the father to the physician, clinic or medical facility performing the abortion and to require the physician, clinic or medical facility to notify the father of the proposed abortion.

342.title: Adjusting foundation allowance for transportation for projected fuel costs
342.description: The purpose of this bill is to adjust the foundation allowance for transportation for projected fuel costs; to provide a method for adjustments; to simplify language; to clarify conflicting provisions; and to remove obsolete provisions.

343.title: Dedicating a portion of the receipts from the tax on food products to be distributed equally to each district of the Division of Highways
343.description: The purpose of this bill is to dedicate a portion of the receipts from the tax on food products to be distributed equally to each district of the Division of Highways for the maintenance of secondary roads.

344.title: Relating to reports of inspections of schools by local boards of health
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that inspections of primary and secondary schools by local boards of health may be reported to the principal of the school, the county superintendent and the president of the county school board, or to persons of like responsibility in the case of a private, parochial, church or other school operated by a religious order.  The bill also authorizes the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health to promulgate and establish standards for these inspections.

345.title: Permitting magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit magistrates to carry concealed handguns without a permit.

346.title: Providing State Treasury Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association
346.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide State Treasury, Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs' Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association, to be used for both associations' administration and training expenses, and to exempt both associations from eligibility and spending requirements under º8-15-8a and º8-15-8b.

347.title: Establishing a procedure whereby a consumer may implement a security freeze to prohibit a consumer reporting agency from releasing all or any part of the consumer's credit report
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure whereby a consumer may implement a security freeze to prohibit a consumer reporting agency from releasing all or any part of the consumer's credit report or any information derived from it without the express authorization of the consumer; to provide for protection for consumer credit header information; to provide for the right to file a police report in the event of security theft; to require a notice to consumers of a breach of information systems; to provide for a judicial declaration of factual innocence for victims of identity theft; and to provide for protection of social security numbers. Civil penalties are provided for violations.

348.title: Reforming the school aid formula by reducing the amount of regular levy deducted from county boards of education
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to reform the school aid formula by reducing from ninety-eight percent to seventy percent the amount of the regular levy deducted from county boards of education for general current expense purposes; by ensuring that improved instructional programs receive at least $33 million annually; by providing at least $5 million to the State Board of Education to assist low-performing schools; by capturing moneys from declining enrollment and direct it to salaries of classroom teachers and service personnel; and by requiring at least an $8 milion annual appropriation for alternative education programs.

349.title: Relating to electronic requisition format approved by the Auditor
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the Auditor approve the electronic requisition format and it provides that the Auditor may set standards for archiving electronic and paper documents related to requisitions.

350.title: Providing that fire officers may use adjacent property to prevent fire from spreading
350.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that fire officers may use adjacent  property to prevent fire from spreading.  Additionally, the bill makes a minor stylistic change.

351.title: Prohibiting parents, guardians or custodians from allowing registered sexual offenders access to children in their custody
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit parents, guardians or custodians from allowing registered sexual offenders access to children in their custody.  The bill also defines key terms and makes technical changes for purposes of consistency.

352.title: Verifiable Science Act
352.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the public may request and shall receive, access under the state freedom of information act to any purported scientific data used as the basis for proposed legislative rules or statutory enactments.

353.title: Pay incentives for teachers who teach in their core field degree
353.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $2000 pay incentive to teachers who teach in their core field degree.

354.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
354.title: Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act."  The bill exempts certain small businesses from paying business-related taxes if they qualify as start up businesses with limited resources.

355.title: Authorizing public school teachers to purchase one personal computer and related devices per year from the state contract for use outside the classroom
355.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the director of purchasing to promulgate a rule authorizing public school teachers to purchase one personal computer and related devices per year from the state contract for use outside the classroom.

356.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
356.title: Creating the criminal offense of injury to a pregnant woman that results in miscarriage or stillbirth
356.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a new criminal offense based on acts of violence against a pregnant woman that result in a miscarriage or stillbirth of her fetus.

357.title: Reducing the ratio of school nurses to school children
357.description: The purpose of this section is to provide a student-to-school nurse ratio of 1:750 in the school year two thousand seven--two thousand eight and to eliminate contracts between county boards of education and county  health departments for equivalent nursing services.

358.title: Authorizing the use of force, including deadly force, against an attacker or intruder
358.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of force, including deadly force, against an intruder or attacker in a dwelling, residence, or vehicle under certain circumstances and prohibiting cancellation of property insurance for claims made by those facing criminal prosecution under this article.

359.title: Relating to privilege against disclosure of information by news media
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide the news media with limited immunity from disclosure of information obtained in the gathering or dissemination of news.

360.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
360.title: Prohibiting the use of any animal in animal fighting ventures
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of any animal in animal fighting ventures and to expand the application felony criminal penalties to include additional activities carried on for the purpose of supporting animal fighting.  Attending an animal fight remains a misdemeanor.

361.title: Providing veterans' death certificates to families and funeral directors at no cost
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for up to five free certified copies of a veteran's death certificate for a veteran's family members and dependants.

362.title: Equally compensating all state magistrates
362.description: The purpose of this bill is to equally compensate all state magistrates at the higher tier salary schedule.

363.title: Relating to the "Mandated Benefits Review Act"
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to review and report to the Legislature in an actuarially-based fashion the financial and other related impacts of any proposed legislation to mandate medical or health-related benefits.

364.title: Providing county boards of education may study the economic feasibility of exercising an option of engaging in cooperative agreements with local public or regional transit authorities to transport students
364.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that county boards of education may, in cooperation with local public or regional transit authorities study the feasibility of entering into cooperative agreements to transport  students to and from school.

365.title: Requiring all executive agencies to report to the governor, Speaker of the House of Delegates and President of the Senate notices of allowances or potential disallowances of federal funds
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all executive agencies to report to the Governor, Speaker of the House of Delegates and President of the Senate notices of disallowances or potential disallowances of federal funds within sixty days of receipt thereof.

366.title: Providing a five percent personal income tax reduction
366.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that all state income tax taxpayers receive a reduction of five percent across-the-board in their income tax rates.  It includes legislative findings that support these tax rate reductions and call for commensurate reduction on the state budget to accompany any such tax reduction.

367.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
367.title: Requiring that employers perform criminal history background checks for employees working as in-home health care providers
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that employers perform criminal background checks of persons who are to work as in-home health care providers prior to employment and annually thereafter.

368.title: Consolidating purchasing by county boards of education
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide economies of scale and reduce costs by requiring that purchases made by a county board of education be made through the regional education service agency serving that county.

369.title: Requiring that motor vehicle insurance certificate may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage
369.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that motor vehicle insurance certificates may be issued only for the time period for which the insured pays for coverage.

370.title: Allowing the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers' Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)and to specify the cost of the service credit purchased.

371.title: Relating to limitations for certain asbestos exposure claims
371.description: Relating to limitations for certain asbestos exposure claims

372.title: Creating a presumption of compensability for cardiovascular injury or disease of professional firefighters
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a presumption of compensability for cardiovascular injury or disease of professional firefighters employed by municipal fire departments.

373.title: Establishing a returnable beverage container deposit program
373.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a program to recycle beverage containers and reduce litter.  The bill requires the use of returnable containers for many beverages and requires the use of a 10 cent deposit; exempts deposits on containers from sales taxes and excludes deposits from business and occupation taxes; prescribes the powers and duties of DEP; and prescribes penalties and remedies.

374.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
374.title: Regulating the sale, possession and breeding of nonnative species
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a scheme of  regulation for the sale, possession and breeding of nonnative species.  Toward this goal the bill contains provisions which address the following:  (1) Defining certain terms; (2) creating the Nonnative Species Regulation Board; (3) establishing duties; (4) establishing a special revenue account and authorizing expenditures; (5) providing rule-making authority; (6) delineating the jurisdiction of member agencies; (7) providing owner liable for the cost of care of seized nonnative species and bonding requirements; (8) requiring pet shop registration, renewal and fee; (9) requiring pet shop to keep records and provide certain notification; (10) requiring permit to possess or breed nonnative species and providing permit application process and permit requirements; (11) providing for exemptions; (12) requiring identification number on nonnative species; (13) establishing caging, care and treatment requirements; (14) requiring liability insurance; (15) authorizing certain inspections; (16) providing for denial of a permit; (17) specifying conditions under which nonnative species may be seized; and (18) establishing civil and criminal penalties.

375.title: Changing the definition of final average salary to thirty-six consecutive months for calculating retirement
375.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of final average salary to thirty-six consecutive months rather than five consecutive years for calculating retirement.

376.title: Increasing the faculty senate allotment for classroom teachers and librarians
376.description: :  The purpose of this bill is to increase the faculty Senate allotment for classroom teachers and librarians from fifty dollars to one hundred dollars, to be spent on academic materials, supplies or equipment to enhance instruction.

377.title: Deleting the provision that allowed private clubs segregated on the basis of race and color to obtain licenses to sell alcoholic liquors
377.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the provision that allowed private clubs segregated on the basis of race or color to obtain a license to sell alcoholic beverages.

378.title: Providing a loan forgiveness program for nurses
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a loan forgiveness program for nurses similar to what currently exists for medical doctors and osteopathic physicians.

379.title: Exempting undergraduate students attending state colleges or universities for the first two years postgraduation, from the payment of state income tax
379.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt undergraduate students attending state colleges or universities as well as graduates of undergraduate programs of such state institutions for the first two tax years postgraduation, from the payment of state income tax.  The bill also provides that the undergraduate students and undergraduate graduates for the first two years after graduating shall pay seventy-five percent of any state income tax that they otherwise would owe to the particular institution or other qualified lending creditor they owe for student loans.  The Tax Commissioner is directed to propose legislative rules to effectuate the purposes of the bill.

380.title: Providing for the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers where probable cause appears to exist
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers to inquire on commission of a crime where probable cause appears to exist.

381.title: Allowing certain public employees to pay back retirement benefits
381.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow public employees with fifteen or more years' service who were subject to reduction in force layoffs to pay back retirement benefits they cashed out of the public employees retirement system.

382.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
382.title: Prohibiting family planning centers that receive state funding from discussing abortion
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit family planning centers in West Virginia that receive state funding from discussing abortion or abortion referrals.

383.title: Requiring a preliminary breath analysis for the purpose of determining the blood alcohol content of a surviving driver
383.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a preliminary breath analysis for the purpose of determining the blood alcohol content of a surviving driver.

384.title: Prohibiting smoking tobacco products in a motor vehicle when a minor is present
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the smoking of tobacco products in a motor vehicle when a minor is present.

385.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
385.title: Relating to setting in which a dental hygienist may perform their duties without direct supervision
385.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide settings in which a dental hygienist may perform their duties without direct supervision.

386.title: Relating to state purchasing cards
386.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state agency purchases as authorized by the Auditor.  The bill provides that certain rules established by the purchasing division be followed and it changes the qualifications for selecting a charge card vendor.  In addition, the bill allows certain funds to be used by the Auditor for general office expenses and it establishes a new Special Revenue Revolving Fund in the State Treasury to be administered by the Department of Administration.  Under the bill, three new members are added to the purchase card advisory committee.

387.title: Providing for payment of unemployment compensation when a person misses work due to domestic violence
387.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the payment of unemployment compensation when a person misses work due to domestic violence. The bill provides that the employer is not chargeable for benefits paid when the worker is unable to work due to domestic violence but that the benefits are paid from the General Unemployment Compensation Fund provided under §21A-8 et seq.

388.title: Subtracting social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income
388.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

389.title: Providing meeting and conference rights for members of municipal police and fire departments
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide meetings and conference rights for members of municipal police and fire departments.  The bill also creates duties for the policemen and firefighters' civil service commissions.

390.title: Tax credit for employees who provide child day care services for their employees
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to give a tax credit to employers who provide or pay for child day care services for their employees' dependent children.

391.title: Authorizing the state Board of Education to grant waivers to sparsely populated counties for relief from ratio limitations on state funding
391.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the state Board of Education to grant waivers to sparsely populated counties for relief from the ratio limitations on state funding of professional educators.

392.title: Providing for a "moment of silence" in public schools
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a "moment of silence" in the public schools.

393.title: Modifying the West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority's power to charge tolls and issue bonds
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority's power and authority to charge tolls and issue bonds and to transfer duties and responsibilities of the parkways authority to the Division of Highways.

394.title: Providing an election to allow resident homeowners, sixty-five years old or older, to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an election for county commissions to allow resident homeowners, sixty-five years old or older,  to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property during their lifetime.

395.title: Prohibiting adhesion waivers of constitutional rights in contractual provisions with consumers as being unenforceable
395.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit adhesion waivers of constitutional rights in contractual provisions with consumers as being unenforceable.

396.title: Providing a housing supplement for members of the State Police
396.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a housing supplement for members of the State Police.

397.title: Providing a corporate tax credit for qualified health insurance policies
397.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit  of three one-forth percent against the net corporate income tax for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees. The tax credit would increase by one-forth percent yearly until reaching a maximum of six percent.

398.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
398.title: The Economic Fairness Act of 2007
398.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the economic fairness act and encourage economic development in counties with high unemployment.

399.title: Requiring motorcycle operators and passengers under twenty-one years of age wear helmets
399.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that motorcycle operators and passengers 21 years old or older wear helmets, except that all operators licensed less than two years would be required to wear helmets.  The bill also modifies language concerning the motorcycle safety and education committee to correctly reflect it is an eight member board, provided under §17B-1D-8, rather than a six member board, while making minor stylistic changes as well.

400.title: Allowing a public school employee or retiree who missed work as a result of pregnancy to purchase up to one year of service credit in the teachers retirement system
400.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a public school employee or retiree who was forced to miss work as a result of a pregnancy to purchase up to one year of service credit in the teachers retirement system.

401.title: Enabling law-enforcement agencies to use their basic investigative tools to thwart terrorist plots
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to criminalize the commission and furtherance of acts of terrorism and provide penalties for violation; it does not create any new agency, program, or mandate.  Its intent is only to prohibit certain acts, thereby allowing existing law-enforcement agencies to investigate and prosecute such acts under existing rules and laws of procedure.

402.title: Prohibiting the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles from suspending a license of a person for more than six months as a result of a seizure
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles from suspending the license of a person whose license was suspended as a result of a seizure for more than six months.

404.title: Relating to disposition and payment of court costs regarding worthless checks
404.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the practice of imposing court costs upon the person initiating the prosecuting if the payment of the check, draft, or order is accepted by the payee or holder thereof after the filing of a complaint for warrant.

405.title: Authorizing school level implementation of student uniform policies
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage the dissemination of information on public school student uniform policies and successful strategies for implementing them to all public schools in the state so that they may be discussed and considered on a school-by-school basis for optional adoption and implementation.  The further purpose of this section is to establish a policy framework to authorize the adoption and implementation of student uniform policies by public schools in this state, including the minimum criteria that must be included in the authorizing policies adopted by the county boards.

406.title: Requiring all applicants for a license or learner's permit to be sight tested
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all applicants for a license or learner's permit to be sight tested before receiving a license or permit; it requires specific driving restrictions based upon the extent of a driver's sight deficiency with sight correcting devices and authorizing use of bioptic telescopic devices.

407.title: Setting standards for assignment of high school athletic directors
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to set standards for school athletic directors. The bill also requires a high school to assign a full-time athletic director if the school has thirteen or more varsity sports, and at least a half-time athletic director if the school has twelve or less varsity sports.

408.title: Including sexual orientation and disability as a bias-based crime civil rights violation for purposes of criminal responsibility
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to include sexual orientation and disability as a bias-based crime civil rights violation for purposes of criminal responsibility; and further removes unnecessary conspiracy provisions; and clarifies that the provisions of this section are not intended to limit free speech or religious expression.

409.title: Providing for removal and election of Public Service Commissioners
409.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the election of Public Service Commissioners.

410.title: Exempting sales of propane gas for any church, religious sect, society or denomination consumption from the imposition of the excise tax on gasoline or special fuel
410.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all gallons of gasoline and propane gas for any church, religious sect, society or denomination or for the use or benefit of any church, religious sect, society or denomination as consumption use from the excise tax on gasoline or special fuel.

411.title: Increasing the salary of public service district board members
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the salary of public service district board members; clarify when salary and expense payments may be made; and add sewer service to the salary schedule for public service districts which contract with others to provide service.

412.title: Providing for the redistricting office of the joint committee on government and finance to propose redistricting plans during census years
412.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the redistricting office of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance to propose redistricting plans  during census years. The main task of the redistricting office is to propose a plan to the Legislature which is based on constitutional and legal requirements and considerations.

413.title: Relating to factors to be considered in granting grandparent visitation
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the grandparent visitation statute to include additional factors for consideration including the child's relationship with the parent contesting grandparent visitation; any history of abuse by the parent, any criminal activity or history on the part of the parent and the amount of time the child spent with the grandparents prior to the absence of contact.

414.title: Establishing requirements for college readiness and work readiness credentials that certify to colleges and employers that a student has demonstrated the proficiencies needed to be successful
