610.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the registration of  motorcycles for twenty-four months.

611.title: Including certain credit unions and their employees in the definitions of "employer" and "employee" for purposes of the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Agency
611.description: The purpose of this bill is to include certain credit unions and their employees in the definitions of "employer" and "employee" for purposes of the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance Agency.

612.title: Relating to prohibiting legislators from enrolling in the state retirement system
612.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit legislators from enrolling in the State Retirement System while providing legislators may elect to direct contributions deducted for retirement pensions into self-directed 401(K) pension plans.

613.title: Extending the provisions of the higher education flexibility act
613.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the provisions of the higher education flexibility act to institutions of higher education that offer graduate degrees and are not or are no longer administratively linked to another institution of higher education.

614.title: Creating a Sentencing Commission
614.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a Sentencing Commission and setting forth its membership, responsibilities, powers and duties.  The bill also requires that the commission evaluate the state's sentencing and correctional laws and policies and make recommendations to the Governor and the Legislature.

615.title: Providing discounted motor registration fees for members of volunteer fire departments
615.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a discounted motor vehicle registration fee to members of volunteer fire departments.  Members would receive two years' motor vehicle registration upon payment of a one-year registration fee.

616.title: Relating to the agreement among states to elect the president by national popular vote
616.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.  Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all fifty states and the District of Columbia.  The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

617.title: Requiring assisted living residences to maintain adequate auxiliary power sources to generate electricity
617.description: The purpose of this bill is to require assisted living residences to maintain adequate auxiliary power sources to generate electricity in the event of an extended power outage.

618.title: Instituting a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and requiring the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other American historical documents
618.description: The purpose of this bill is to institute a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and require the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other founding American historical documents, including the Bill of Rights, during this week.

619.title: Reverting the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents
619.description: The purpose of this bill is to revert the 911 fee on wireless telephones from three dollars to seventy-five cents while reverting the distribution formula for 911 fees to a pro rata share of total fee revenues.

620.title: Requiring any proposed toll revision be presented to the Joint Committee on Government and Finance
620.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Parkways, Economic Development and Tourism Authority to present any proposed toll revision to the Joint Committee on Government and Finance.

621.title: Repealing the Code of West Virginia and adopting in lieu thereof, the Code of the Commonwealth of Virginia
621.description: Repealing the Code of West Virginia and adopting in lieu thereof, the Code of the Commonwealth of Virginia

622.title: Prohibiting elected state officials from becoming lobbyist for two years
622.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit elected state officials from lobbying before two years after their term of office expires.

623.title: Providing for a modification to federal adjusted gross income for expenses incurred by organ donors
623.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a modification to federal adjusted gross income for expenses incurred by organ donors.

624.title: Making English the official language of West Virginia
624.description: The purpose of this bill is to make English the official  state language.

625.title: Requiring the Commissioner of Corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses
625.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the commissioner of corrections to keep track of repeat offenses committed by persons convicted of sexual offenses against children.

626.title: Requiring licensed tattoo artist to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the reading of magnetic resonance imaging
626.description: The purpose of this bill is to require licensed tattoo artists to inform patrons, prior to performing the tattoo procedure, of the potential problems that a tattoo may cause in relation to the clinical reading of magnetic resonance imaging studies, should the medical need for such studies ever arise.

627.title: Relating to the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"
627.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"; to define terms; to prohibit any person from obtaining, selling or receiving a person's telephone record without their consent; and to provide penalties.

628.title: Modifying the provisions regarding the higher education institutions that are eligible for receiving PROMISE scholarship funds
628.description: Modifying the provisions regarding the higher education institutions that are eligible for receiving PROMISE scholarship funds

629.title: Relating to making it unlawful to transfer propane from one holding tank to another
629.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it unlawful to transfer propane gas from one holding tank of two hundred fifty gallons or more to another such holding tank unless the tank has been emptied by usage to less than 5% capacity.

630.title: Including Salem International University as an eligible institution for PROMISE scholarship students
630.description: The purpose of this bill is to include Salem International University as an eligible institution for Promise scholarship students; and deleting the requirement that an eligible institution loses its eligibility status when it changes its status to a private, not for profit institution.

631.title: Providing certain county commissions with authority to regulate the location of businesses selling sexually-oriented materials
631.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a county commission without an established planning commission to regulate the location of businesses selling sexually-oriented material.

632.title: Providing a method in which males may contest allegations or presumptions of biological parentage under certain circumstances
632.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a method in which males may contest allegations or presumptions of biological parentage under certain circumstances.

633.title: Establishing the crimes of human trafficking and involuntary servitude
633.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the crimes of  human trafficking and involuntary servitude and to provide criminal penalties for persons convicted of human trafficking and involuntary servitude offenses.

634.title: Providing funds for the maintenance, repair and preservation of statues on the State Capitol grounds from lottery proceeds
634.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide funds for the maintenance, repair and preservation of statues on the State Capitol grounds from lottery proceeds.

635.title: Extending the alternative-fuel motor vehicle tax credit for ten years and making the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit
635.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the alternative-fuel motor vehicles tax credit for 10 years and to make the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit.

636.title: Including bicycle and pedestrian ways in consideration in the planning and development of state roads
636.description: The purpose of this bill is to include bicycle and pedestrian ways in consideration in the planning and development of state roads.  It provides that bicycle and pedestrian ways shall be established in conjunction with the construction, reconstruction or other changes of any state road, with special emphasis to projects in or within one mile of an urban area.

637.title: Relating to the prevention of predatory lending practices
637.description: The purpose of this bill is to address the causes of the current foreclosure crisis and generally protect consumers from losing their homes as a result of the subprime and other lenders' overreaching practices and contract provisions, the significance of which consumers cannot be expected to understand.

638.title: Requiring the Division of Motor Vehicles to offer an optional vehicle registration plate with the phrase "In God We Trust" inscribed on the plate
638.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Division of Motor Vehicles to offer, at no additional fee, a standard motor vehicle license plate with the phrase "In God We Trust" inscribed on the plate.

639.title: Changing the composition of the West Virginia Board of Dental Examiners
639.description: The purpose of this bill is for changing the composition of the West Virginia Board of Dental Examiners; providing that a dental hygienist connected with a dental college, school or dental department of a university is eligible for appointment to the board; and requiring four years to lapse following the completion of two full terms before a former member may be reappointed to the board.

640.title: Removing the limitation on terms for members on the board of library directors
640.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the limitation on terms for members on the board of library directors.

641.title: Authorizing the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue an special registration plate for Daughters of the American Revolution
641.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue a special registration plate for Daughters of the American Revolution.

642.title: Authorizing a corporation net income tax credit for reducing charges for home heating fuel and propane gas provided to low-income residents
642.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a corporation net income tax credit for reducing charges for home heating fuel and propane gas provided to low-income residents.

643.title: Requiring the Director of the Division of Veterans' Affairs to establish a healthcare database
643.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Director of the Division of Veterans' Affairs of West Virginia to establish a healthcare database for the veterans' hospitals in the state to enable veterans easy access to the facilities.

644.title: Budget Bill, making appropriations of public money out of the treasury in accordance with section fifty-one, article six of the Constitution
644.description: Budget Bill, making appropriations of public money out of the treasury in accordance with section fifty-one, article six of the Constitution

645.title: Authorizing a tax credit for new teachers in critical needs areas
645.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a tax credit for new teachers in critical needs areas.  It requires the State Board of Education to determine standards defining "critical needs areas" in both subject areas and geographic areas.  The tax credit for the first three years of employment in such an area shall equal the teachers' liability for personal income taxes.  If the teacher continues to teach in a critical needs area for another five years, the tax credit is equal to fifty percent of the tax liability.

646.title: Updating meaning of federal adjusted gross income and certain other terms used in West Virginia Personal Income Tax Act
646.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of "federal adjusted gross income" and certain other terms used but not defined in the West Virginia Personal Income Tax Act by bringing them into conformity with their meanings for federal income tax purposes.

647.title: Updating meaning of federal taxable income and certain other terms used in West Virginia Corporation Net Income Tax Act
647.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of "federal taxable income" and certain other terms used but not defined in the West Virginia Corporation Net Income Tax Act by bringing them into conformity with their meaning for federal income tax purposes.

648.title: Renewing the West Virginia Small Business Linked Deposit Program
648.description: The purpose of this bill is to renew the West Virginia Small Business Linked Deposit Program.

649.title: Relating to civil actions filed in the courts of the state
649.description: Relating to civil actions filed in the courts of the state

650.title: Authorizing the disclosure of certain mental health records to the National Instant Criminal Background Check System
650.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the disclosure of certain mental health records to the National Instant Criminal Background Check System.

651.title: Revising mining safety equipment requirements and enhancing penalties for crimes against mining property
651.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement that battery-powered strobe lights be affixed to caches of self-contained self-rescue devices, to expand criminal penalties related to the theft and destruction of certain coal mine equipment and property, and to establish criminal penalties for the illegal entry onto mine property to commit a felony or larceny.

652.title: Relating to compensation and expenses of panel attorneys providing public defender services
652.description: The purpose of the bill is to create the Indigent Defense Commission to assist Public Defender Services with regard to the general policies and procedures of the agency and to provide additional oversight of the costs and administration of the public defender corporations; to require corporations to submit monthly reports on billable and nonbillable time to the agency; to authorize the agency to create additional corporations in a judicial circuit with an active corporation, activate corporations, and require the merger of existing corporations; to establish an order of preference for the appointment of panel attorneys; to modify requirements for funding applications; to modify compensable expenses; and to authorize the executive director to establish guidelines for submission of vouchers and claims.

653.title: Provide for the denial or suspension of a driver's license for any student who withdraws from school or fails to receive passing grades
653.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the denial or suspension of a driver's license for any student who withdraws from school or fails to receive passing grades.

654.title: Relating to the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony
654.description: The purpose of this bill is the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony.

655.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
655.title: Strengthening the protections for whistleblowers of unsafe working conditions in mines
655.description: The purpose of this bill is to further protect whistleblowers for reporting the unsafe working conditions in mines.

656.title: Restricting public access to concealed weapons permit records
656.description: The purpose of this bill is to restrict public access to concealed weapons permit records.  The bill permits inspection of licenses by such persons as guardians of the licensee, executor or administrator, if licensee is deceased, attorney or other agent of licensee and law-enforcement agencies.

657.title: Transferring administration of the donated food program from the Department of Agriculture to the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety
657.description: Transferring administration of the donated food program from the Department of Agriculture to the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety

658.title: Authorizing counties and municipalities to enter into contracts for energy-savings
658.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize counties and municipalities to enter into contracts for energy-saving contracts.  Current law only allows the state and its agencies to do this.

659.title: Granting public employees credit toward their West Virginia public employee retirement benefits for service in the Peace Corps
659.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant Peace Corps members credited service toward the West Virginia public employees retirement benefits, even if they are not public employees at the time of their service.

660.title: Requiring that workplace fatalities be reported to the Division of Labor
660.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that workplace fatalities be reported to the Division of Labor.

661.title: Agreement among the states to elect the president by national popular vote
661.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.  Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all fifty states and the District of Columbia.  The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

662.title: Relating to payment of wages through a direct deposit system
662.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the payment of wages made through a direct deposit system utilizing an automated teller machine card or other means of electronic transfer.

663.title: Providing for a legislative rule requiring repayment of a PROMISE scholarship award under certain circumstances
663.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a legislative rule requiring repayment, in whole or in part, of a PROMISE scholarship award if the recipient chooses to work outside of West Virginia following graduation.

664.title: Allow public employees to acquire a lump sum payment for unused annual leave days in excess of those that can be carried over from year-to-year
664.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow public employees to acquire a lump sum payment for unused annual leave days in excess of those that can be carried over from year-to-year.

665.title: Exempting social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax for taxpayers whose federal adjusted gross income is less than fifty thousand dollars
665.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax for taxpayers whose federal adjusted gross income is less than $50,000.

666.title: Granting the board of Respiratory Care Practitioners rulemaking authority and the issuance of temporary permits to students
666.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the board of Respiratory Care Practitioners rulemaking authority and the issuance of temporary permits to students.

667.title: Reducing state income tax liability for certain retired public employees
667.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for certain county, state and federal retirees by increasing the amount excluded from their retirement income in calculating the federal gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

668.title: Allowing the Division of Labor to promulgate Rules to license elevator workers
668.description: Allowing the Division of Labor to promulgate Rules to license elevator workers

669.title: Giving abutting landowners of public lands a right of first refusal to lease or buy public lands
669.description: The purpose of this bill is to give abutting landowners of state property a right of first refusal to lease or buy public lands.

670.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
670.title: Nontraditional Career Development Centers Act
670.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Superintendent of Schools to enter into contracts with public and nonprofit private entities to support Nontraditional Career Development Centers in assisting displaced homemakers or single parents in receiving job counseling, job training, job placement services and other support services leading to high-skill, high-wage jobs.

671.title: Relating to the regulation and treatment of the production of natural gas and coalbed methane
671.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the taxation of natural gas and coalbed methane equal and uniform, to dedicate certain amounts of tax revenue to the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund, and to grandfather certain entitlements to the exemption previously applicable to coalbed methane production.

672.title: Joint Parenting Act
672.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact a Joint Parenting Act.  The bill would establish a rebuttable presumption of joint legal and physical custody of their children in child custody matters.  It outlines procedures and criteria to be used when determining the custody of children.  It also provides procedures addressing relocation of parents after divorce.

673.title: Making technical and other changes to the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System
673.description: The purpose of this bill is to make technical and other changes to the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System; to provide for the correction of errors; to permit rollovers of any dollar amount; to provide for an onset date for disability retirement benefits; to provide for the termination of disability retirement benefits of a retirant who refuses to submit to a medical examination or provide a certification statement by his or her physician of continued disability; to remove option to purchase declining term insurance for members with loans; to provide procedure for subsequent loans; to clarify the eligibility requirements of certain sheriffs; and, to permit the collection of fees for late payment from employers.

674.title: Relating to the disqualification for public retirement benefits
674.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the termination of retirement benefits in any and all plans of a member who renders less than honorable service, to add the definition of "former participant", and to provide for the retention of employer contributions in the plan of members of the Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System whose benefits have been terminated for less than honorable service.

675.title: Clarifying that all retirement systems administered by the Consolidated Public Retirement Board are included for employer pick-up provisions for federal tax purposes
675.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that all retirement systems administered by the Consolidated Public Retirement Board are included for employer pick-up provisions for federal tax purposes.

676.title: Relating to limitations for certain asbestos claims
676.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit certain asbestos claims, provide for the fair and efficient judicial consideration of personal injury and wrongful death claims arising out of asbestos or silica exposure, to ensure that individuals who suffer impairment, now or in the future, from illnesses caused by exposure to asbestos or silica, receive compensation for their injuries, and for other purposes.

677.title: Prohibiting the use of cell phone and text-messaging devices while operating a motor vehicle except when using a hands-free device or in the case of an emergency
677.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of cell phone and text-messaging devices while operating a motor vehicle except when using a hands-free device or in the case of an emergency.  This bill also prohibits the use of a cell phone by a school bus driver other than in limited circumstances such as an emergency.

678.title: Providing that all employees have the right to review and copy the contents of their personnel file
678.description: The purpose of this bill is to give all employees the right to review and copy their respective personnel files.

679.title: Asbestos Claims Transparency Act
679.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure that requires a claimant that files an asbestos case after the effective date of this bill to provide information to all defendants about all claims filed or anticipated to be filed by that claimant against asbestos bankruptcy trusts, a mechanism for the defendant to challenge those claims, a procedure for sanctions by the court, and for set-offs for those claims.

680.title: West Virginia Public Campaign Financing Act
680.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a system for public funding of election campaigns for candidates for the State Senate and House of Delegates who agree to and do abide by restrictions on campaign contributions from private sources and limits on campaign spending.

681.title: Providing that only healthy beverages and healthy or nutritional snacks may be sold in the county school system
681.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that only healthy beverages and healthy or nutritional snacks may be sold in the county school system.

682.title: Uniform Maternal Screening Act
682.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish an advisory council on maternal risk assessment within the Office of Maternal, Child and Family Health and to grant legislative rule-making authority to the Bureau for Public Health to develop a uniform maternal risk screening tool to serve as an alert to medical care providers of the need for greater evaluation and assessment of high-risk pregnancies.

683.title: Protecting computer owners and users from computer spyware
683.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect consumers from unsolicited and perhaps fraudulent offers from unsolicited pop-up electronic mail.

684.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
684.title: West Virginia Taxpayer and Citizen Protection Act of 2008
684.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate illegal immigration in West Virginia.

685.title: Authorizing an additional salary bonus for certain classroom teachers
685.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a recruitment bonus for new math, science and special education teachers, or teachers filling positions that have remained vacant for one year or more.

686.title: Requiring county board establishment of an additional supplemental salary schedule for classroom teachers in certain circumstances
686.description: Requiring county board establishment of an additional supplemental salary schedule for classroom teachers in certain circumstances

687.title: Joint Emergency Services Act of 2008
687.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to create a joint emergency service agency in lieu of an emergency ambulance service authority, county fire association or county fire board.

688.title: Requiring group insurance companies and third party administrators to furnish claims experience to policyholders
688.description: The purpose of this bill is to require group insurance companies to furnish claims experience to policyholders.

689.title: Relating to medical qualifications for school bus operators
689.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that persons who are currently or have previously been employed as a school bus operator may not be rendered ineligible for such employment  as a result of having diabetes mellitus requiring insulin, if other requirements are met.

690.title: Extending the deadline for submission of the written plan for participation in the pilot program for increased powers for municipal self government
690.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the deadline for  submission of the written plan for participation in the pilot program for increased powers for municipal self government.

691.title: Senior Citizen Property Tax Payment Deferment Act
691.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the deferment of property tax increases for property owned, used and occupied by senior citizens.

692.title: Relating to certification of professional educators
692.description: The purpose of this bill is for certification of professional educators; authorizing holders of K-8 certificates to teach departmentalized courses for which certified; authorizing alternative education programs for certified teachers to obtain additional endorsement; providing for state board rule; report on proposed rule to Legislative Oversight Commission on Education Accountability prior to implementation.

694.title: Limiting the tax assessment on antique motor vehicles
694.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the tax assessment on antique motor vehicles to the lower of its true value or $500.

695.title: Relating to funeral and cremation expenses for indigent persons
695.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize cremation of indigent persons by funeral directors and the payment of this service by the Department of Health and Human Resources.

696.title: Green Buildings Act
696.description: The purpose of this bill is for the adoption of green building standards for the construction or renovation of public buildings over five thousand square feet in size.

697.title: Establishing criminal penalties of not less than two years nor more than ten years for the manufacture, delivery or possession of methamphetamine precursors
697.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish criminal penalties of not less than two years nor more than ten years for the manufacture, delivery or possession of methamphetamine precursors.

698.title: Expanding the powers of the magistrate to prosecute for worthless checks beyond the strict limitations of NSF
698.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the powers of the magistrate to prosecute for worthless checks beyond the strict limitations of NSF.

699.title: Requiring vision screening for renewal of a driver's license
699.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons applying for renewal of a driver's license to pass a vision screening administered by the Division of Motor Vehicles.

700.title: Changing the closing hours of private clubs to two o'clock a. m.
700.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the closing hours of private clubs from three a.m. or three-thirty to two a.m. every day.

701.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
701.title: Creating a Maternal Mortality Review Team
701.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a Maternal Mortality Review Team and to establish its members and responsibilities.

702.title: Clarifying that the Board of Registration for Professional Engineers is subject to a regulatory board review
702.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the Board of Registration for Professional Engineers is subject to a regulatory board review.

703.title: Clarifying that the Board of Examinations in Counseling is subject to a regulatory board review
703.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the West Virginia Board of Examinations in Counseling is subject to a regulatory board review.

704.title: Creating an Office for Oral Health under the Bureau for Public Health and authorizing a full time director
704.description: The purpose of the bill is to create an Office for Oral Health under the Bureau for Public Health and to authorize a full time director.

705.title: Providing for a video recording device monitoring system during Amber Alert periods
705.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a video recording device monitoring system during Amber Alert periods.

706.title: Relating to the compensation and expenses of legislators
706.description: The purpose of this bill goes to the compensation and expenses of legislators; increasing the basic compensation and expense reimbursement for members of the Senate; providing a schedule of payment for compensation; increasing the additional compensation of presiding officers, majority and minority leaders and specified committee chairs, as well as certain other members to be designated by the presiding officers; increasing from four to six the number of other members that may be designated by the presiding officers to receive extra compensation and corresponding reimbursement of expenses; removing certain limits on the number of days for which extra compensation and expenses may be paid; and removing the requirement that to be compensated for additional days that the legislative business for which the member is to be compensated be performed in the Capitol.

707.title: Authorizing municipalities to provide administrative procedures for the assessment and collection of delinquent municipal fees
707.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize municipalities to provide administrative procedures for the assessment and collection of delinquent municipal fees, with the right to appeal to circuit court.

708.title: Relating to the termination of the Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park Commission
708.description: The purpose of this bill is to terminate the  Blennerhassett Island Historical State Park Commission.  The termination is exempt from the wind down provisions of §4-10-12.  The powers of the commission are transferred to the Division of Natural Resources.

709.title: Relating to Professional Employer Organizations
709.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate Professional Employer Organizations, and to require a study as to their impact on the health insurance market.

710.title: Relating to funds held for charitable purposes by nonprofit, charitable institutions
710.description: This bill repeals the Uniform Management of Institutional Funds Act (UMIFA) and replaces it with the Uniform Prudent Management of Institutional Funds Act (UPMIFA).  UPMIFA is an update of the UMIFA which dates back to 1972.  UPMIFA applies to funds held for charitable purposes by nonprofit, charitable institutions.  The three principal issues addressed are scope of coverage, investment obligations and expenditure of funds.

711.title: Relating to the State Teachers' Retirement System
711.description: The purpose of this bill is to make minor technical changes by changing the term "secretary" to "director"; adding a definition of "employer error"; to clarify definition of "member"; to clarify when membership ceases in the State Teachers' Retirement System; to provide for the correction of errors; to permit rollovers of any dollar amount; and, to permit subsequent loans to members sixty days after full payment of previous loan.

712.title: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System
712.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify which contributions can be transferred from the State Police Death, Disability and Retirement Fund ; to make minor technical changes by changing the term "employee" to "member"; and, to permit rollovers of any dollar amount from the Public Employees Retirement System.

713.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
713.title: Phasing in requirements for electric providers to add renewable energy systems to help protect and sustain the environment
713.description: The purpose of this bill is to phase in requirements for electric providers to add renewable energy systems to help protect and sustain the environment.

714.title: Protection of consumers from toxins in toys
714.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect the public from toxins in toys.

715.title: Relating to regulatory review of the West Virginia Acupuncture Board
715.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the West Virginia Acupuncture Board is subject to a regulatory board review.

716.title: Vesting power in the Legislature to regulate smoking in fraternal organizations and private clubs
716.description: The purpose of this bill is to vest power in the Legislature to regulate smoking in fraternal organizations and private clubs; and for the removal of fraternal organizations and private clubs from the smoking bans enacted by local health departments.

717.title: Creating the West Virginia Military Family Relief Fund
717.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Military Family Relief Fund and a personal income tax refund checkoff program to solicit contributions to the fund.

718.title: Allowing farm equipment dealers to calculate their inventory based on an average of their yearly sales
718.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow farm equipment dealers to calculate their inventory based on an average of their yearly sales.

719.title: Redistricting of the House of Delegates into one hundred single member districts
719.description: The purpose of this bill is to create one hundred single member districts after the two thousand ten census.

720.title: Clarifying the fiscal responsibility and authority of county commissions over their budgets and salaries
720.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the fiscal responsibility and authority of county commissions over their budgets and expenditures, particularly in regard to salaries of department heads and elected county officials.

721.title: Relating to insurance coverage for autism
721.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide insurance for the detection and treatment of autism.

722.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
722.title: Changing the requirements for licensure as a forester or forestry technician and giving the Board of Foresters rule-making authority
722.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the requirements for licensure as a forester or forestry technician and give the Board of Foresters rule-making authority.

723.title: Special Aircraft Property Valuation Act
723.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a methodology for the valuation of all aircraft owned or leased by commercial airlines, charter carriers, private carriers, private companies or private firms, for property tax purposes.

724.title: Relating to reimbursement of compensation paid to certain state employees for job-related training, education or professional development
724.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize state agencies to condition compensation paid to employees for job-related training, education or professional development on continued employment with the state agency.

725.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
725.title: Creating a commission to study the impact of global warming on the State of West Virginia
725.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a commission to study the effects of global warming in West Virginia.

726.title: Creating a "Sudan Divestment Procedure"
726.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a "Sudan Divestment Task Procedure".  It provides the method for how the state funds or trustees of those funds, including pension fund systems or other affected entities of the state shall address certain investments relating to Sudan and divestment.  The bill further provides legislative findings and definitions; identification of scrutinized companies; requires certain other actions by the public funds, including reporting; provides for expiration of provisions of article and enforcement of article; and a severability clause.

727.title: Providing retention salary increases for Division of Corrections and Division of Juvenile Services employees
727.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide retention salary increases for Division of Corrections and the Division of Juvenile Services employees.

728.title: Allowing limited driving privileges when a driver's license is suspended for certain reasons
728.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure by which a person whose driver's license is suspended for certain reasons may obtain a restricted driver's license in order to  drive in the course of the person's employment or occupation, to and from the person's residence, work location, an alcohol or drug education or treatment program as ordered by the court, the court's probation department, a court-ordered community service program, an educational institution at which the person is enrolled as a student or a place of regularly occurring medical treatment for a serious condition for the person or a member of the person's household or immediate family.

729.title: Allowing certain vehicles designated by the Secretary of the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety to use red flashing lights
729.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow vehicles designated by the Secretary of the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety for emergency response by the Division of Corrections, Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority and Division of Juvenile Services to use red flashing lights.

730.title: Repealing outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to the operation of the penitentiary by the Commissioner of Public Institutions
730.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to the operation of the penitentiary by the Commissioner of Public Institutions, the hiring of inmates as domestics and the hiring out of inmates by contract.

731.title: Repealing outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to Huttonsville Correctional Center
731.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to the Huttonsville Correctional Center.

732.title: Relating to child abuse and neglect
732.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit parents, guardians or custodians from allowing sexually violent predators and registered child abusers access to children.  The bill also defines key terms and makes technical changes for purposes of consistency.

733.title: Increasing criminal penalty to commit malicious assault, unlawful assault, battery or assault upon a child protective caseworker or a local adult protective services caseworker employee
733.description: The purpose of this bill creates an increased criminal penalty to commit malicious assault, unlawful assault, battery or assault upon a child protective services caseworker or as a local adult protective services caseworker employee.

734.title: Providing immunity from civil liability for adult protective services workers and child protective services workers
734.description: The purpose of this bill is provide personal immunity from civil liability for adult protective services workers and child protective service workers for acts, errors or omissions that occurred during the course of their official duties.

735.title: Limiting the per diem rate in regional jails
735.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the per diem rate charged for incarceration in regional jails to half the daily rate for partial days of twelve hours or less.

736.title: Allowing the Supreme Court of Appeals to establish a uniform bail schedule
736.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Supreme Court of Appeals to establish a uniform bail schedule which will allow persons charged with crimes to be released by posting a standard bail when a magistrate is not available.

737.title: Repealing outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to Denmar State Hospital
737.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal outdated provisions of the West Virginia Code relating to Denmar State Hospital.

738.title: Allowing county school boards to establish a four-day school week and collect fees for use of school buildings on the fifth day
738.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county school boards to establish a four-day school week and collect fees for use of school buildings on the fifth day from community organizations that provide student support programs.

739.title: Exempting social security benefits from West Virginia personal income
739.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

740.title: Increasing the barrel tax on nonintoxicating beer and allocating fifty percent of the tax to the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund
740.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the barrel tax on nonintoxicating beer and allocate fifty percent of the tax to the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund.

741.title: Providing that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of service
741.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service.

742.title: Notifying communication centers and law-enforcement departments before motor vehicles are repossessed without the knowledge of the debtor
742.description: The purpose of this bill is to notify communication centers and law-enforcement departments before motor vehicles are repossessed without the knowledge of the debtor.

743.title: Prohibiting the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project for a living elected public official
743.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project which receives any operating or construction moneys from state sources or state taxpayers for a living, elected official by any governmental entity.  The bill also provides that any responsible governmental official authorizing the naming of a building, road, structure or project for a living elected official is liable to the governmental entity for any costs incurred by a violation.

744.title: Updating various provisions of the Code relating to the Division of Corrections
744.description: The purpose of this bill is to update various provisions of the Code relating to the Division of Corrections. The bill would:

745.title: Increasing the West Virginia retirement income exemption from taxation on persons age sixty-five years of age or older or surviving spouse of such persons
745.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the exemption on retirement income from taxation on persons age sixty-five years of age or older or a surviving spouse of such persons from $8,000 a year to $15,000 a year.

746.title: Providing low-income workers with a refundable state tax credit based on the federal Earned Income Tax Credits
746.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide low-income workers with a refundable state tax credit based on the federal Earned Income Tax Credits.  Current law provides for a nonrefundable tax credit.

747.title: Expanding eligibility for state minimum salary supplements for classroom teachers achieving certain national certification
747.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand eligibility for state minimum salary supplements for achieving certain national certification.

748.title: Authorizing the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner to enter into cooperative agreements for assistance with law enforcement to investigate and enforce the laws relative to the sale of alcoholic beverages
748.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner to enter into cooperative agreements for assistance with state, county, and municipal police officers and university law enforcement to investigate and enforce the laws relative to the sale of alcoholic beverages.

749.title: Relating to zoning ordinances
749.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow voters to petition to resubmit enacted zoning ordinances for voter approval or rejection two years after their original enactment with voter approval.  This bill would also require voter approval for county commission enacted zoning ordinance amendments, and would lower the voter signature percentage requirements needed for petitions.

750.title: Prohibiting inclusion of specific dollar amounts or figures related to damages in complaints for personal injury or wrongful death actions
750.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit inclusion of specific dollar amounts or figures related to damages in complaints for personal injury or wrongful death actions.

751.title: Authorizing the participation of local governments in a purchasing card program to be administered by the Auditor
751.description: The purpose of this bill is related to authorizing the participation of local governments in a purchasing card program to be administered by the Auditor as chief inspector of public offices.

752.title: Reducing state income tax for state and federal retirees by increasing exemption on retirement income
752.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the federal gross income for state income tax purposes.

753.title: Relating to transfers of teachers
753.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a degree of certainty to education employer/employee relations by defining when classroom teachers are transferred so that school administrators know when to implement the notice provisions set out in this section.  The definition of a transfer for classroom teachers is consistent with the cases decided by hearing examiners for the West Virginia Education and State Employees Grievance Board.

754.title: Adding CPR and First Aid training to the health education curriculum in secondary schools
754.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the addition of CPR and First Aid training to the health education curriculum in secondary schools to further protect the safety of children in our schools.

755.title: Relating to faculty senate funds for classroom teachers and librarians
755.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the faculty senate funds available to classroom teachers and librarians.

756.title: Prohibiting the Commissioner of Culture and History from merging the archives library and the lending library
756.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the Division of Culture and History and the commissioner make specific use of the archives library in the West Virginia Science and Culture Center; prohibiting the sale of food and drink in that building and merging the archives library with the lending library; locating the gift shop in the basement with the museum; and giving the Archives and History Commission oversight and administrative authority over the state historian and archivist.

757.title: Authorizing governing bodies of municipalities and county commissions to transfer early in-person voting ballots to precincts in the manner absentee ballots are delivered
757.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize governing bodies of municipalities and county commissions to transfer early in-person voting ballots to precincts in the manner absentee ballots are delivered, which is one day before the election.

758.title: Critical Needs Firefighters Tax Credits
758.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a tax credit for new firefighters in critical needs areas.  It requires the State Fire Commission to determine standards defining "critical needs areas" in both specializations and geographic areas.

759.title: Revising licensing requirements for professional licensing boards, including authorizing a special volunteer license for health care professionals
759.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a special license for health care professionals who are retired and are donating their expertise in a clinic setting and to provide such persons who render such services with immunity from civil liability.

760.title: Establishing the West Virginia Research Trust Fund
760.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish directed research endowment funds at Marshall University and West Virginia University for the purpose of promoting research, scholarship, and economic development in certain areas of study.  The bill establishes a program whereby eligible private donations are matched by the allocation and distribution of state moneys from the newly established West Virginia Research Trust Fund.

761.title: Authorizing the School Building Authority to issue certain revenue bonds from proceeds of the State Excess Lottery Fund
761.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the School Building Authority to issue revenue bonds by using nineteen million dollars in proceeds from the State Excess Lottery Fund.  This increased bonding capacity will permit the School Building Authority increased capacity to build additional schools and make substantial improvements to existing schools.

762.title: Prohibiting employers from mandating captive meetings with their employees relating to political matters
762.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit employers from mandated captive meetings with their employees on political or religious matters.  The bill provides a prohibition on these meetings and allows employees to recover damages for any adverse actions taken against them for refusal to participate in such meetings.

763.title: Strengthening of vehicle emission standards
763.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Director of the Department of Environmental Protection the authority to promulgate new vehicle emission standards.

764.title: Prohibiting the sale of less than twenty packaged cigarettes
764.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the sale of less than twenty packaged cigarettes.  It requires federally mandated warnings on all cigarettes sold.  And, the bill provides a misdemeanor penalty of a fine of $250.00 for violations.

765.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
765.title: Permitting adult adoptees to obtain uncertified copies of their original birth certificates and providing birth parents with consent preference and medical history forms
765.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a process by which an adult adopted person, the child or children of a deceased adopted person or an adopted person judged incompetent by a court of law, or a legal representative of an adopted person may obtain a copy of that person's original unamended and unaltered birth certificate.  This bill also allows a birth parent to include with the child's original birth certificate a form that indicates whether the parent wishes to be contacted by the child and an updated medical history form.

766.title: Allowing pregnancy leave buy-back by teachers who are currently employed or retired
766.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a public school employee or retiree who was forced to miss work as a result of a pregnancy to purchase up to one year of service credit in the teachers retirement system.

767.title: Clarifying that a municipality and county will be notified by an insurance company when a total loss to a structure occurs
767.description: This bill clarifies that a municipality and county will be notified by an insurance company when a total loss to a structure occurs within that county or municipality.

768.title: Relating to rule making requirments of the Department of Health and Human Services
768.description: The purpose of this bill is require all rules, policies and state plans of the Department of Health and Human Resources relating to public assistance to undergo notice, public comment and public hearing before review by the Legislative Oversight Commission on Health and Human Resources Accountability and submission to the United States government.  The bill authorizes LOCHRA to recommend changes to the Department as well as proposing corrective legislation.

769.title: Relating to licensing persons using bioptic telescopic devices to operate a motor vehicle
769.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the issuance of drivers' licenses to persons using bioptic telescopic lenses.  The bill sets conditions, restrictions and limitations for licensing. The bill further authorizes the Division of Rehabilitation Services to promulgate the criteria for applicant  enrollment in low vision driving courses, and the criteria for establishing low vision driving courses. The bill also makes technical and stylistic changes to the section.

770.title: Increasing the salary of the Secretary of Transportation and the Commissioner of Highways when one person is performing both duties
770.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the salary of the Secretary of Transportation and the Commissioner of Highways when one person is performing both duties.

771.title: Providing that written status reports on civil actions brought against state government agencies are required only as requested by the President of the Senate and Speaker of the House
771.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the number of written status reports on civil actions brought against state government agencies that are required to be provided by the chief officer of the government agency to the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Delegates.  Currently, agencies are required to furnish one report every sixty days in every case pending against a state government agency.  The bill would provide that reports are required only as requested by the President and the Speaker.

772.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
772.title: Reducing the number of individuals who receive duplicate prescriptions from multiple physicians
772.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the number of individuals who receive duplicate prescriptions from multiple physicians and to further identify individuals diverting controlled  substances from their intended use.

773.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
773.title: Prohibiting the use of the body of an unborn baby for certain purposes
773.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of the body of an unborn baby for any medical experimentation or scientific investigation, except as necessary to diagnose a disease or condition suspected to exist in the mother's or fetus's body.  The bill also prescribes criminal penalties for violation of the section.

774.title: Relating to physician assistants and updating language to conform to national changes
774.description: The purpose of this bill is to update language to conform to national changes and to require supervising physicians to be fully licensed without restriction or limitation, to require reporting of failure of any recertification examination and expiration of licensure until passage of the examination, and to raise fees.

775.title: Establishing the West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board and requiring accreditation standards for convention and visitors bureaus
775.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board, establish its duties and responsibilities, and require accreditation standards for convention and visitors bureaus operating in this state.

776.title: Regulating the practice of marriage and family therapy
776.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the practice of marriage and family therapy by establishing the Marriage and Family Therapy Board.

777.title: Relating to the regulation of parking for state office buildings
777.description: The purpose of this bill relates to the regulating of parking for state office buildings in Charleston.

778.title: Relating to investment options in minor settlements proceedings
778.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize that net settlement proceeds held for a minor may be invested in a Smart529 college savings plan.

779.title: Levying a minimum corporation income tax
779.description: The purpose of this bill is to levy a minimum corporation income tax.

780.title: Requiring the purchasing of American-made flags with state funds
780.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the purchase of United States flag or flags of the State of West Virginia by the state, counties or boards of education using public funds only be made from manufacturers in the United States.

781.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
781.title: Exempting all gallons of special fuel and propane gas for home heating consumption use from the excise tax on gas or special fuel
781.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all gallons of special fuel and propane gas for home heating consumption use from the excise tax on gasoline or special fuel.

782.title: Providing cost-of-living benefits to retired teachers funded from the severance tax collections on natural gas
782.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide cost-of-living benefits to retired teachers to be funded from the severance tax collected on natural gas.

783.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
783.title: Relating to trapping of wild animals and extending the time for checking traps
783.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the time from twenty-four to forty-eight hours for checking traps.

784.title: Providing members of the Defined Contribution Retirement System a one-time option to transfer to the State Teachers' Retirement System
784.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide members of the Defined Contribution Retirement System a one-time option to transfer into the State Teachers' Retirement System.

785.title: Giving teachers and service personnel and retired teachers a raise
785.description: The purpose of this bill is to give teachers and service personnel and retired teachers a raise.

786.title: Permitting a governing body of a municipality to place a lien on property in an amount equal to the demolition and removal of a hazardous structure
786.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the governing body of a municipality to place a lien on property in an amount equal to the demolition and removal of a hazardous structure.

787.title: Allowing insurers who have been suspended from writing new policies to continue to service existing policies
787.description: The purpose of this bill is to is to allow insurers who have been suspended from writing new policies in West Virginia to continue to service existing policies and accept premiums on those existing policies.

788.title: Allowing law-enforcement agencies to sell all unclaimed stolen property at auction and use the proceeds
788.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow law-enforcement agencies to sell all unclaimed stolen property at auction and use the proceeds for law-enforcement agency purposes.

789.title: Rescinding state financial assistance from students who receive two or more citations for illegal consumption or possession of alcohol
789.description: The purpose of this bill is to rescind state financial assistance from students who receive two or more citations for an open container violation, DUI, underage consumption, public intoxication or contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

790.title: Eliminating being charged court costs for each individual charge from one single incident in traffic violations or Department of Natural Resources violations
790.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate defendants in traffic violations or Department of Natural Resources violations being charged court costs for each individual charge from one single incident.

791.title: Increasing the Public Service Commission appointees and requiring that there be one appointee from each congressional district and two at-large appointments
791.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the Public Service Commission appointees from 3 to 5; and requiring that there be one appointee from each congressional district and two at-large appointments.

792.title: Relating to leaving children unattended or supervised in motor vehicles
792.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish leaving children unattended or unsupervised in a motor vehicle as a crime; to establish penalties; and to allow law-enforcement officers to take necessary steps to protect children left unattended or unsupervised in a motor vehicle.

793.title: Clarifying that if a county board of education moved the library funding obligation of a "special act library" from the regular tax levy to the excess levy, the library funding obligation under the special act would cease
793.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that if a county board of education moved the library funding obligation of a "special act library" from the regular tax levy to the excess levy, the library funding obligation under the special act would cease in the fiscal year in which the excess levy became effective or would have become effective if it had been passed by the voters.

795.title: Permitting members of volunteer fire departments to participate in the state's public employees insurance plan
795.description: This bill permits qualified volunteer firefighters to be covered by the state's public health insurance plan. The bill also  adds "volunteer firefighter" to the definition of employee and "volunteer fire company" to the definition of employer, and permits the payment of the employer's portion of the costs relating to plan to be paid from funds available to volunteer fire companies.

796.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
796.title: Relating to the unauthorized practice of medicine and surgery or podiatry or as a physician assistant
796.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the fine for health care professionals whose licenses are expired and who practice for less than three months, and to specify as a felony the unauthorized practice of  medicine and surgery or podiatry or as a physician assistant in all other instances and to provide for enhanced criminal penalties where serious bodily injury results from such unauthorized practice.

797.title: Relating to reports of inspections of primary and secondary schools by local boards of health
797.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that inspections of primary and secondary schools by local boards of health may be reported to the principal of the school, the county superintendent and the president of the county school board, or to persons of like responsibility in the case of a private, parochial, church or other school operated by a religious order.  The bill also authorizes the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health to promulgate and establish standards for these inspections.

798.title: Relating to sales of wine
798.description: The purpose of this bill is to address Constitutional and other concerns left open after the passage of SB712 during the 2007 Regular Session.  The bill sets application procedures for and restricts issuance of waivers of statutory raw product production quotas and import limitations for farm wineries; eliminates a restriction on donations to political party campaign funds by wholesalers' representatives and their spouses; licenses "brokers" as a separate class of wholesaler representative; combines sampling and tasting functions in the wine specialty shop license and increases the annual license fee; exempts a winery producing 20,000 gallons of wine or less annually from the liter tax; compresses direct shipper licensing requirements into a single section; limits direct shipping to wineries and farm wineries - suppliers and retailers deleted; requires consumers to pay sales/use tax on direct shipments of wine from wineries that have no minimum physical presence in WV; adopts language regarding disposition of tax income to satisfy the Auditor; and changes provisions relating to brand registration.

799.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
799.title: Administration, leasing space on behalf of state spending units
799.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Leasing Space on Behalf of State Spending Units.

800.title: Agriculture, fee structure for the pesticide control act
800.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Fee Structure for the Pesticide Control Act of 1990.

801.title: Agriculture, inspection of meat and poultry
801.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Inspection of Meat and Poultry.

802.title: Agriculture, frozen desserts and imitation frozen desserts
802.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Frozen Desserts and Imitation Frozen Desserts.

803.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
803.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, general provisions
803.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to General Provisions.

804.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
804.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, Benefit determination and appeal
804.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Benefit Determination and Appeal.

805.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
805.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, teachers' defined contribution system
805.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Teachers' Defined Contribution System.

806.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
806.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, teachers' retirement system
806.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Teachers' Retirement System.

807.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
807.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, refund, reinstatement, retroactive service and loan interest factors
807.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Refund, Reinstatement, Retroactive Service and Loan Interest Factors.

808.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
808.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, deputy sheriff retirement system
808.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System.

809.title: Environmental Protection, department of air quality, to prevent and control air pollution from combustion of refuse
809.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Prevention and Control of Air Pollution from the Combustion of Refuse.

810.title: Environmental Protection, ambient air quality standards for carbon monoxide and ozone
810.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Ambient Air Quality Standards for Carbon Monoxide and Ozone.

811.title: Environmental Protection, ambient air quality for nitrogen dioxide
811.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Ambient Air Quality Standard for Nitrogen Dioxide.

812.title: Environmental Protection, emission standards for hazardous air pollutants
812.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants Pursuant to 40 CFR Part 61.

813.title: Environmental Protection, standards of performance for new stationary sources
813.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Standards of Performance for New Stationary Sources Pursuant to 40 CFR Part 60.

814.title: Environmental Protection, prevent and control emissions from commercial and industrial solid waste
814.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Prevention and Control of Emissions from Commercial and Industrial Solid Waste Incineration Units.

815.title: Environmental Protection, prevent and control emission from hospital/medical infectious waste
815.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Prevention and Control of Emissions from Hospital/Medical/Infectious Waste Incinerators.

816.title: Environmental Protection, prevent and control air pollution from hazardous waste treatment, storage, or disposal facilities
816.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Prevention and Control of Emissions of Air Pollution from Hazardous Waste Treatment, Storage or Disposal Facilities.

817.title: Environmental Protection, emission standards for hazardous air pollutants for source categories
817.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants for Source Categories Pursuant to 40 CFR Part 63.

818.title: Environmental Protection, control of annual nitrogen oxide emissions
818.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Control of Annual Nitrogen Oxide Emissions to Mitigate Interstate Transport of Fine Particulate Matter and Nitrogen Oxides.

819.title: Environmental Protection, control of annual sulfur dioxide emissions
819.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Control of Annual Sulfur Dioxide Emissions to Mitigate Interstate Transport of Fine Particulate Matter and Sulfur Dioxides.

820.title: Environmental Protection, secretary's office, voluntary remediation and redevelopment rule
820.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Voluntary Remediation and Development.

821.title: Environmental Protection, Secretary's office, environmental excellence program rule
821.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Environmental Excellence Program.

822.title: Environmental Protection, hazardous waste management system
822.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Hazardous Waste Management System.

823.title: Environmental Protection, water resources, requirements governing water quality standards
823.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Requirements Governing Water Quality Standards.

824.title: Environmental Protection, water resources, national pollutant discharge elimination system program
824.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Program.

825.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4244
825.title: Highways, traffic and safety rules
825.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Highways to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Traffic and Safety Rules.

826.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4244
826.title: Highways, use of state road rights of way and adjacent areas
826.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Highways to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Use of State Road Rights of Way and Adjacent Areas.

827.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4244
827.title: Highways, transportation of hazardous wastes upon the roads and highways
827.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Highways to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Transportation of Hazardous Wastes upon the Roads and Highways.

828.title: Insurance Commission, licensing and conduct of insurance producers, agencies and solicitors
828.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Licensing and Conduct of Insurance Producers, Agencies and Solicitors.

829.title: Insurance Commission, examiners and examinations
829.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Examiners and Examinations.

830.title: Insurance Commission, mental health parity
830.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Mental Health Parity.

831.title: Massage Therapy Licensure Board, general provisions
831.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Massage Therapy Licensure Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to General Provisions.

832.title: Board of Medicine, continuing education for physicians and podiatrists
832.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Continuing Education for Physicians and Podiatrists.

833.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4244
833.title: Motor Vehicles, disclosure of information from the files of the division of motor vehicles
833.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Disclosure of Information from the Files of the Division.

834.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4255
834.title: Natural Resources, special boating rules
