834.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Special Boating Rules.

835.title: Public Service Commission, rules and regulations governing emergency telephone service
835.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Public Service Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Emergency Telephone Service.

836.title: Authorizing the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety to promulgate legislative rules
836.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Police to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia State Police Professional Standards Investigations, Employee Rights, Early Identification System, Psychological Assessment and Progressive Discipline.

837.title: Acupuncture, disciplinary and complaint procedures for acupuncturists
837.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Acupuncturists to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Disciplinary and Complaint Procedures for Acupuncturists.

838.title: Acupuncture, continuing education requirements
838.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Acupuncturists to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Continuing Education Requirements.

839.title: Authorizing the Department of Administration to promulgate legislative rules
839.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Leasing of Space and Acquisition of Real Property on Behalf of State Spending Units.

840.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
840.title: Administration, controlling the public land corporation's sale, lease, exchange or transfer of lands and minerals
840.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Administration to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Controlling the Public Land Corporation's Sale, Lease, Exchange or Transfer of Lands and Minerals.

841.title: Agriculture, auctioneers
841.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Auctioneers.

842.title: Agriculture, WV Plant Pest Act Rule
842.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Agriculture to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia Plant Pest Act.

843.title: Alcohol Beverage Control Commission, retail licensee operations
843.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Alcohol Beverage Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Retail Licensee Operations.

844.title: Alcohol Beverage Control Commission, farm wineries
844.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Alcohol Beverage Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Farm Wineries.

845.title: Alcohol Beverage Control Commission, sale of wine
845.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Alcohol Beverage Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Sale of Wine.

846.title: Auditor, standards for requisitions for payment issued by state officers
846.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Auditor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Standards for Requisitions for Payment Issued to State Officers on the Auditor.

847.title: Auditor, state purchasing card program
847.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Auditor to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the State Purchasing Card Program.

848.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
848.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, public employee retirement system
848.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Public Employees Retirement System.

849.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
849.title: Consolidated Public Retirement Board, state police
849.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Consolidated Public Retirement Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia State Police.

850.title: Dental Examiners, rule for the board

905.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Secretary of State to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Use of Digital Signatures, State Certificate Authority and the State Repository.

906.title: Solid Waste Management Board, performance measures and review standards for solid waste authorities operating commercial solid waste facilities
906.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Solid Waste Management Board to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Performance Measures and Review Standards for Solid Waste Authorities Operating Commercial Solid Waste Facilities.

907.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Examiners for Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Licensure of Speech-pathology and Audiology.

908.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4206
908.title: State Police, cadet selection
908.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Police to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Cadet Selection.

909.title: Tax Department, exchange of information agreement
909.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Tax Department to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Exchange of Information Agreement Between the Commissioner of the Tax Division of the Department of Revenue and the Commissioner of the Division of Labor of the Department of Commerce, the Commissioner of the Insurance Commission of the Department of Revenue, the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles of the Department of Transportation, the Commissioner of the Bureau of Employment Programs and the Office of the Governor.

910.title: Veterinary Medicine, registration of veterinary technicians
910.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia, 1931, as amended, relating to authorizing the Board of Veterinary Medicine to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Registration of Veterinary Technicians.

911.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4209
911.title: Ethics Commission, solicitation and receipt of gifts and charitable contributions by public employees and officials
911.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Ethics Commission to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Solicitation and Receipt of Gifts and Charitable Contributions by Public Employees and Officials.

912.title: Professional Surveyors, fees for surveyors and surveying firms
912.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Professional Surveyors to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Fees for Surveyors and Surveying Firms.

913.last_action: Reported in Com. Sub. for H. B. 4206
913.title: State Police, state police career progression system
913.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Police to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the West Virginia State Police Career Progression System.

914.title: Environmental Protection, antidegradation implementation procedures
914.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Environmental Protection to promulgate a legislative rule relating to Antidegradation Implementation Procedures.

915.title: Requiring prosecutors or assistant prosecutors that desire to carry a concealed weapon to undergo annual training
915.description: The purpose of this bill is to require prosecutors or assistant prosecutors that desire to carry a concealed weapon to undergo annual training consistent with the federal Law-Enforcement Safety Act.

916.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
916.title: Oil and Gas Surface Owner's Bill of Rights
916.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand rights for owners of the surface property where oil and gas wells are drilled.

917.title: Clarifying that certain funds are authorized investments for funds of political subdivisions
917.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that funds and pools of the West Virginia Management Board and the West Virginia Board of Treasury Investments are authorized investments for funds of political subdivisions.

918.title: Pertaining to the matching program of the deferred compensation plan for state employees
918.description: The purpose of this bill is to delete unnecessary language pertaining to the matching program of the deferred compensation plan for state employees, to clarify that an employee must have received pay every payday during a fiscal year to qualify for participation in the matching program and to provide the Treasurer with information needed to operate the state deferred compensation plan.

919.title: Eliminating penalties associated with the underpayment of taxes owed from a person who is a resident individual, provided a personal income tax is timely filed
919.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate penalties associated with the underpayment of taxes owed from a person who is a resident individual, provided a personal income tax is timely filed and payment of any tax due is made at that time.

920.title: Relating to electronic commerce
920.description: The purpose of this bill is to further permit the use of electronic commerce.  The Auditor and Treasurer are granted the discretion to require electronic filing of documents and to waive any requirements in such filing and the certification, notarization or verification of those documents.  The bill also defines the term "document" and permits the sale or disposal of property by electronic commerce.

921.title: Requiring the training of election officials and poll workers within thirty days prior to a scheduled election
921.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the training of election officials and poll workers within thirty days prior to a scheduled election.  Current law requires training to be completed within seven days of an election.

922.title: Protecting incapacitated persons and the elderly
922.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect incapacitated persons and the elderly who, reliant upon the care of others, are extremely vulnerable members of our society from abuse and neglect by caregivers, guardians or custodians, by more clearly defining the offense of abuse or neglect of incapacitated adults or elder persons which result in the death of such persons, to include the offense of murder.

924.title: Creating a special registration plate for the American Veteran's Organization (AMVETS)
924.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special registration plate for the American Veteran's Organization (AMVETS).

925.title: Comprehensive Child Welfare Commission
925.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a commission to study the child welfare system and make recommendations to strengthen it.

926.title: Relating to the rights of crime victims
926.description: The purpose of this bill is to enumerate specific rights of crime victims.

927.title: Enabling creditors to collect upon their judgements from debtors who often attempt to defeat such judgments
927.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable creditors to collect upon their judgements from debtors who often attempt to defeat such judgements by disappearing.  It also protects a certain class of persons whose identity and location must not be revealed due to court orders.

928.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
928.title: Abortion Complication Reporting Act
928.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to file regular reports with the Department of Health and Human Resources, regarding patients who require medical treatment as a result of an abortion; providing criminal penalties for violation.

929.title: Relating to requirements for firefighter applicants
929.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the age for firefighter beyond 35 for persons already employed by the Civil Service Commission.

930.title: Removing extraneous language regarding the limitation of exotic entertainment by county commissions
930.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove extraneous language regarding the limitation of exotic entertainment by county commissions.

931.title: Expanding the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program to children of certain state employees
931.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees, receiving income of twenty-five thousand dollars per year or less, for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

932.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
932.title: Providing for aged or disabled farmers to continue to receive the benefit of having their farm land appraised as farm property after they cease farming
932.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for aged or  disabled farmers to continue to receive the benefit of having their farm land appraised as farm property after they cease farming due to age or other disability.

933.title: Clarifying disciplinary cases, investigations, hearings, injunctions and penalties for the Board of Acupuncture
933.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify disciplinary cases, investigations, hearings, injunctions and penalties for the board of Acupuncture.

934.title: Revised Anatomical Gift Act
934.description: This bill repeals the current Anatomical Gift Act and replaces it with a Revised Act based on the Uniform Laws Commission's 2006 revision.  The Revised Act makes it easier to make a document of gift, particularly with regard to organ donor notations on drivers' licenses and ID cards; authorizes additional persons, such as a medical power of attorney or health care surrogate, to make anatomical gifts on behalf of an incapacitated person before death actually occurs; expands the list of those who may make an anatomical gift after an individual dies without a document of gift; establishes presumptions for distribution for body parts where the anatomical gift that does not specify to whom the gift passes; accommodates the use of donor registries; clearly provides for a document of refusal if an individual does not want organs donated; establishes criminal penalties for misrepresentation of a document of gift for the purposes of selling organs or tissue; and resolves ambiguity and conflict between anatomical gifts and "Do Not Resuscitate" instructions.

935.title: Providing an annual exemption from the consumers sales and service tax for purchases of certain energy efficient products
935.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a limited sales tax holiday for purchases of certain Energy Star appliances and devices over a three-day period, beginning June 20, 2008.

936.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
936.title: Prohibiting the performance of any abortion by any person who has admitted to or who has been adjudicated to have committed medical malpractice
936.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the performance of any abortion by any person who has admitted to or who has been adjudicated to have committed medical malpractice.  The bill also  prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of this section and further provides that nothing in this section can be construed as approving of abortion.

937.title: Relating to bona fide residents wholly or solely owning greyhounds
937.description: Relating to bona fide residents wholly or solely owning greyhounds

938.title: Exempting from the nursing licensing provisions the care of the sick when done in connection with the practice of religious tenets of any church or religious organization
938.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from the nursing  licensing provisions the care of the sick when done in connection with the practice of religious tenets of any church or religious organization and by or for its members.

939.title: Creating an apprenticeship program for barbers and cosmetologists
939.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a barber and cosmetologist apprenticeship program.

940.title: Reducing yearly insurance premiums on motor vehicles
940.description: The purpose of this bill is to give insureds the rate reductions they were promised when the Legislature granted motor vehicle insurers concessions by enacting legislation.

941.title: Exempting Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions form state income tax
941.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions from state income tax.

942.title: Authorizing county commissions to designate locations for early voting other than the county courthouse or annex
942.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to designate locations for early voting other than the county courthouse or annex of the courthouse.

943.title: Waving tuition and fees for members of the WV State Police
943.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a waiver or reimbursement of tuition and fees for members of the West Virginia State Police attending institutions of higher education.

944.title: Paying for veterans' grave markers where the U. S. government has denied the application of the veteran
944.description: The purpose of this bill is to pay for veterans' grave markers where the U.S. government has denied the application of the veteran.

945.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
945.title: Limiting the Department of Health and Human Resources involvement in abortions
945.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the Department of Health and Human Resources from being involved in aiding or assisting any person to obtain an abortion to a greater extent than is required by law and to prescribe criminal penalties for violations of the section.

946.title: Requiring all high schools include in their health classes a course in fetal development
946.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all high schools include in their health classes a course in fetal development.

947.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
947.title: Relating to using alternate medical facilities under West Virginia's emergency response plan
947.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the availability for emergency treatment in case of a disaster beyond traditional hospitals to veterinary clinics.

948.title: Including ambulance and fire fees as part of the property tax assessment so that the fees and property taxes may be paid with the same check
948.description: The purpose of this bill is to include ambulance and fire fees as part of the property tax assessment so that the fees and property taxes may be paid with the same check.

949.title: Making 911 emergency fees available to be used for both emergency and nonemergency calls
949.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter the definition of

950.title: Relating to the use of personal leave days by a surviving spouse of a deceased employee of a school board
950.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a surviving spouse of an employee of a school board who dies while employed to receive credit for the deceased spouse's accrued and unused personal leave time if the surviving spouse is also an employee of the same school board. In lieu of credit, for personal leave, the surviving spouse may elect to receive a lump sum amount for the accrued and unused sick leave of the deceased spouse.

951.title: Mandating that opioid treatment centers remain open seven days a week including holidays in order to eliminate any methadone being sent home with patients
951.description: The purpose of this bill is to mandate that opioid treatment centers remain open seven days a week including holidays in order to eliminate any methadone being sent home with patients.

952.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
952.title: Providing overtime pay for all employees who are required to work holidays regardless if the holiday hours are in excess of a forty hour workweek
952.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide overtime pay for all employees who are required to work holidays regardless if the holiday hours are in excess of a forty hour workweek.

953.title: Exempting the sale of the services of shredding and recycling of paper and paper products from the consumer sales tax
953.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the sale of the services of shredding and recycling of paper and paper products from the consumer sales tax.

954.title: Prohibiting state funding for the distribution of holiday or greeting cards by elected officials, state employees, departments or agencies
954.description: The purpose of this bill is to restrict the use of state funding for holiday or any other form of greeting cards.

955.title: Providing for prior written authorization for the towing of motor vehicles without the consent of the owner or operator, and providing criminal background checks for tow truck drivers
955.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for prior written authorization for the towing of motor vehicles without the consent of the owner or operator, and to provide for criminal background checks for drivers of tow vehicles.

957.title: Relating to charitable bingo and updating the maximum wage allowed to reflect changes in state minimum wage
957.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the maximum wage allowed to reflect changes in State of West Virginia minimum wage, which exceeds the current maximum wage allowed, and pending changes in the federal minimum wage.  By stating a percentage of the minimum wage rather than a specific dollar amount, the code will not be outdated with future changes in the minimum wage laws.

958.title: Excluding the service of a poll worker from being considered a prohibited political activity
958.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude the service of a poll worker from being considered a prohibited political activity.

959.title: Allowing a registrant to register a Class G vehicle for a two-year period and providing for alternative methods of payment of fees
959.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for an optional two-year registration period for motorcycles by collecting  either one full year or two full year's fees. The bill also contains a provision to facilitate a change to expiration dates.

960.title: Reducing the time period for magistrate courts and municipal courts to notify DMV of unsatisfied traffic-related tickets of nonresidents
960.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the time period for magistrate courts and municipal courts to notify DMV of unsatisfied traffic-related tickets of nonresidents.  This change is necessary to remain in compliance with the Nonresident Violator Compact (NRVC).

961.title: Eliminating the requirement to send surrendered driver's licenses back to the original state of licensure
961.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement to send surrendered driver's licenses back to the original state of licensure. The bill would require applicants for an instruction permit to pay for additional attempts to successfully pass the written test, provide for a specific penalty for violating the terms of conditions of the level one or level two driver's license, provide exceptions to the use of the address of principal residence, increase the period that the instruction permit is issued, restricts GDL level 1 or 2 drivers to operation of passenger vehicles, provides for a criminal penalty for violation of the terms and conditions of a GDL license, allows the use of a United States passport in lieu of a certified copy of a birth certificate, allows the division to issue an identification card if the applicant has a driver's license and makes other technical changes to standardize definitions.

962.title: Revising Insurance Commissioner reporting requirements to the Legislature on workers' compensation insurance rules
962.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for legislative notice by the Insurance Commissioner whenever a rule, policy or guideline that affects the workers compensation insurance system is implemented.

963.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
963.title: Relating to requiring an insurance company to withhold a specified amount from insurance proceeds to cover costs of fire cleanup of a structure
963.description: The purpose of this bill is to require an insurance company to withhold a specified amount from insurance proceeds to cover costs of fire cleanup of a structure within a municipality under certain circumstances.

964.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
964.title: Reporting requirements when it is suspected that a women suffered injury or death due to induced abortion
964.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to report to the Department of Health and Human Resources when he or she believes that a woman has suffered injury or death due to an induced abortion, to impose duties on the Department of Health and Human Resources regarding these reports and to outline penalties for violations.

965.title: Requiring that greyhounds be kept with the state for six months before it may be trained as a racing dog
965.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that greyhounds be kept with the state for six months before it may be trained as a racing dog.

966.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
966.title: Prohibiting any person who is not a physician licensed to practice in this state from performing an abortion
966.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit persons who are not licensed physicians from performing an abortion in this state.

967.title: Authorizing the Board of Barbers and Cosmetologists to increase fees for one year
967.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a Board of Barbers and Cosmetologists to increase fee for one year.

968.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
968.title: Relating to the discharging of firearms within a certain distance of a dwelling house
968.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it lawful for any person to discharge a firearm within five hundred feet of any dwelling house in a safe and accurate manner if that person obtains a permit to do so from the Director of the Division of Natural Resources.

969.title: Increasing the state racing commission from three to five members
969.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase from three to five the number of members on the Racing Commission board and sets forth who the members may be.

970.title: Clarifying West Virginia's consumer protection law
970.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify West Virginia's consumer protection law; provide for statement of legislative intent; provide exemption for matters regulated by the Federal Trade Commission; provide standards for actions by consumers; provide for jury trials; and establish an effective date.

971.title: Relating to payment of National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus
971.description: The purpose of this bill is to pay the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to the holders of certificates awarded to them during employment as a classroom teacher if they are subsequently employed as a school principal, or assistant school principal, or in another position in an instructional leadership capacity.

972.title: Creating a State Trail Authority within the West Virginia Development Office
972.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a State Trail Authority.  The bill authorizes the appointment of a Statewide Trail Coordinator and to hire District Trail Coordinators, specifies the powers of the State Trail Authority and sets forth the powers and duties of Statewide Trail Coordinator and District Trail Coordinators.

973.title: Expanding technology infrastructure to provide broadband internet access throughout the State of West Virginia
973.description: The purpose of this bill expanding technology infrastructure to provide broadband Internet access throughout the State of West Virginia; donation of surplus computers; authorizing Chief Technology Officer to establish donation program; requiring Chief Technology Officer to consult with and assist higher education institution governing boards in creating a donation program; requiring Chief Technology Officer to study the recycling of obsolete technology; exempting donated computers from certain procedures relating to disposition of surplus property; creating the Electronic Telecommunication Open Infrastructure Act (ETOPIA); providing definitions for terms used in the article; setting forth legislative findings; requiring an inventory and mapping of the current availability of access to broadband communications in this state; developing coordinated deployment and operation of technology infrastructure within this state; providing for technology infrastructure inventory, local government cooperation and inventory survey reporting requirements; authorizing emergency and legislative rules; prescribing the authority of the Secretary of Department of Administration; describing specific authorized disclosures of confidential information; creating Joint Legislative Oversight Commission on Transportation and Infrastructure; providing subpoena powers; providing for enforcement of subpoena power through a court of competent jurisdiction; prescribing the powers and duties of the Secretary of Commerce; establishing reporting requirements; authorizing secretary to provide technical and funding assistance to develop technology infrastructure; authorizing secretary to engage in consulting services for fee; authorizing contractual and joint venture agreements; providing for the liberal construction of article; utilizing broadband infrastructure, technology and information to enhance early childhood development; providing for the confidentiality of trade secrets and proprietary information; providing for criminal penalties for unlawful disclosure of confidential information or data; and expanding number of higher education institutions authorized to create computer and computer equipment donation program.

974.title: Relating to the criminal offense of cruelty to animals
974.description: The purpose of this bill is to prescribe minimum requirements relative to tethering or chaining animals, including the length and weight of chains or tethering devices, as well as other requirements, all of which are intended to protect animals from cruel treatment.

975.title: Reducing the wholesale tax on heating fuel, off road fuels, kerosene and propane used for home heating purposes or off road use
975.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the wholesale tax on heating fuel, off road fuels, kerosene and propane used for home heating purposes or off road use to 4.85% effective January 1, 2009.

976.title: Exempting all schools which include grades kindergarten through twelve from paying consumer sales tax on items the school sells
976.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all schools which include grades kindergarten through grade twelve from paying consumer sales tax on items the school sells.

977.title: Compensating state troopers for call-back time
977.description: The purpose of this bill is to require compensation for certain off-duty State Police officers.

978.title: Adding language to the code for fees for tests and certificates that were already imposed
978.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to the code for fees for tests and certificates which were already imposed but did not have statutory authorization.

979.title: Capping regional jail per diem charges at forty-eight dollars and ten cents
979.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the regional jail per diem charge to forty-eight dollars and ten cents per day, per inmate.

980.title: Requiring that all decisions regarding certain reductions in full-time classified personnel workforce at state institutions of higher education be made on the basis of seniority
980.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that all decisions regarding temporary or permanent reductions in full-time classified personnel workforce at state institutions of higher education, in situations where a job is reduced by reducing the number of days or hours worked, be made on the basis of seniority.

981.title: Limiting the posting of certain classroom material on the internet
981.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the posting of certain classroom material on the Internet as determined by the classroom teacher.

982.title: Allowing teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state
982.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state of at least ten years.

983.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
983.title: Increasing compensation for conservation officers
983.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an increase in compensation for conservation officers.

984.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
984.title: Providing state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel
984.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state health care services for all active and inactive duty military personnel.

985.title: Allowing Hatfield-McCoy Regional Recreation Authority to retain civil penalties imposed for violation of authority rules
985.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Hatfield-McCoy Regional Recreation Authority to retain civil penalties imposed for violation of authority rules, for the benefit of the Hatfield-McCoy Recreation Area.

986.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
986.title: Allowing a hospital physician to decline performing an abortion when a mother's life is not in imminent danger
986.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a hospital physician to decline performing an abortion when a mother's life is not in imminent danger.

987.title: Extending the Neighborhood Investment Program Act and eligibility for tax credits under the act
987.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend Neighborhood Investment Program Act, and eligibility for tax credits under the act, until July 1, 2011.

988.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
988.title: Prohibiting abusive behavior towards elephants by an owner or manager
988.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor for an owner or manager of an elephant to engage in abusive behavior towards the elephant.

989.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
989.title: Relating to the eliminating of mercury in vaccines
989.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate, to the maximum extent possible, the use of vaccines that contain mercury.

990.title: Relating to mine operators protective equipment and clothing and increasing the visibility of each mine employee to help deter accidents
990.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the visibility of each mine employee to help deter accidents.

991.title: Prohibiting magistrates from imposing multiple court cost fees for the same matter
991.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit magistrates from imposing multiple court cost fees for the same matter.

992.title: Authorizing the law-enforcement agency responsible for a forfeited motor vehicle to trade the motor vehicle for a new vehicle
992.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the law-enforcement agency responsible for a forfeited motor vehicle to trade the motor vehicle for a new vehicle if the motor vehicle has little value for public auctions purposes.

993.title: Authorizing county commissions to adopt and enforce noise abatement ordinances
993.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to adopt and enforce noise abatement ordinances.

994.title: Amending various requirements for motor vehicle dealers
994.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend various requirements for motor vehicle dealers.  The bill expands the authority of the Dealer Recovery Fund Control Board to award claims; raises the minimum bond required of dealers during their first three years of operation from $10,000 to $25,000; establishes a minimum level of vehicle sales to remain a licensed dealer; adds required participation in electronic issuance of temporary license plates; and authorizes dealers in border states to issue registrations on vehicle sales and exempts persons employed by a dealer in the business of selling commercial motor vehicles from the requirements of obtaining a dealer salesperson license.

995.title: Providing a minimum hourly rate of pay for extracurricular assignments for school service personnel
995.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a minimum hourly rate of pay for extracurricular assignments for school service personnel.

996.title: Modifying administrative and criminal penalties for driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol and/or drugs
996.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the interlock program available to first time offenders while also increasing incentives for participation in the program; increased periods on the interlock program for aggravating circumstances involving a second or subsequent DUI offense; reducing the administrative penalties for driving with a suspended license; permitting administrative hearing decisions to be based on the arresting officer's affidavit; and requiring a mandatory blood alcohol content test for all drivers involved in a motor vehicle crash resulting in death or serious bodily injury.

997.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
997.title: Requiring a woman, prior to an abortion, to have a pregnancy test administered at the facility where the abortion is to be performed
997.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a woman, prior to an abortion, to have a pregnancy test administered at the facility where the abortion is to be performed, and the pregnancy test results must be confirmed prior to the abortion.  The bill also provides that the license of a physician may be revoked for violations.

998.title: Reducing acts of student violence and disruptive behavior and increasing penalties for chronically disruptive students
998.description: Reducing acts of student violence and disruptive behavior and increasing penalties for chronically disruptive students

999.title: Establishing a West Virginia State Trooper's Association leave donation program
999.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a leave donation program to allow members of the state trooper's association to donate accumulated leave time to the president and designee of the president of the state trooper's association.

1000.title: Allowing insured a minimum of one year to file all claims
1000.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow insureds a minimum of one year to file all claims.

1001.title: Increasing compensation of membership of the West Virginia State Police
1001.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the compensation  of the membership of the West Virginia State Police.

1002.title: Creating a special revenue account in the State Treasury called the "West Virginia Racing Commission-Special Account-West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund
1002.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the creation of a special revenue account in the State Treasury called the "West Virginia Racing Commission-Special Account-West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund."

1003.title: Clarifying how payment of the library funding obligation of a "special act library" is made from the local share
1003.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify how payment of the library finding obligation of a "special act library" is made from the local share.

1004.title: Making it a misdemeanor to file a frivolous lawsuit
1004.description: The purpose of this bill is to discourage the filing of any frivolous claims and keep the court system from being clogged with cases of no merit.

1005.title: Approving fee waivers for certain students and faculty and staff at institutions of higher education
1005.description: The purpose of this bill is to approve fee waivers for certain students and faculty and staff at institutions of higher education at undergraduate and graduate levels.  The bill  applies this exemption to all such institutions.  It further provides that nonresident faculty and staff may get the exemption only up to the amount of in-state tuition.

1006.title: Providing an exemption from gross income for members of volunteer fire departments for state personal income tax purposes
1006.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow members of volunteer fire departments to deduct the taxes on personal income due for that tax year as an additional modification reducing the member's federal adjusted gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

1007.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to create a school drug safety program
1007.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to create a school drug safety program.  The bill would require the program to include drug testing of individuals prior to  being hired, transferred or promoted to positions within a school and include random drug testing of all individuals employed in a school.

1008.title: Increasing the number of magistrates in Jefferson County by one
1008.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the number of magistrates in Jefferson County by one.

1009.title: Providing crime watch members coverage under the West Virginia Public Employees Insurance health coverage plan
1009.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide health and life insurance coverage for Crime Watch Members.

1010.title: Increasing protections to beneficiaries of structured settlements as they relate to settlement transfers
1010.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase protection to beneficiaries of structured settlements as they relate to settlement transfers.

1011.title: Relating to an assigned risk plan and guaranty association account for workers' compensation insurance
1011.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the development of a plan by the Insurance Commissioner to provide workers' compensation coverage to employers who are unable to procure coverage in the voluntary market and to include workers' compensation insurance under the Guaranty Association Act in order to provide a means of paying claims when an workers' compensation insurer becomes insolvent.

1012.title: Permitting employee and retiree organizations to obtain state employees' home addresses
1012.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit employee and retiree organizations to obtain state employees' home addresses as an exception to the limitation imposed on the release of personal information concerning state employees and retirees.

1013.title: Awarding service revolver upon retirement to state fire marshal
1013.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state fire marshals to keep their service revolver upon retirement.

1014.title: Expanding the number of members of boards of zoning appeal from five to seven
1014.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the expansion of the number of members of boards of zoning appeal from five to seven.

1015.title: Revising certain powers and duties of the Legislative Auditor
1015.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise certain powers and duties of the Legislative Auditor.  It authorizes audits of state funds, including funds derived from a state controlled function,  provides legislative intent as to proposals for regulating professions and occupations, allows reports to be conducted by the Legislative Auditor by request, provides recommendations the Legislative Auditor may make in reports and expands the time during which legislation may be considered before reapplication for regulation of a profession or occupation.

1016.title: Authorizing municipalities to create an annual vacant property registration
1016.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize municipalities to create a semiannual vacant property registration fee.

1017.title: Relating to the teachers retirement system and providing that certain beneficiaries receive an annuity when an eligible spouse has not redeemed the accumulated contributions
1017.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain beneficiaries receive an annuity when an eligible spouse has not redeemed the accumulated contributions and making the provision retroactive to July 1, 2002.

1018.title: Authorizing the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals to maintain a domestic violence database
1018.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals to maintain a domestic violence database.

1019.title: Removing requirement that resident violators of traffic laws be required to sign citations
1019.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that resident violators of traffic laws be required to sign citations.

1020.title: Relating to the commissioner's rule-making authority for workers' compensation
1020.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the current exemption of the Insurance Commissioner from legislative review of rules relating to the regulation of workers' compensation insurance market beginning July 1, 2009.

1021.title: Allowing magistrates and family court judges to carry concealed weapons on courthouse property
1021.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow magistrates and family court judges to carry concealed weapons on courthouse property.

1022.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1022.title: Banning abortions in instances where the fetus could survive if delivered and providing penalties
1022.description: The purpose of this bill is to ban abortions in instances where the fetus could survive if delivered and to provide a criminal penalty for violations.

1023.title: Allowing members of the State Teachers Retirement System to repay a maximum of three years worth of contribution back into the system
1023.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow members of the State Teachers Retirement System to repay a maximum of three years worth of contribution back into the system.

1024.title: Restoring the licensure exemption for certain contractors of manufactured housing installation
1024.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore the West Virginia Manufactured Housing Construction and Safety Standards the power to allow subcontractors to work on manufactured housing installation.

1025.title: Abolishing the business and franchise tax
1025.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the business franchise tax effective July 1, 2008.

1026.title: Relating to retention and destruction of health care records
1026.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide time frames (ten years following the last date of treatment or contract for adults) for retention of medical and other health care records, including diagnostic media, and methods for destruction of the records.

1027.title: Providing a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence
1027.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence of an individual in any one year.

1028.title: Creating the crime of murder of a child by a parent who exposes his or her child to the manufacturing of a controlled substance
1028.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the crime of murder of a child by a parent who exposes his or her child to the manufacturing of a controlled substance.

1029.title: Providing that persons convicted of certain drug related crimes must participate in a substance abuse counseling program to be eligible for probation
1029.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that persons convicted of certain drug related crimes must participate in a substance abuse counseling program to be eligible for probation.

1030.title: Relating to tax administration efficiency and technical advancements
1030.description: The purpose of this bill is to require electronic filing of tax returns for taxpayers that satisfy the threshold requirements; to authorize the combining of tax assessments resulting from one audit; to authorize the Tax Commissioner to promulgate rules to determine the application of partial tax payments; to apply the statute of limitations separately to all taxes in a combined assessment; to authorize the recordation of one lien for all taxes in a combined assessment, to authorize health care providers to assert the exemption from consumers sales and service tax for purchases of drugs, durable medical goods, mobility enhancing equipment, prosthetic devices and insulin for use in providing professional or personal services through direct pay permits; to eliminate the periodic biennial renewal requirement for business registration certificates granted on or after the first day of July, two thousand ten; to impose a penalty for the involuntary cancellation, revocation or suspension of such certificates for any cause specified by statute, payable upon reinstatement, or issuance of a business registration certificate after the involuntary cancellation, revocation or suspension of a prior business registration certificate; to require the Tax Commissioner to design a new tax return form that combines the reporting of both Consumers Sales and Service Tax and Use Tax, and to require taxpayers to use the form required by the Tax Commissioner, and to simplify the annual West Virginia Withholding Tax imposed under the code by adopting the federal schedule and procedures.

1031.title: Protecting the academic speech of professional educators
1031.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect academic speech of professional educators.

1032.title: Relating to compulsive gambling
1032.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health and Human Resources to bid and award contracts for gambling treatment programs; develop procedures and contract requirements, provide for performance monitoring; prohibit interference with the operation of the program; prohibit the use of Lottery Commission logo on advertising media; and require an annual report.

1033.title: Relating to immunity from civil liability for operators of parks and recreation districts
1033.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend immunity from civil liability to the operators of parks and recreation districts.

1034.title: Discount Medical Plan Organizations and Discount Prescription Drug Plan Organizations Act
1034.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism for the regulation and licensing by the Insurance Commissioner of discount medical plan organizations and discount prescription drug plan organizations.

1035.title: Allowing an additional "pari-mutuel racing facility" in north central West Virginia
1035.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an additional "Pari-mutuel racing facility" in north central West Virginia with strict limitations on the nature and scope of the facility.

1036.title: Relating to state board standards for the recommended duration of school bus transportation times for students to and from school
1036.description: This bill requires the high quality standards for transportation adopted by the state board to include standards for the recommended duration of the one-way school bus transportation time for students to and from school under normal weather and operating conditions.

1037.title: Requiring automatic tire chains as standard equipment on all new school buses
1037.description: The purpose of this bill is to require automatic tire chains as standard equipment on all new school buses.

1038.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1038.title: Eliminating plastic bags from use in retail establishments
1038.description: The purpose of this section is to eliminate plastic bags from use in retail establishments.

1039.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
1039.title: Requiring rest periods for employees during each four hours of work
1039.description: The purpose of this bill is to require rest periods of fifteen minutes for each four hours of work.

1040.title: Providing a one-time supplement to retirement benefits for certain annuitants and survivor beneficiaries
1040.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement for certain annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired at least three consecutive years.

1041.title: Exempting land-based finfish aquaculture facilities from certain sludge management requirements
1041.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt land-based finfish aquaculture facilities from certain sludge management requirements.

1042.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1042.title: Requiring medical practitioners who perform abortions to estimate the gestational age of the fetus by using ultrasound
1042.description: The purpose of this bill is to require medical practitioners who perform abortions to estimate the gestational age of the fetus by using ultrasound analysis and measurement.  The bill also prescribes a criminal fine for violations of the section.

1043.title: Permitting retired state employees to transfer from Medicare to coverage through the West Virginia Public Employees Act
1043.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit Medicare-eligible retired employees to transfer coverage from a Medicare-specific plan to coverage directly from the agency.

1044.title: Establishing the West Virginia Sesquicentennial of the American Civil War Commission and Fund
1044.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Sesquicentennial of the American Civil War Commission and Fund to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the Civil War; establish membership and compensation; provide the powers and duties of the commission; and provide for continuation of the commission.

1045.title: Relating to the West Virginia Residential Mortgage Lender, Broker and Servicer Act
1045.description: The purpose of this bill is to correct a typographical error, and permit the division to make a claim on a licensee's bond for unpaid penalties and invoices while giving consumer claims priority.

1046.title: Relating to compensation of charitable bingo and charitable raffle operators
1046.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the code sections affected to reflect modern federal minimum wage requirements and to clarify language.

1047.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1047.title: Imposing a smoking ban at medical facilities
1047.description: This bill provides that medical facilities shall be free of tobacco smoke and imposes posting requirements upon the medical facilities.  Additionally, it sets forth penalties.

1048.title: Establishing a statewide reporting system for hospitals to report their infection rates
1048.description: The purpose of the bill is to establish a statewide reporting system for hospitals to report their infection rates and to improve the incidence of infections in West Virginia hospitals.

1049.title: Exempting existing churches from paying tax on propane and other forms of heating oil
1049.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt existing churches from paying a tax on propane and other heating oils used for the purpose of heating a church building.

1050.title: Imposing corporate net income tax on certain regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts used as tax sheltering vehicles
1050.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose corporate net income tax on certain regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts used as tax sheltering vehicles.

1051.title: Repealing the corporate license tax, and creating corporate license tax replacement fees
1051.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the complicated and confusing corporate license tax, and to replace the resulting loss of revenues by the Office of the Secretary of State by creating a new one-time $100 filing fee, and by permitting the Secretary of State to keep all of the $25 annual attorney-in-fact fees paid by corporations and limited partnerships.

1052.title: Authorizing the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a "Choose Life" license plate displaying the "Choose Life" logo
1052.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a "Choose Life" license plate displaying the "Choose Life" logo.

1053.title: Ensuring that beer kegs are not considered scrap metal unless received directly from a beer manufacturer
1053.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that stainless steel kegs are not considered scrap metal unless received directly from a beer manufacturer or an authorized representative.

1054.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
1054.title: Requiring the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors
1054.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors.

1055.title: Permitting firework displays on public school property provided the State Superintendent and the Fire Marshal approve the display
1055.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit firework displays on public school property provided the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshall approve the display.

1056.title: Granting a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees
1056.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a salary increase for Regional Jail Authority employees of five thousand dollars to be paid over a three-year period.

1057.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1057.title: Expanding West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program to children of employees whose annual income is twenty-five thousand dollars or less
1057.description: The purpose of this bill is to qualify children of state employees and any other person employed in this state whose annual income is twenty-five thousand dollars a year or less for the West Virginia Children's Health Insurance Program.

1058.title: Eliminating the sales tax on food effective the first day of July, two thousand eight
1058.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the sales tax on food beginning the first day of July, two thousand eight.

1059.title: Allowing for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death
1059.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death.

1060.title: Providing a misdemeanor penalty if a person fails to make a reasonable, good faith attempt to return a minor child in a timely manner at the expiration of a lawful custody or visitation period
1060.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a misdemeanor penalty if a person fails to make a reasonable, good faith attempt to return a minor child in a timely manner at the expiration of a lawful custody or visitation period.

1061.title: Increasing the compensation of the membership of the West Virginia State Police
1061.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the compensation of the membership of the West Virginia State Police.

1062.title: Increasing annual salaries of public school teachers, providing salary bonuses for classroom teachers, and increasing annual salaries for school service personnel
1062.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase annual salaries for public school teachers, provide salary bonuses for classroom teachers, and increase annual salaries for school service personnel.

1063.title: Increasing the maximum amount of a medical student loan that may be cancelled
1063.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the maximum amount of a medical student loan that may be cancelled annually from $5,000 to $10,000 to match the increased maximum annual $10,000 loan amount.

1064.title: Establishing a higher education energy and water savings revolving loan fund
1064.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a higher education energy and water savings revolving loan fund.

1065.title: Exempting vehicles in a  funeral procession from paying tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike
1065.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt vehicles in a funeral procession from paying a toll on the West Virginia Turnpike.

1066.title: Creating a course in solar hot water heating at each community and technical college in the state
1066.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a course in solar hot water heating at each community and technical college in the state.

1067.title: Enhancing criminal penalties for certain criminal acts against health care workers
1067.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend to health care workers the same protections afforded other persons who serve the public and are thereby regularly exposed to the threat of physical  violence in the course of performing their jobs, by establishing   enhanced criminal penalties for certain crimes, such as malicious assault or battery, committed against licensed and certified health care professionals.

1068.title: Relating to air pollution control
1068.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the expedited review of complete permit applications for sources, other than major sources.  It would allow all facilities with complete permit applications and who have received written permission from the secretary, to construct an altered or expanded source provided that operations of the altered or expanded source could not commence until its permit or permit modification was issued.  It also sets timelines for permitting actions, makes other clarifications of the secretary's duties in minor source air permitting and would require the promulgation of legislative rules to implement this bill by the first day of August, two thousand eight.

1069.title: Including the school principal's recommendation in the criteria to be considered when hiring teachers and other professional personnel
1069.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the school principal's recommendation in the criteria to be considered by a county board of education when hiring teachers and other professional personnel.

1070.title: Clarifying the regulation and treatment under the law of the production, marketing and delivery of natural gas and oil
1070.description: The purpose of this bill is to simplify the taxation and clarify the regulation and treatment under the law of the production, marketing and delivery of natural gas and oil.

1071.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1071.title: Captive Cervid Farming Act
1071.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate captive cervid farming as an agricultural enterprise in this state.  Toward this purpose, the bill contains provisions as follows:  Describing powers and duties of the Department of Agriculture; providing for rule-making authority; setting forth duties and obligations of the commissioner; providing for an application process; providing for the issuance, renewal, modification, and transfer of a license certificate; providing for inspection of facilities; providing for the transition of current facilities; addressing noncompliance with article and providing for certain criminal penalties and remedies due to noncompliance.

1072.title: Relating to payment of various medical expenses and equipment on behalf of disabled members of the West Virginia State Police
1072.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the circumstances under which the West Virginia State Police is responsible for the payment of medical expenses associated with injuries received in the performance of official duties.

1073.title: Creating the offense of carrying, using or possessing a firearm or other destructive device during the commission of a drug related crime
1073.description: The purpose of this bill is to define certain terms and create the offense of carrying, using or possessing a firearm or other destructive device during the commission of a drug related crime.

1074.title: Reducing the corporate net income tax rate to five point nine percent effective the first day of July, two thousand eight
1074.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the rate of tax on corporate net income to five point nine percent (5.9%), effective the tax year beginning July 1, 2008.

1075.title: Relating to definitions under the Medical Professional Liability Act
1075.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that a licensed pharmacy is a health care facility and licensed pharmacies and pharmacists are health care providers solely under the provisions of the Medical Professional Liability Act.  Licensed pharmacies and pharmacists are licensed and certified by the West Virginia Board of Pharmacy and participate in the preparation, compounding and dispensing of drugs and medical devices to patients that are used in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.

1076.title: Exempting from state and personal income tax the benefits a retired teacher receives from the State Teachers Retirement System under certain circumstances
1076.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from state personal income tax the benefits a retired teacher receives from the State Teachers Retirement System, provided that teacher on or before the sixth day of March, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two elected to participate to the full extent permitted by his or her salary in that retirement system.

1077.title: Healthy Families Act
1077.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a minimum amount of paid sick leave to almost all employees working within the State of West Virginia.

1079.title: Allowing the Higher Education Policy Commission and WV Council for Community and Technical College Education to enter into lease-purchase agreements
1079.description: The purpose of this bill is allow the Higher Education Policy Commission and WV Council for Community and Technical College Education to enter into lease-purchase agreements.

1080.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Act
1080.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent government sponsored interference with a West Virginian's guaranteed freedom of religion.

1081.title: Permitting Information Act
1081.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the permitting information ombudsman in the Governor's Office of Technology; to establish the ombudsman's authority; establishing the duty of agencies to provider permitting information; development of permitting information repository available to the public; providing procedures for an agency's failure to provide permitting information; the reporting of status of the permitting information repository to the Legislature and the Governor; and allowing for the promulgation of rules by the permitting information ombudsman.

1082.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1082.title: Relating to a modification of income subject to personal income tax for the spaying and neutering of cats and dogs
1082.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a modification to  income subject to personal income tax for the spaying and neutering of cats and dogs that are family pets.

1083.title: Providing that the PEIA Finance Board may make optional plans available as an IRS plan or as part of the preferred provider benefits
1083.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the PEIA Finance Board may make optional plans available as an IRS plan or as part of the preferred provider benefits.

1084.title: Requiring public utilities to file with the county commission in each county in which it provides service, copies of all proposed tariffs and schedules showing all the rates, charges and tolls
1084.description: The purpose of this bill is to require public utilities to file with the clerk of the county commission in each county in which it provides service, or proposes to provide service, copies of all proposed tariffs and all schedules showing all the rates, charges and tolls for service to be rendered by it or by other persons, firms or corporations in connection with it.

1085.title: Relating to fees and expenditures for county development
1085.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for additional fees and those fees for county development.

1086.title: Relating to replacing unuseable athletic facilities
1086.description: The purpose of this bill is to replace unuseable athletic facilities; requiring adequate plan for replacement within certain time period; and penalties.

1087.title: Including roads used by multiple families in the state road system
1087.description: The purpose of this bill is to include roads that serve more than one family in the state road system.

1088.title: Removing the section of code that limits the use of certain types of vehicles on highways between sunset and sunrise
1088.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove section of code that limits the use of certain types of vehicles on highways between sunset and sunrise.

1089.title: Creating a registry of convictions for operating a clandestine drug laboratory
1089.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a registry of persons convicted of operating a clandestine drug laboratory.  The proposal includes provisions designating certain information to be contained on the registry and directing the Criminal Identification Bureau of the State Police to create a website using descriptive terms for the public to access relative to the information in the registry.

1090.title: Protecting potential property buyers by requiring property owners to disclose previous existence of a crystal methamphetamine lab
1090.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect potential property buyers by requiring property owners to disclose the previous existence on the property of a crystal methamphetamine lab.

1091.title: Providing health insurance under PEIA for surviving dependents of State Police Officers killed in the line of duty
1091.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide health insurance under PEIA for surviving dependents of State Police Officers killed in the line of duty.

1092.title: Increasing the amount of benefits for surviving dependents of State Police officers killed in the line of duty
1092.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of support that is received for dependent children who survive State Police officers killed in the line of duty.

1093.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1093.title: Prohibiting the destruction of frozen embryos
1093.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the destruction of frozen embryos, and to provide for the adoption of frozen embryos and to impose a fine for noncompliance.

1094.title: Adding more exemptions to the requirement that a foreign corporation obtain a certificate of authority before conducting affairs in the state
1094.description: Adding more exemptions to the requirement that a foreign corporation obtain a certificate of authority before conducting affairs in the state

1095.title: Relating to fees charged by the Secretary of State
1095.description: Relating to fees charged by the Secretary of State

1096.title: Expanding the powers of the Office of Consumer Advocacy within the Office of the Insurance Commissioner
1096.description: Expanding the powers of the Office of Consumer Advocacy within the Office of the Insurance Commissioner

1097.title: Making it a misdemeanor to falsify educational or academic records to obtain a benefit
1097.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor to falsify educational or academic records or to knowingly misrepresent your academic or educational record to obtain a benefit for that individual or other party.

1098.title: Permitting county board of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches
1098.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county boards of education the power to employ the most qualified person to be athletic and other extracurricular coaches. The bill also permits the boards to develop the criteria to be used when hiring and firing coaches.

1099.title: Allowing state colleges and universities to better manage real property gifted to them or acquired by them with private funds
1099.description: The purpose of this bill is allow state colleges and universities to better manage real property gifted to them, or acquired by them with private funds by allowing title to such properties to be transferred to a real estate foundation established as a nonstock, nonprofit corporation.  The foundation must be exempt from federal income tax.  The governing board must affirmatively approve each transfer but only upon a finding that the property was in fact gifted to the institution or was acquired with private moneys.

1100.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1100.title: Requiring medical facilities that provide abortions to administer anesthesia to an unborn fetus when aborted, if it is older than seven weeks
1100.description: The purpose of this bill is to require medical facilities that provide abortions to administer anesthesia to an unborn fetus when aborted, if it is older than seven weeks.  It also provides that when, during the course of an abortion procedure, a fetus is aborted alive, all available medical means must be used to preserve its life.  The bill provides criminal penalties for violations.

1101.title: Making certain changes to the West Virginia State Police Retirement System
1101.description: This committee substitute would lower the normal retirement age for State Police officers under this retirement plan, eliminate any reduction in the benefit of a State Police officer who is disabled on the job, raise the cap on scholarship money available certain surviving  dependent children, and increase and dedicate certain fees to the State Police Retirement Fund.

1102.title: Requiring a board of education to wait ten days before posting a new job opening following the death of an employee
1102.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a board of education to wait ten days before posting a new job opening following the death of an employee.

1103.title: Providing that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election
1103.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election on an ordinance for the program.

1104.title: Relating to registered nurses required in operating rooms
1104.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a circulating registered nurse during every surgical procedure.

1105.title: Prohibiting the filming or photographing of minors in the production of obscene matter and providing penalty
1105.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the filming or photographing of minors in the production of obscene matter and to make the penalty therefor equal to that for filming or photographing minors engaged in sexually explicit conduct.

1106.title: Public-Private Transportation Facilities Act
1106.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Public-Private Transportation Facilities Act of 2008 within the Division of Highways.

1107.last_action: Clerk's note: Enrolled bill not presented to Governor as passed by Legislature; bill is null and void
1107.title: Relating to payment of GED exam fees
1107.description: Relating to payment of GED exam fees

1108.title: Limiting the mid-year transfer of certain school employees working with students with exceptionalities
1108.description: Limiting the mid-year transfer of certain school employees working with students with exceptionalities

1109.title: Mandating that school principals submit recommendations for the superintendent regarding the appointment, assignment, promotion, transfer and dismissal of all personnel
1109.description: The purpose of this bill is to mandate that school principals submit recommendations for the superintendent regarding the appointment, assignment, promotion, transfer and dismissal  of all personnel; and technical changes.

1110.title: Relating to proof of financial responsibility in motor vehicle insurance
1110.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the property damage liability limit for motor vehicle insurance to fifty thousand dollars.

1111.title: Authorizing the Commissioner of Highways to install "move over" signs along interstate highways applicable to motorist approaching disabled or emergency vehicles
1111.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the West Virginia Commissioner of Highways to install "move over" signs along interstate highways applicable to motorists approaching disabled or emergency vehicles on the shoulders or berms.

1112.title: Allowing payments from the Parkways Authority to the Hatfield-McCoy Regional Recreational Authority to continue past the nine-year limitation
1112.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow payments from the Parkways Authority to the Hatfield-McCoy Regional Recreational Authority to continue past the nine-year limitation in the statute.

1113.title: Prohibiting certain sex offenders from loitering within one thousand feet of a school or child care facility, school bus stop, or other child safety zone
1113.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain sex offenders from loitering within one thousand feet of a school or child care facility, school bus stop, or other child safety zone.

1114.title: Relating to the criminal offense of stalking
1114.description: Relating to the criminal offense of stalking

1115.title: Requiring the preservation of biological evidence found in connection with a criminal case, and establishing penalties for violations
1115.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the preservation of biological evidence found in connection with a criminal case so that the evidence is available for DNA testing.  It also establishes criminal penalties for violations.
