1116.title: Adding definitions for anticipated and unanticipated users of external defibrillators and limiting liability toward unanticipated users who render aid
1116.description: The purpose of this bill is to add definitions for anticipated and unanticipated users of external defibrillators and limiting liability toward unanticipated users who render aid.

1117.title: Prohibiting public disclosure of the social security number of any person named or disclosed in a motor vehicle accident report
1117.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude a driver's or involved person's social security number from motor vehicle accident reports.

1118.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1118.title: Prohibiting timber or land holding companies or other entities from setting up and charging for hunting club organizations
1118.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit timber or land holding companies or other entities from setting up and charging for hunting club organizations.  It requires these companies or entities to permit, for a fee, licensed hunters to hunt on property owned or held by the companies or entities.  Proceeds from the permits are to be divided equally between the Division of Natural Resources and the land owners or holders.

1119.title: Requiring magistrate courts to maintain records relating to successful collection rates on judgements
1119.description: The purpose of this bill is to require magistrate courts to maintain records relating to successful collection rates on judgments and to make reports of these available to claimants and general public.

1120.title: Finding and declaring certain claims against the state and its agencies to be moral obligations of the state
1120.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide payment to certain claimants who provided commodities and/or services to the state, but who were not paid because the agency involved overspent its budget.

1121.title: Enhancing criminal penalties for violating statutory requirments for purchasing scrap metal when the scrap metal is a catalytic converter
1121.description: The purpose of this bill is to enhance criminal penalties for violating statutory requirements for purchasing scrap metal when the scrap metal is a catalytic converter.

1122.title: Requiring drivers to submit to evidentiary breath tests and blood or urine tests
1122.description: The purpose of this bill is to require drivers to submit to evidentiary breath tests and blood or urine; set forth requirements for blood or urine tests; authorize issuance of warrants to perform chemical analysis of the blood or urine of persons charged with driving under the influence; and penalties.

1123.title: Exempting the first twenty thousand dollars of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax
1123.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $20,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

1124.title: Relating to the regulation of the practice of accountancy
1124.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow more firms and accountants to practice accountancy in West Virginia.

1125.title: Limiting the use of the titles "registered nurse", "nurse practitioner", and "nurse" to certain qualified individuals
1125.description: The purpose of this legislation is to limit the use of the word "nurse" to those who are qualified and licensed to practice "nursing" by the WV Board of Examiners for Professional Nurses.

1126.title: Providing opportunities for members of the Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System ("TDC") to the State Teachers Retirement System ("TRS")
1126.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the voluntary  transfer of assets from the Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System ("TDC") to the State Teachers Retirement System ("TRS"); to provide an election on the question of actively contributing members of the TDC voluntarily transferring assets to the TRS; requiring seventy percent of actively contributing members of the TDC to vote in the affirmative; to permit the voluntary transfer of assets upon affirmative vote; providing for transferring members to receive service credit in TRS for an amount equal to seventy-five percent of the members' service credit to the TDC; and providing transferring members the option to receive full credit in TRS by paying the Actuarial Reserve.

1127.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
1127.title: Requiring certification of correctness as to design, construction and performance of domestic and commercial liquefied petroleum gas-consuming equipment and appliances
1127.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certification of correctness as to design, construction and performance of domestic and commercial liquefied petroleum gas-consuming equipment and appliances. The bill would also:

1128.title: Limiting liability for repair costs to automobile owners when they hit a deer on a public highway
1128.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit costs to automobile owners for repairs needed when they hit a deer on a public highway.

1130.title: Providing qualified entities access to the West Virginia Central Abuse Registry
1130.description: This bill is intended to provide qualified entities access to the FBI database through the West Virginia State Police Criminal Records system in addition the information contained in the West Virginia Central Abuse Registry (which includes the West Virginia Sex Offender Registry) and at the reduced rate.

1131.title: Relating to the Water Resources Protection and Management Act
1131.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the continuation of the water resources survey; authorize DEP to develop a state water resources management plan; and authorize designation of regional and critical area water resources planning areas and plans.

1132.title: Explaining all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales
1132.description: The purpose of this bill is to clearly explain all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales.

1133.title: Including a parenting plan with an application for a marriage license
1133.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a parenting plan to be included with an application for a marriage license.

1134.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1134.title: Extending the required period between rabies vaccination for dogs and cats to three years
1134.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the required period between rabies vaccination for dogs and cats to three years.

1135.title: Allowing fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal
1135.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow fireworks displays on public school property upon approval of the State Superintendent of Schools and the State Fire Marshal.

1136.title: Relating to equal pay for all state magistrates
1136.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that all magistrates be paid equally.

1137.title: West Virginia Military Authority Act
1137.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the West Virginia National Guard to receive federal and state funds for national security and homeland security purposes; to develop and administer security programs; and the hiring of employees.

1138.title: Eliminating West Virginia income tax on social security benefits
1138.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate West Virginia income tax on social security benefits.

1139.title: Prohibiting sex offenders from residing in certain areas
1139.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the safety of the community by prohibiting sexual offenders from residing in certain areas.

1140.title: Relating to requirements for PROMISE scholarships
1140.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide West Virginia students with a partial PROMISE scholarship for schooling outside the state for the reason that no in-state institution offers a course for a major or a degree in the desired field; and to require applicants and recipients of PROMISE scholarships to perform community services.

1141.title: Relating to zoning ordinance adoption by election or otherwise
1141.description: Relating to zoning ordinance adoption by election or otherwise

1142.title: Providing classifications of licensees to be licensed by the State Fire Marshal to engage in fire protection work
1142.description: The purpose of this bill is to add classifications of licensees to be licensed by the State Fire Marshal to engage in fire protection work.

1143.title: Relating to the reimbursement of costs for newborn screenings
1143.description: Relating to the reimbursement of costs for newborn screenings

1144.title: Authorizing the Whitewater Commission to establish a fee to stock trout on the Gauley River by legislative rule
1144.description: Authorizing the Whitewater Commission to establish a fee to stock trout on the Gauley River by legislative rule

1145.title: Relating to reports by health care providers of persons incompetent to drive an automobile
1145.description: Relating to reports by health care providers of persons incompetent to drive an automobile

1146.title: Allowing certain state employees to be paid for unused sick leave days once per year
1146.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees hired prior to July 1, 2001 to be paid for unused sick leave days once per year; including those employees who have had their jobs eliminated since January 1, 2006.

1147.title: Establishing multidisciplinary investigative teams in adult protective services
1147.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish multidisciplinary investigative teams within each county of the state, provide for cooperation and outline the responsibilities of the investigative team in adult protective services.

1148.title: Altering the definition of criminal neglect
1148.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter the definition of criminal neglect to be congruent as defined in §61-2-29.

1149.title: Permitting internet sales of life and accident and sickness insurance
1149.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit Internet sales of life and accident and sickness insurance.

1150.title: Health Insurance for Employees
1150.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that workers on public improvement projects valued at one million dollars or more  be covered by health care insurance.

1151.title: Setting forth the qualifications and reinstatement conditions of sanitarians
1151.description: The purpose of this bill sets forth the qualifications and reinstatement conditions of sanitarians. The bill increases the application fee and does not permit registrations to be renewed unless continuing education requirements are met. The bill also permits a board member whose term has expired to continue to serve until such time as the Governor's replacement has been approved by the Senate.

1152.title: Reforming the school aid formula by reducing the regular levy deducted from county boards of education
1152.description: The purpose of this bill is to reform the school aid formula by reducing the regular levy deducted from county boards of education for general current expense purposes by 50% of the growth in local share from 5 years prior.

1153.title: Allowing guidance counselors to compete equally for all guidance counselor positions
1153.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow guidance counselors to compete equally for all guidance counselor positions regardless of whether the position is posted for the elementary grade levels or the secondary grade levels.

1154.title: Relating generally to the ethical standards of public officers, employees and lobbyists
1154.description: Relating generally to the ethical standards of public officers, employees and lobbyists

1155.title: Placing the Weatherization Program under the control of the Division of Energy
1155.description: The purpose of this bill is to place the Weatherization Program under the control of the Division of Energy.

1156.title: Relating to municipalities that impose user fees
1156.description: The purpose of this bill is to require municipalities that impose user fees to impose the fee on all users who reside within the municipality and allowing for exemptions and prohibiting municipalities from imposing user fees on certain persons who reside outside the municipality.

1157.title: Allowing county commissions to regulate subdivisions and land development without adopting a plan
1157.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county commissions to regulate subdivisions and land development without adopting a comprehensive plan.

1158.title: Requiring mandatory community service upon conviction of a misdemeanor offense of driving under the influence and creating a central registry
1158.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mandatory community service upon conviction of a misdemeanor offense of driving under the influence and creation of a central registry of persons convicted of driving under the influence.

1159.title: Suspending the future issuing of new video lottery licenses
1159.description: The purpose of this bill is to suspend the future issuing of new video lottery licenses; no new licenses may be issued unless expressly authorized by the Legislature.

1160.title: Updating the licensing requirements for physicians and podiatrists
1160.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the licensing requirements for physicians and podiatrists.  It extends the time period for passing all steps of the examination from seven to ten years.  Applicants who fail any one of the three steps of the examination in three attempts must appear before the board for a determination as to any further licensure requirements.

1161.title: Prohibiting illegal aliens from obtaining in-state tuition rates at state colleges and universities
1161.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit illegal aliens from obtaining in-state tuition rates at state colleges and universities.

1162.title: Authorizing the county sheriff to charge a fee for conducting drug screens for the Department of Health and Human Resources
1162.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the county sheriff to access a $25 fee for conducting drug screens for the Department of Health and Human Resources.

1163.title: Exempting law-enforcement officers on official duty form paying tolls on the turnpike
1163.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt law-enforcement officers who are on duty from paying any tolls on the West Virginia Turnpike.

1164.title: Permitting a five hundred dollar credit against personal income tax for the purchase of new wood and pellet stoves
1164.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a five hundred dollar credit against personal income tax for the purchase of new wood and pellet stoves that meet certain criteria. The bill also permits a yearly two hundred fifty dollar tax credit for the purchase of pellets.

1165.title: Relating to limitations the court may impose to the allocation of responsibility under a parenting plan if a parent has made two or more unsubstantiated or false reports of domestic violence or child abuse
1165.description: The purpose of this bill is to add if a parent has made two or more unsubstantiated or false reports of domestic violence or child abuse, then upon the request of either parent, the court may determine if limitations should be imposed upon the allocated responsibility.

1166.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1166.title: Requiring registration as kennel by persons who maintain twenty or more dogs or cats
1166.description: The purpose of this bill is to require registration as a kennel by persons who maintain twenty or more adult dogs or cats.

1167.title: Prohibiting lottery form using minors in advertising during school hours
1167.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of minors during school time by the lottery for lottery advertisements.

1168.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1168.title: Requiring physicians and medical institutions to report where abortions have been performed due to perceived congenital defects of fetuses
1168.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians and medical institutions to report instances where abortions have been performed due to perceived congenital defects of fetuses while providing a civil penalty for failing to report an abortion.

1169.title: Providing for continuing contract status for teachers and establishing dismissal and suspension procedures
1169.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for continuing contract status for teachers and establish dismissal and suspension procedures.

1171.title: Providing that the transfer of development rights are renewable
1171.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that transfer of development rights are renewable; making the rights transferred be for twenty years and a reversion of twenty years; and authorizing the county commission to stagger the time rights transferred.

1172.title: Prohibiting the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals
1172.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the placement of automated teller machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals and to only allow fraternal and veterans organizations to renew their licenses for limited video lottery.

1173.title: Appointing an additional circuit court judge to the ninth judicial circuit
1173.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize an additional judge to the 9th Judicial Circuit consisting of Mercer County.

1174.title: Eradicating limited video lottery after the thirtieth day of June, two thousand eleven
1174.description: The purpose of this bill is to eradicate limited video lottery after the thirtieth day of June, two thousand eleven.

1175.title: Giving the owners of newly constructed homes a ten-year grace period before a connection to a newly installed sewer line is mandatory
1175.description: The purpose of this bill is to give owners of newly constructed homes a ten-year grace period before a connection to a newly installed sewer line is mandatory, provided the home is not sold within that ten-year period.

1176.title: Protecting the privacy of a person's prescription information
1176.description: The purpose of the bill is to protect the privacy of a person's prescription information.

1177.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
1177.title: Relating to the legal employment status of West Virginia workers
1177.description: The purpose of this bill is to require public employers and those contractors and subcontractors who contract with the state to register and participate in the Department of Homeland Security's Federal Work Authorization Program; update the code to comply with corresponding federal law; and discourage discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity and national origin.

1178.title: West Virginia Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Act
1178.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Act, to require public improvement contractors to have and implement a drug-free workplace program that requires drug and alcohol testing be conducted by a contractor.

1179.title: Providing an exemption from workers' compensation in certain circumstances for volunteer fire departments
1179.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that volunteer fire departments are not required to pay into the Workers' Compensation Fund for time during which they are not performing on- duty functions.

1180.title: Relating to the Emergency Medical Services Retirement System
1180.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the definitions of "early retirement age", "full-time employment" and "political subdivision"; specify the date contributions are due the fund and provide for delinquency fees; clarify language relating to the purchase of prior service and provide for delinquency fees; make a correction to the heading in section ten of this article; eliminate the minimum amount required for eligible direct rollover distributions; allow for rollover distributions totaling less than two hundred dollars; clarify language relating to the benefit awarded for a duty disability; add provisions for payment of additional death benefits; clarify the language relating to the effective date for receipt of a duty disability benefit; and make a correction to the time period for which an interim study shall be conducted on the potential effects of the implementation of this plan.

1181.title: Relating to the Streamlined Sales and Service Tax and Use Tax and the West Virginia Consumer Sales and Service Tax and Use Tax
1181.description: The purpose of this bill is to conform the provisions of the West Virginia Streamlined Sales and Use Tax statute, West Virginia Code §11-15B, to the current provisions of the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement as amended, to provide certain definitions of terms and to make certain technical and typographical corrections.

1183.title: Authorizing a part-time prosecuting attorney to elect to be full-time if the State Auditor determines there is sufficient funding
1183.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a part-time prosecuting attorney to request the State Auditor's opinion regarding whether a county has sufficient funding to employ a full- time prosecuting attorney; to authorize the part-time  prosecuting attorney to elect to be a full-time prosecuting attorney if the State Auditor determines there is sufficient funding; and providing a salary.

1184.title: Testing school bus operators every other year
1184.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow school bus drivers to only be tested once every two years if they are regularly employed as a school bus operator.

1185.title: Prohibiting banks or lending institutions from increasing credit card or any sort of loan interest rate due to the failure of the borrower to pay any other nonrelated debt
1185.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit banks or lending institutions from increasing credit card or any sort of loan interest rate due to the failure of the borrower to pay any other nonrelated debt.

1186.title: Increasing the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits
1186.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits of municipalities from five percent to six percent, with the increase being deposited into the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund for distribution to counties.

1187.title: Relating to continuing education for insurance producers
1187.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for carry-over of hours of continuing education required for individual insurance producers into the following biennial reporting period.

1188.title: Changing the definition of "small employer" to include the self-employed
1188.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of "small employer" to include the self-employed.

1189.title: Providing nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education
1189.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education through continuing contracts and dismissal for cause.

1190.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
1190.title: Changing the name of the Division of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans Assistance
1190.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the name of the Division of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans Assistance.

1191.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
1191.title: Enabling veterans killed in action after the twentieth century to have their names inscribed on the Veterans Memorial on the State Capitol Complex
1191.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable veterans killed in action after the twentieth century to have their names inscribed on the Veterans Memorial on the State Capitol Complex.

1192.title: Allowing retiring public employees to have credit for similar service out-of-state
1192.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow retiring public employees to have credit for similar service out-of-state to meet eligibility requirements for retirement purposes.

1193.title: Relating to updating the foreclosure process on trust deeds
1193.description: Relating to updating the foreclosure process on trust deeds

1194.title: Increasing the pay grade of cafeteria managers
1194.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the pay grade of cafeteria managers.

1195.title: Relating to how cost is determined in retail businesses
1195.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow retail store owners to markup nonintoxicating beer up to twenty percent for retail sale.

1196.title: Providing a tax credit for scholarship donations
1196.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for scholarship donations.

1197.title: Attracting private investment for the financing, construction and operation of additional lodging units at Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park
1197.description: The purpose of this bill is to attract private investment for financing, construction and operation of additional public cottages at Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park.  The bill authorizes and directs the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate rules regarding the granting of long-term lodging unit usage and related rights and privileges to private parties on commercially reasonable terms that are deemed appropriate, desirable or necessary by the Director to attract additional private investment for such purposes.

1198.title: Requiring accident and sickness insurance providers and HMO's to cover the treatment of Lyme disease
1198.description: The purpose of this bill is to require accident and sickness insurance providers and health maintenance organizations to cover certain Lyme disease treatments.

1199.title: Limiting members of the Board of Pharmacy to two full terms
1199.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit members of the Board of Pharmacy to two full terms.

1200.title: Authorizing regional jail employees to carry a firearm after receiving appropriate certification
1200.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize regional jail employees to carry a firearm after receiving appropriate certification; and expanding their arrest authority.

1201.title: West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act
1201.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

1202.title: Relating to the crime victims compensation program
1202.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow awards, under the crime victims compensation program, to be made to victims of identity theft.

1203.title: Relating to the licensing of private investigators and security guards
1203.description: The purpose of this bill is to strengthen enforcement in the private investigating and security guard field by revising the current law governing the licensing of private investigators and security guards. It modifies the licensing of private investigators and security guards, with exceptions for federal officers, provides for the registration of private investigative and security guard employees, and provides penalties for late registration and fees and charges for services of the Secretary of State.

1204.title: Relating to the Consolidated Public Retirement Board
1204.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Division of Corrections Retirement System to be administered by the Consolidated Public Retirement Board.  The bill provides definitions; effective dates; federal qualification requirements; membership standards; required contributions from members and employers; the creation of the West Virginia Division of Corrections Retirement Fund; transfer from Public Employees Retirement System; time limits; notice requirement; commencement of benefits; providing for retirement credited through member's use of accrued annual or sick leave; providing retirement benefits; annuity options; providing for refunds in certain circumstances; deferred retirement; providing for forfeitures of benefits; providing awards and benefits for duty-related disability and for other causes; requiring physical examinations; establishing criteria for termination of disability; providing awards and benefits to surviving spouse and additional death benefits and scholarships for dependent children; providing for burial benefit; establishing exemption from taxation, garnishment and other process; authorizing certain deductions; establishing the effect of qualified domestic relation orders; prohibiting fraud and establishing penalties; requiring repayment in certain circumstances; providing for treatment of prior military service; establishing effective date of the system; providing voluntary employer participation; establishing starting date for benefits; and providing for no forfeiture of benefits if the system terminates.

1205.title: Providing a state tax deduction for amounts paid for health insurance under certain circumstances
1205.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a state tax deduction for amounts paid for health insurance. The bill provides up to an eight thousand dollar tax deduction from taxable income for amounts paid for health insurance plans not backed by an employer or state or federal government.

1206.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
1206.title: Creating the Traumatic Brain Injury Services Commission
1206.description: The purpose of this article is to create a new commission for the service to veterans and others suffering from traumatic brain injuries.

1207.last_action: To House Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
1207.title: Removing certain exceptions in the definitions of employer and employee covered by the West Virginia minimum wage law
1207.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove certain exceptions in the definitions of employer and employee covered by the West Virginia minimum wage law.

1208.title: Authorizing a salary increase for civil service employees at state hospitals that did not receive a salary increase in 2007
1208.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a $2,000 salary increase for civil service employees at state hospitals that did not receive a $2,000 salary increase in 2007.

1209.title: Exempting voluntary associations and nonprofit organizations from the annual fee of Secretary of State as attorney-in-fact
1209.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt voluntary associations and nonprofit organizations from the annual fee of Secretary of State as attorney-in-fact.

1210.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
1210.title: Designating the seventh day of December, "Pearl Harbor Day," as a legal state holiday
1210.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate the seventh day of December, "Pearl Harbor Day," as a legal state holiday.

1211.title: Verification of Lawful Presence within the United States
1211.description: The purpose of this bill is to require state agencies and political subdivisions thereof to verify the lawful presence within the United States of any applicant for certain public benefits.

1212.title: Capping the amount paid into the Berkeley County Library Fund by the Berkeley County Court
1212.description: The purpose of this bill is to cap the amount paid into the Berkeley County Public Library Fund by the Berkeley County Court.

1213.title: Reducing the term of suspension to no more than six months, except for serious traffic offenses
1213.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the term of suspension of driver's license to no more than six months, except for serious traffic offenses and driving under the influence.

1214.title: Providing a cost-of-living provision for certain persons under the Teachers Retirement System
1214.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living provision for certain persons under the Teachers Retirement System.

1215.last_action: To House  Veterans Affairs and Homeland Security
1215.title: Exempting all military income from personal income taxes
1215.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt all military income from personal income taxes beginning in two thousand nine.

1216.title: Prohibiting sex offenders from residing in certain areas and subjecting convicted sex offenders to global positional system monitoring
1216.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the safety of the community by prohibiting sexual offenders from residing in certain areas and to subject persons convicted of sexual offenses against minors who are on parole or probation to global positioning system monitoring for the duration of their life.

1217.title: Making changes to the combined tax reporting requirements for the West Virginia corporate net income tax and business franchise tax and reducing the Corporation Net Income Tax rate
1217.description: The purpose of this bill is to make technical and policy refinements to combined tax reporting requirements for the West Virginia corporate net income tax and business franchise tax, and to reduce the Corporation Net Income Tax rate starting January 1, 2009.

1219.title: Increasing the penalties for overtaking and passing a school bus
1219.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for overtaking and passing a school bus.

1220.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1220.title: Relating to the valuation of managed timberland
1220.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit classification of real property as managed timberland to prevent county property tax revenues from decreasing by more than five percent.

1221.title: Providing a cost-of-living provision for certain public employee retirement annuitants
1221.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living provision for certain public employee retirement annuitants.

1222.title: Allowing persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim
1222.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim.

1223.title: Exempting persons with a masters or a doctorate degree in marriage or family therapy from being licensed
1223.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt persons with masters or a doctorate degree in marriage or family therapy from  being licensed.

1224.title: Authorizing the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to sign National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permits
1224.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to sign National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permits.

1225.title: Providing a corporate tax credit for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees
1225.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a corporate net income tax credit of $2,000 per employee, per year, against the net corporate income tax for qualified health insurance policies provided by corporate employers to employees.  The maximum yearly tax credit for eligible corporations would total $30,000.

1226.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1226.title: Establishing the Consent to Health Care of Minors Act
1226.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Consent to Health Care of Minors Act, allowing for a caregiver who is not a parent, legal custodian or guardian of a minor to consent to health care for a minor through an affidavit.  The bill provides for revocation and termination of consent, good faith reliance on the affidavit, exceptions to an affidavit's applicability, penalties for a false statement in an affidavit of consent, and rule making authority.

1227.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1227.title: Prohibiting wagering at animal fighting ventures and providing penalty
1227.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit wagering at animal fighting ventures and providing a felony criminal penalty.

1228.title: Requiring annual adjustments of certain provider payments
1228.description: The purpose of this bill is to require annual adjustments of certain provider payments under agreements entered into under the provisions of chapters 16 (Public Health), 27 (Mentally Ill Persons) or 49 (Child Welfare) of the West Virginia Code, based on the nonseasonally-adjusted employment cost index issued by the United States Department of Labor.

1229.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1229.title: Prohibiting cloning human embryos in state medical schools, colleges or universities
1229.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit cloning human embryos in state medical schools, colleges or universities; and dismissal from employment for violation of section.

1230.title: Prohibiting mining on cemetery land
1230.description: The purpose of this bill is to require operators of mining sites to include the affects mining will have on cemeteries in close proximity to or included on the mining site.

1231.title: Directing the State Board of Education to develop a program of instruction on macroeconomics
1231.description: The purpose of this bill is to help better prepare the youth of West Virginia to succeed in life by providing them with an understanding of the great economic system known as capitalism.  This bill would direct the State Board of Education to develop a program of instruction on macroeconomics, the curriculum to include the basic principles of capitalism, the role capitalism played in the founding of our country and the writing of the United States Constitution, and the positive results capitalism has produced in the United States by improving our citizens' quality of life.

1232.title: Providing noise restrictions for residential areas outside incorporated municipalities
1232.description: The purpose of this bill is to maintain the peace in rural residential areas by providing for a public nuisance law for residential areas outside incorporated municipalities.

1233.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the state Bureau of Senior Services
1233.description: Making a supplementary appropriation to the state Bureau of Senior Services

1234.title: Requiring the Legislature to appropriate funds to the Small Claims Compensation Fund every six months
1234.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Legislature to appropriate funds to the Small Claims Compensation Fund every six months.

1235.title: Relating to the renewal or extension of a cellular telephone contract
1235.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the renewal or extension of a cellular telephone contract over the telephone without reducing the terms to writing an unfair or deceptive act or practice; and make the charging of a cancellation fee for cancelling telephone cellular service without a proper written contract illegal an unfair or deceptive act or practice.

1236.title: Giving credit for energy savings when a solar heating water system is installed on a residential property
1236.description: The purpose of this bill is to give credit for energy savings when a solar heating water system is installed on a residential property.

1237.title: Relating to special district excise tax authorization
1237.description: The purpose of this bill is to prescribe the base and rate of tax for purposes of the special district excise taxes imposed pursuant to the authorizing code sections, and to grant the State Tax Commissioner discretion to require electronic filing of returns and prescribe rules relating to the electronic filing of returns related to such taxes, and to require the electronic payment of such taxes and prescribe rules relating to payment of such taxes, and prescribing what such rules shall contain, and to authorize sharing of tax information with bond trustees and authorize secondary sharing of such information with the bond issuers, bondholders and bond counsel and to make such trustees, bondholders and bond counsel subject to the confidentiality requirements for tax information set forth in West Virginia Code.

1238.title: Relating to a study and investigation on issues in connection with creating a pilot program for child day care centers operated by the state
1238.description: Relating to a study and investigation on issues in connection with creating a pilot program for child day care centers operated by the state

1239.title: Requiring gaming facilities to issue monthly statements that list patrons' gaming winnings and losses
1239.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Lottery Commission to require gaming facilities to issue monthly statements that list patrons' gaming winnings and losses, when a card or other data collecting method is used for this information.

1240.title: Giving state institutions of higher education more flexibility in the planning and operation of their schools
1240.description: The purpose of this bill is to give state institutions of higher education more flexibility in the planning and operation of their schools.

1241.title: Updating safety rules and regulations pertaining to walkways along railtracks
1241.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Service Commission to institute additional rulemaking proceedings to update safety rules and regulations pertaining to walkways along railtracks.

1242.title: Requiring that warranty provisions for new motor vehicles are equally applicable to motor vehicles purchased inside or outside the state
1242.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to require that warranty provisions for new motor vehicles are equally applicable to motor vehicles purchased inside or outside the state.

1243.title: Increasing protection to beneficiaries of structured settlements as they relate to settlement transfers
1243.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase protection to beneficiaries of structured settlements as they relate to settlement transfers.

1244.title: Relating to the spouse and dependent insurance coverage under the West Virginia Public Employees' Insurance Act
1244.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend PEIA coverage for pregnancy related conditions to covered dependants.

1246.title: Relating to health reimbursement accounts for local government employees
1246.description: Relating to health reimbursement accounts for local government employees

1247.title: Allowing e-notification by using e-certified cards for verification of certified mail acceptance to the court of origin for service of process
1247.description: Allowing e-notification by using e-certified cards for verification of certified mail acceptance to the court of origin for service of process

1248.title: Viatical Settlements Act
1248.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the business of viatical settlements between insureds and viatical settlement companies with respect to life insurance policies. This bill will regulate how the company will operate its business; will require licensing of the company, as well as its brokers; and help to limit fraudulent practices.

1249.title: Collaborative Family Law Proceedings
1249.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for a collaborative law procedure whereby parties involved in family law proceedings may agree to resolve their disputes on an agreed basis without having to resort to judicial intervention.

1250.title: Specifying that infrastructure projects providing broadband services facilities be included in infrastructure projects eligible for funding from the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund
1250.description: The purpose of this bill is to specify that infrastructure projects providing broadband services facilities be included in infrastructure projects eligible for funding from the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund.  The bill also provides for including the feasibility of inclusion of broadband transmission lines concomitant with the construction of new roads and that construction of broadband transmission lines may be funded from the infrastructure road improvement reserve account within the infrastructure fund.  The bill also removes the limitation of the amount of funds which may be annually transferred to the account.

1251.title: Exempting acts resulting in the taking or damaging of private property for public use from the immunity granted to a political subdivision
1251.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt takings, including regulatory takings, from the immunity granted to a political subdivision.

1252.title: Exempting from taxation certain property owned by a nonprofit organization
1252.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from taxation certain property owned by a nonprofit organization for housing and religious and leadership training to college and university students.

1253.title: Relating to establishing minimum deductions
1253.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish minimum deductions from salary payments due the employees and to allow governing boards to increase their contributions to employee retirement plans to one that exceeds the contributions of employees.

1254.title: Providing per diem pay for volunteers who drive veterans to hospitals
1254.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a $50 per diem pay and mileage and expenses for volunteers who drive veterans to hospitals that are more than 30 miles from their home or local VA office.

1255.title: Eliminating the six month waiting period for those in the Teachers Retirement System to receive disability retirement benefits
1255.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the six month waiting period for those in the Teachers Retirement System to receive disability retirement benefits.

1256.title: Relating to state government construction contracts
1256.description: The purpose of this bill is to require disclosure of general and subcontractors license within two hours of the close of bids to the contracting public entity for review prior to the award of a contract.

1257.title: Relating to the control of noise pollution
1257.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for mitigation of construction noise by the Department of Environmental Protection.

1258.title: Providing a tax credit for new job creation by certain taxpayers
1258.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to taxpayers which do not satisfy the new jobs percentage requirement prescribed for the credit allowed under chapter eleven, article thirteen Q.

1259.title: Modifying the check cashing service fee
1259.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the check cashing service fee making it consistent with the national average which is 3%-government, 5%-payroll and 10% for personal checks of the face value of the check cashed.

1260.title: Providing that a recognizance secured by execution of a bail bond is void upon the finding that the accused is guilty
1260.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a recognizance secured by execution of a bail bond is void upon the finding that the accused person is guilty, and to terminate bond liability at that time.

1261.title: Giving county school superintendents more flexibility and ease in placing service personnel workers in positions of need on a day-to-day basis
1261.description: The purpose of this bill is to give county school superintendents more flexibility and ease in placing service personnel workers in positions of need on a day-to-day basis.

1262.title: Relating to providing the Dangerous and Vicious Dog Act
1262.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate dangerous and vicious dogs within the state of West Virginia and to provide regulatory requirements for owners or custodians of dangerous and criminal penalties for failing to comply with the provisions. The bill also creates misdemeanor penalties for owners or custodians of dangerous or vicious dogs that cause injury or death of a person or persons and domestic animals.

1263.title: Relating to approval of a student for homebound services and their rights
1263.description: Relating to approval of a student for homebound services and their rights

1264.title: Creating a funding mechanism for Child Advocacy Centers from the Crime Victim's Compensation Fund
1264.description: Creating a funding mechanism for Child Advocacy Centers from the Crime Victim's Compensation Fund

1265.title: Expanding the definition of limited health service
1265.description: Expanding the definition of limited health service

1266.title: Making changes to workers' compensation insurance
1266.description: The purpose of this bill is to make changes to the workers' compensation code to reflect the transition from a monopolistic system.  The bill would prohibit government contracts with employers in default of certain compensation-related payments and permit the Insurance Commissioner to employ certain enforcement procedures to such employers.  It also sets certain rates for surcharges on insured employers and makes various revisions to the litigation system for compensation claims.  It would also increase the salaries of the members of the Board of Review.

1267.title: Relating to the deployment of broadband to the remaining unserved areas of the state
1267.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Broadband Deployment Council and to develop a strategy and mechanism to be employed in extending broadband to every West Virginian by stimulating demand for broadband services and by constructing the necessary infrastructure to meet that demand.

1268.title: Relating to the recording of certain geologic information
1268.description: The purpose of this bill is to require coal prospectors to record certain geological information and to report said information to the department of environmental protection.  The bill also provides for the sharing of geological information recorded by coal and well operators with the state geological and economic survey.  Finally, the bill provides for the filing of core samples taken by coal prospectors and well operators and the submission of said samples to the state geological and economic survey.

1269.title: OxyContin Asset Forfeiture Fund
1269.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the OxyContin Asset Forfeiture Fund.

1270.title: Mandating the State Bar through the Insurance Commissioner require lawyers to use doctors chosen for an independent panel
1270.description: The purpose of this bill is to mandate the State Bar through the Insurance Commissioner require lawyers to use doctors chosen for an independent panel.

1271.title: Providing for a Public Service Commission investigation for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission
1271.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a Public Service Commission investigator for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission and in which an individual suffers severe bodily injury or death.

1272.title: Authorizing the Commissioner of Highways to seek the advice of, and consult with, county commissions and prosecuting attorneys with regard to all roads in and outside of the state road system
1272.description: The purpose of this bill is to specifically authorize the Commissioner of Highways to seek the advice of, and consult with, county commissions and prosecuting attorneys with regard to all roads in and outside of the state road system located in their counties.

1273.title: Requiring the West Virginia Development Office to pursue the establishment of an Office of Minority Business Development
1273.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage the development of minority businesses in this state by establishing an Office of Minority Business Development within the West Virginia Development Office.

1274.title: Relating to the forfeiture of bail
1274.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the provision allowing a bail posted by someone other than the person under bail to be forfeited for failure to comply with a condition of bail, other than that to appear.

1275.title: Providing adequate care for pastured race horses
1275.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide pastured racehorses with care that is the same or substantially similar to the care they received when being used for racing purposes.

1276.title: Including a tax checkoff option for Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp
1276.description: The purpose of this bill is to include on the state personal income tax return a checkoff option to donate some or all of any tax refund to the "Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp Checkoff Program" for the operation of the camp.

1277.title: Requiring county commissions to hold public hearings on public question elections
1277.description: The purpose of this bill is to require county commissions to hold public hearings to gather public opinion and comments prior to public question elections.

1278.title: Defining "caving" as a recreational purpose and activity for which a landowner's liability for injury is limited
1278.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "caving" as a recreational purpose and activity for which a landowner's liability for injury is limited.

1279.title: Increasing certain penalties for persons convicted of domestic battery and domestic assault
1279.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase certain penalties for persons convicted of domestic battery and domestic assault including the requirement that they complete an approved batterers' course.

1280.title: Electing all justices to the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and all circuit court judges on a nonpartisan basis
1280.description: The purpose of this bill is to elect all justices to the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and all circuit court judges on a nonpartisan basis.

1281.title: Consolidating all gaming-related functions within the Department of Revenue into a single gaming commission
1281.description: The purpose of this bill is to consolidate all gambling- related functions within the Department of Revenue into a single gaming commission.  The State Gaming Commission would also include the current state athletic (boxing) commission.

1282.title: Insuring that tobacco products are not sold in any packaging other than the original
1282.description: The purpose of this bill is to insure that tobacco products are not sold in any packaging other than the original factory wrapped package and to insure that cigarettes are not sold individually.

1283.title: Permitting the sale of nonintoxicating beer within three hundred feet from a church that consents to the sale
1283.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a beer licensee to locate within three hundred feet of a church if agreed to by the church under certain circumstances.

1284.title: Limiting the use of some lands for nonenergy related purposes in "growth counties"
1284.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of some lands for nonenergy related purposes in "growth counties."

1285.title: Relating to assessed property valuations
1285.description: The purpose of this bill is to limiting the valuation of any property still owned by the same person or persons who owned the property at the time of the previous periodic valuation, the property's assessed value may not be greater than one and seventy-five thousandths times the previous assessed valuation.

1286.title: Requiring lobbyists and lawyers providing lobbying services to pay service tax
1286.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lobbyists and lawyers when performing lobbying services to pay service tax.

1287.title: Establishing a business franchise tax credit to certain home builders
1287.description: This bill gives a ten per cent franchise tax credit to those home builders who sell more than ten homes for less than two hundred, fifty thousand dollars that are greater than one thousand, two square feet, provided those homes are sold to public school teachers who are in the state's five counties that have the highest percentage of teachers who are less than "highly qualified."

1288.title: Specifying certain terms of participation in the Public Employees Insurance Agency
1288.description: Specifying certain terms of participation in the Public Employees Insurance Agency

1289.title: Relating to the use of tax exempt property by auctioneers
1289.description: Relating to the use of tax exempt property by auctioneers

1290.title: Relating to procedures for municipal police officers and firemen investigations and hearings
1290.description: Relating to procedures for municipal police officers and firemen investigations and hearings

1291.title: Eliminating civil service protection for probationary law-enforcement officers
1291.description: Eliminating civil service protection for probationary law-enforcement officers

1292.title: Requiring the DMV to notify the state police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle
1292.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Division of Motor Vehicles to notify the West Virginia State Police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle.

1293.title: Adding one magistrate to Wood County
1293.description: The purpose of this bill is to add one magistrate to Wood County.

1294.title: Clarifying the purpose of the Purchasing Division
1294.description: This bill clarifies the purpose of the Purchasing Division by omitting the reference to leasing; requires bids to be based on written specifications; permits director to effectively negotiate; repeals the requirement for the director to establish a central duplicating office; clarifies resident, veteran, small and minority vendor preferences; provides a preference for vendors which use products manufactured in West Virginia; and permits the state agency for surplus property to sell commodities to the general public at the posted price.

1295.title: Herbert Henderson Office of Minority Affairs
1295.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Herbert Henderson Office of Minority Affairs as a cabinet in the Governor's office.

1296.title: Providing for access to driver's license information to licensed private investigators and licensed security services
1296.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for access to driver's license information to licensed private investigators and licensed security services.

1297.title: Exempting the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax
1297.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax.

1298.title: Creating the West Virginia Addictions Treatment and Recovery Fund
1298.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Addictions Treatment and Recovery Fund by dedicating five cents per ounce of the uniform price of alcoholic liquors sold in this state to the fund.

1299.title: Creating multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses
1299.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to create multi-year hunting, fishing and trapping licenses in increments of three, five or ten years.  The director is authorized to set fees for the multi-year licenses by legislative rule.

1300.title: Authorizing the Public Employees Insurance Agency to charge interest to employers on amounts not paid on time
1300.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Public Employees Insurance Agency to charge interest to employers upon amounts not paid on time.

1301.title: Relating to confidential records
1301.description: The purpose of this bill is authorize the chief technology officer to receive confidential records and have access to agencies' databases which may contain confidential information, while accepting the responsibility to safeguard this information as defined by applicable law.

1302.title: Authorizing certified animal euthanasia technicians to administer a sedative to an animal prior to euthanizing
1302.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize certified animal euthanasia technicians to administer a sedative to an animal prior to euthanizing if warranted to humanely euthanize the animal or to protect the animal euthanasia technician.

1303.title: Jobs Impact Statement
1303.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a jobs impact statement to be completed by the West Virginia Development Office for certain proposed legislation which may cause an impact on the West Virginia economy.

1304.title: Requiring health care providers to release unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing to a parent or legal guardian without written consent from minor
1304.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health care providers to release unemancipated minor's medical records for drug testing to a parent or legal guardian without written consent from minor.

1305.title: Abolishing joint liability and establishing comparative fault
1305.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish joint liability and establish the principle of comparative fault by which each defendant is liable for damages according to the percentage of fault attributed by a judge or jury.

1306.title: Continuing the permissible appropriation of Public Employees Insurance Reserve Fund moneys to the bureau for medical services
1306.description: This bill would continue the permissible appropriation of Public Employees Insurance Reserve Fund moneys to the bureau for medical services of the Department of Health and Human Resources.

1307.title: Reducing the requirement that the Director of Personnel must have five years experience in personnel management
1307.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the requirement that the Director of Personnel must have five years experience in personnel management in order to better the state's recruitment abilities for the position.

1308.title: Relating to itinerant status for school service personnel
1308.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish itinerant status for school service personnel and provide for inclusion of certain information on a notice of job vacancy.

1309.title: Making changes to the Municipal Home Rule Board
1309.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the composition of the Municipal Home Rule Board and change the timetable and responsibilities for the Municipal Home Rule Pilot Program.

1310.title: Allowing for expanded temporary employment of retired state employees in areas of critical need
1310.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for expanded temporary employment of retired state employees in areas of critical need.

1311.title: Clarifying the process and procedure for hearing boards
1311.description: The purpose of this bill is to bring the statutes up to date and clarify the process and procedure for hearing boards.

1312.title: Increasing the fine for littering from fifty dollars to one hundred dollars
1312.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the fine for littering from fifty dollars to one hundred dollars.

1313.title: Relating to carrying concealed pistols or revolvers
1313.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve the concealed handgun license reciprocity process by recognizing any concealed handgun license issued by any other state to a nonresident of this state without the requirement of a reciprocity agreement or recognition of West Virginia permits by the other state as a condition of such recognition.  This bill would continue statutory authorization for the Attorney General to negotiate and execute reciprocity agreements with other states as necessary to secure the recognition of West Virginia concealed handgun licenses in as many other states as possible.

1314.title: Amending the West Virginia Film Industry Investment Act
1314.description: The purpose of the bill is to amend the West Virginia Film Industry Investment Act through clarifying definitions; restricting double use of expenditures for different credits; clarifying the application of the credits; requiring certification of eligibility by the West Virginia Film Office, providing further clarification of the information to be filed by an eligible company; authorizing the transfer or sale of credits; expanding the tax credit review information to be provided to the Legislature; and making the amendments to the article applicable to all taxable years beginning after the thirty-first day of December, two thousand seven.

1315.title: Creating the West Virginia Smoke Detector Act
1315.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Smoke Detector Act which requires evidence that residential property being transferred has an operational smoke detector installed in the immediate vicinity or each sleeping area within all one- to four-family dwellings.

1316.title: Specifying the types of topics that are to be covered in school programs on personal finance
1316.description: The purpose of this bill is to identify the types of topics to be included in courses on personal finance.

1317.title: Directing the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary
1317.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary; and to require the state board to identify these reports to the Legislature with recommendations on how to alleviate the administrative burden of these reports on principals and teachers.

1318.title: Establishing a corporate tax credit up to fifty percent of the corporation's net income tax for contributions to scholarship funds
1318.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to corporations of up to fifty percent of their primary tax liability for contributing to scholarship funds.

1319.title: Clarifying that the Governor appoints the Executive Director of the Development Office with the advice and consent of the Senate
1319.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the Governor appoints the Executive Director of the Development Office with the advice and consent of the Senate, and to preserve the Council for Community and Economic Development for potential future need.

1320.title: Ensuring that homeowners are adequately informed of the nature of the licensed contractor's insurance coverage
1320.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that homeowners are adequately informed, prior to signing a contract for construction, of the nature of the licensed contractor's insurance coverage, including whether the insurance policy will cover damages resulting from faulty workmanship.

1321.title: Establishing the Flexible Leave Act
1321.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Flexible Leave Act allowing for the use of earned leave with pay for an illness in an employee's immediate family.

1322.title: Permitting depositories of state, county, municipal and other public moneys to pool securities
1322.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it easier for banking institutions to maintain the collateral levels needed to serve as depositories of public moneys.  This bill accomplishes this purpose in three ways:  First, depositories for municipal and county deposits already have the ability to place municipal and county deposits in certificates of deposit meeting certain requirements, in lieu of providing a bond or security in lieu of bond and gives depositories of state moneys that same option; Second, this bill permits banking institutions that serve as depositories for public moneys to pool securities in lieu of other bonding and pledging requirements; Finally, this bill permits public depositories to insure public deposits in excess of FDIC limits though a bankers surety bond.

1323.title: Establishing the Athletic Training Licensure Act
1323.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a licensing board to license athletic trainers providing the requirements for licensure and outline the duties and powers of the board.

1324.title: Relating to suspension of drivers license for certain offenses if committed by college students
1324.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit issuance of a temporary license allowing driving to and from college and classes when there was a suspension of drivers license not involving DUI or other serious driving offense committed by college students.

1325.title: Permitting private owners of vehicles to install an interlock system on their vehicle
1325.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit private owners of vehicles to install an interlock system on their vehicle.

1326.title: Relating to registration and operation of mini trucks
1326.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow mini trucks to be licensed in West Virginia for limited use on public highways.

1327.title: Fairness in Public Construction Contract Act
1327.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact a comprehensive prompt payment law which requires public owners to pay contractors undisputed amounts due within thirty days of receiving a proper invoice - and contractors to pay subcontractors within seven days of receiving payment from owners.

1328.title: Providing a tax credit for Ad Valorem tax paid on Manufacturing Inventory
1328.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit for Ad Valorem tax paid on Manufacturing Inventory, and other tangible personal property which will reduce either or both the amount of business franchise tax or corporate net income tax owed, effective the tax year beginning July 1, 2008.

1329.title: Requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle
1329.description: The purpose of this bill is to requiring the Public Service Commission to allow Class I cities to enter into one or more agreements with contract carriers by motor vehicle.

1330.title: Providing standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs
1330.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs and require hospitals to provide free charity care to uninsured citizens one hundred one percent below poverty level and lowered rates to those citizens between one hundred and three hundred percent below poverty level.

1331.title: Relating to fleeing form a law-enforcement officer
1331.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a felony offense for certain persons convicted of fleeing a law-enforcement officer.

1332.title: Providing regulation, penalties, and administration for natural gas and methane gas wells
1332.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide regulation, penalties, and administration for natural gas and methane gas wells.

1333.title: Raising the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines
1333.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the state salary level to at least one hundred twenty-five percent above the Federal Poverty Guidelines.

1334.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Veterans' Affairs
1334.description: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Veterans' Affairs

1335.title: Relating to the distribution of the State Treasurer's "Road Fund"
1335.description: The purpose of this bill is to distribute the State Treasurer's "Road Fund" proportionally in each county according to the tax revenue generated from that county.

1336.title: Providing mandatory carding for all purchases of alcoholic liquor and nonintoxicating beer from a retailer
1336.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide mandatory carding for all purchases of alcoholic liquor and nonintoxicating beer from a retailer.  The bill additionally provides protection from criminal and civil liability for retailers that install transaction scan devices and require their agents, employees and servants to enforce mandatory carding.

1337.title: Bringing the West Virginia Tax Increment Financing Act up to current regulations
1337.description: The purpose of this bill is to bring the West Virginia Tax Increment Financing Act up to current regulations and provide for financing regulations for development of infrastructure.

1338.title: Authorizing use of citations in lieu of arrest warrants for certain offenses
1338.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize law enforcement officers to use citations in lieu of arrest warrants for certain offenses, no longer requiring that a law enforcement officer personally witness a misdemeanor.

1339.title: Relating to allocation of costs for housing inmates who are transferred
1339.description: Relating to allocation of costs for housing inmates who are transferred

1340.title: Providing that counties may petition for additional temporary magistrates to serve during off-hours
1340.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit those counties who see fit to petition the Supreme Court of Appeals for the temporary appointment of a retired magistrate to serve during otherwise off- hours to ascertain if a magistrate on duty during off-hours would reduce incarceration rates and county jail expenses.

1341.title: Establishing a multi-disciplinary commission to study, make findings and recommendations regarding incarceration population and costs
1341.description: The purpose of this bill is to request the Supreme Court of Appeals to establish a multi-disciplinary commission to study, make findings and recommendations regarding incarceration population and costs.

1507.title: "Term Limitations Amendment"
1507.description: The purpose of this resolution is to impose term limitations on legislators.

1508.title: Homestead Exemption Increase Amendment
1508.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase the homestead exemption from $20,000 to $50,000.

1510.title: Dedication of Funding to Natural Resources Amendment
1510.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide constitutionally that the Legislature appropriate one percent of the state's General Revenue Fund to the Division of Natural Resources each fiscal year to be used to promote and preserve the state's natural resources and to fund law-enforcement activities associated with the Department of Natural Resources.

1511.title: Increase of Terms of Members of the Legislature Amendment
1511.description: The purpose of this Resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would increase the terms of members of the House of Delegates from two to four years, and would increase the terms of members of the State Senate from four to six years.

1512.title: Sheriff Terms Amendment
1512.description: The purpose of this resolution is to change the term limit of sheriffs from two to three consecutive terms and to eliminate language stating that if a sheriff has served "any part" of a term then that portion counts as one of the terms.

1513.title: Veto Session Amendment
1513.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to section fourteen, article VII of the West Virginia Constitution, relating to creating a veto session of the Legislature to consider bills vetoed by the Governor.

1514.title: Taxpayer's Bill of Rights Amendment
1514.description: The purpose of this resolution is to restrain the growth of government by limiting the amount of revenues and expenditures.

1515.title: Initiative, Referendum and Recall Amendment
1515.description: The purpose of this Resolution is to amend the State Constitution to give the people the powers of initiative, referendum and recall.

1516.title: Legislative Improvement Amendment
1516.description: The purpose of this Resolution is to amend the Constitution to provide for single senatorial and delegate districts, and for the Senate to be comprised of thirty-four members and the House of Delegates to be comprised of one hundred members.

1517.title: Prohibiting the Governmental Taking of Private Property for Private Use Amendment
1517.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to prohibit the taking of private property for private use.

1518.title: "The Active Duty Armed Services Motor Vehicle Property Tax Amendment"
1518.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the Constitution to exempt a single motor vehicle owned by residents of this state who are serving on active duty in the armed forces of the United States and are stationed outside this state on the date mandated by law for assessment to be made from ad valorem taxes.

1519.title: Elected Consumer Advocate Amendment
1519.description: The purpose of this resolution is to make the Consumer Advocate an elected official.

1520.title: Super-Majority Required for Passage of Tax Bill Amendment
1520.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to propose an amendment to the Constitution to require that bills imposing a tax or license fee and bills increasing the effective rate of any tax levied or fee imposed may not be enacted unless two thirds of the members of each house, present and voting, vote in the affirmative for passage.

1521.title: Amendment clarifying that nothing in the Constitution secures or protects a right to abortion
1521.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to clarify that nothing in the Constitution secures or protects a right to abortion or requires the funding of an abortion.

1522.title: Increasing the term of magistrates from four years to six years
1522.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase magistrates' term of office from four years to six years.

1523.title: The Marriage Protection Amendment
1523.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution in order to prohibit the state from recognizing same sex marriages.

1527.title: Homestead Exemption Freeze Amendment
1527.description: The purpose of this resolution is to freeze the homestead exemption when a person is age sixty-five or older and applies for the exemption unless the person adds significant value through improvements to the home or secures a loan using the home as collateral.
