1528.title: Providing a constitutional procedure for the appointment of a member of the Legislature
1528.description: The purpose of this Joint Resolution is to amend the Constitution to provide a constitutional procedure for the appointment of a member of the Legislature to replace a former member.

1529.title: Elected Insurance Commissioner Amendment
1529.description: The purpose of this resolution is to make the Insurance Commissioner an elected official.

1531.title: Inventory Exemption Amendment
1531.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to authorize the exemption from property taxation, as determined by the Legislature by law, of personal property inventory in the form of raw materials, goods in process and finished goods employed exclusively in or resulting exclusively from manufacturing.

1532.title: Insurance Commissioner as an Elected Officer Amendment
1532.description: The purpose of this resolution is to make the insurance commissioner a constitutionally elected officer and to limit the insurance commissioner to two terms.

1534.title: Judicial Recusal Amendment
1534.description: The purpose of this amendment is to create a judicial commission to determine the recusal of judges in a judicial proceeding.

1535.title: Budget Committee to Introduce the Budget Bill Amendment
1535.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide that the Governor, Speaker of the House of Delegates and President of the Senate shall each prepare and submit a budget bill to the Legislature.

1537.title: Manufacturing Inventory and Tangible Personal Property Tax Exemption Amendment
1537.description: The purpose of this resolution is to authorize the exemption from property taxation of manufacturing inventory and other tangible personal property, as determined by the Legislature.

1538.title: Property Tax Assessment Homestead Limitation Amendment
1538.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would provide for the limiting of the assessed valuation of, and the tax levy rate upon, real property and personal property in the form of a mobile home, used exclusively for residential purposes and occupied as a residence by a resident owner citizen who is over the age of sixty-five or who is permanently or totally disabled (property subject to the current homestead exemption)and owned by a person whose income is less than four hundred percent of the federal poverty level, to not exceed the assessed valuation and levy rate upon the property in the year the property became eligible for the homestead exemption, and to establish a ten percent maximum tax increase on the aforementioned property per year.

1539.title: Warrantless Searches of Homes by Electronic Surveillance Home Searched Amendment
1539.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would allow an agent of the government, without first obtaining a warrant, to obtain information or evidence by means of electronic surveillance in the home of a person when that agent consents to the surveillance and in instances where this is not prohibited by the Fourth Amendment to the United States Constitution.

1540.title: Authorizing Attorney General to investigate and charge certain fuel price gouging
1540.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Office of the Attorney General the power to investigate and charge home heating oil, gasoline or other motor fuel price gouging, at any time.

1541.title: Relating to judges' sentencing discretion for certain youthful offenders
1541.description: The purpose of this bill is to give a circuit judge discretion to impose the original sentence on a youthful offender who has successfully completed a youthful offender training program but who has been charged with committing another crime between his or her release from the youthful offender center and the sentencing hearing.

1542.title: Providing mandatory review of life without parole sentence by Supreme Court
1542.description: The purpose of this bill is to require review of life without parole sentences by the State Supreme Court of Appeals.

1543.title: Requiring Legislative Auditor evaluate Secondary Schools Activities Commission
1543.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the West Virginia Secondary School Activities Commission is subject to evaluation by the Legislative Auditor and require board members and officers to comply with ethical standards for elected and appointed officials.

1544.title: Legalizing and regulating fireworks sale and use
1544.description: The purpose of this bill is to legalize and regulate the selling of fireworks.

1545.title: Providing county boards of education members per diem for mandatory education
1545.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that county board of education members receive $85 per day for mandatory training sessions plus expenses.

1546.title: Establishing Flood Protection Planning Council
1546.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the State Flood Protection Planning Council to coordinate flood protection programs and review and update state flood protection plan.  The bill also establishes the Legislative Oversight Commission on Flooding.

1547.title: Requiring legislative approval for road, highway or bridge memorial designation
1547.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for legislative approval by concurrent resolution before a road, highway or bridge memorial designation.  The bill also clarifies the rule-making procedure of the commissioner of highways.

1548.title: Permitting hunter safety program in public schools
1548.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the State Board of Education to prescribe an orientation program in firearms and firearms safety in the public schools of this state with the advice of the Division of Natural Resources.

1549.title: Providing tax deduction on interest paid on student and automobile loans
1549.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax deduction on interest paid on student loans and automobile loans.

1550.title: Reducing state vehicles' petroleum-based fuel consumption
1550.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that state government exercises leadership in the reduction of petroleum based fuel consumption through improvements in fleet fuel efficiency and the use of alternative fuel vehicles and alternative fuels. Reduced petroleum use and the displacement of petroleum by alternative fuels will help promote markets for more alternative fuel and fuel efficient vehicles, encourage new technologies, enhance West Virginia's energy self-sufficiency and security, and ensure a healthier environment.  The bill provides preferences for providers of alternative fuel capable vehicles and combustion powered machines, and providers of fuels that contain not less than twenty percent alternative fuels.  The bill also requires certification of the plans to reduce fuel consumption for state-owned vehicles to eighty percent of their two thousand six level by two thousand eleven and for state subdivisions to eighty percent of their two thousand nine levels by two thousand fourteen.

1551.title: Increasing one-trip permits fee issued by State Police
1551.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the fee for issuance of one-trip permits and to provide that the State Police retain a portion of the fee for administration and enforcement.

1552.title: Relating to Dental Practice Act generally
1552.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the West Virginia Dental Practice Act by:  Clarifying definitions; clarifying powers of the board; clarifying temporary permits; establishing a special license for volunteers who are retired and volunteer their dental expertise in a clinic setting; and requiring the promulgation of a rule by the board for providing a copy of a complaint to a dentist or dental hygienist.

1553.title: Prohibiting certain employer-sponsored political, religious or labor communications
1553.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit certain employers from  meeting and communicating with employees regarding the employer's political, religious, or labor organizing activities.  The bill also provides a civil remedy for violations.

1554.title: Reducing and eliminating behavioral health care providers severance tax
1554.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce and ultimately eliminate the severance tax imposed on behavioral health care providers.

1555.title: Allowing fire departments certain expenditures for educational and training supplies
1555.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the purchase of up to two thousand dollars worth of educational and training supplies and fire prevention promotional materials by volunteer and part volunteer fire departments.

1556.title: Relating to health care provider tax generally
1556.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax of five percent of the gross receipts of a behavioral health service provider and to allow certain providers to reduce gross receipts by contractual allowances.

1557.title: Allowing paid sick leave to be used as paid family leave
1557.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow employees to use paid accumulated sick leave for paid family leave to care for a family member.

1558.title: Revising immunizations requirements for school children
1558.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide medical and nonmedical exemptions from mandatory immunizations for school children.  The bill would require parents and guardians to assert their conscientious or religious beliefs in an affidavit.  Parents or guardians seeking an exemption for a child would be required to present an affidavit affirming that they have completed and understood an educational course approved by the Commissioner of Public Health regarding the risks and benefits of immunizations, to be provided by the Bureau for Public Health, before the exemption could apply.  Further, the bill would remove students who are not immunized from school in times of emergency or epidemics.  The bill provides that the Commissioner of the Bureau of Health may by rule add or delete diseases for which vaccines are required for school attendance and to reconstitute the Immunization Advisory Committee.

1559.title: Relating to Public Employees Retirement System generally
1559.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the obsolete provisions of §5-10-43 on pro rata reduction of annuities; to remove the requirement that an employee no longer disabled must be returned to his or her former job; to provide for reemployment; to permit administrative hearings before disability retirement termination; to clarify procedures for reapplication by disability retirants whose benefits were terminated for economic causes; to clarify reinstatement interest factors; and to specify that the board may terminate not only early retirement benefits but also regular or disability retirement benefits of someone who has fraudulently obtained them, and may act to recover benefits gained by misrepresentation.  Current code establishes misdemeanor jail and monetary penalties for fraud.

1560.title: Increasing barrel tax on nonintoxicating beer
1560.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the barrel tax on nonintoxicating beer and allocate fifty percent of the tax to the Regional Jail Operations Partial Reimbursement Fund.

1561.title: Providing notice of availability of owner's title insurance
1561.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide notification to purchasers of residential real property that lender's title insurance does not protect them, and that they have the right to obtain coverage in a separate policy for their own protection.

1562.title: Requiring Commissioner of Public Health assess health impact of certain rules proposed by Department of Environmental Protection
1562.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Commissioner of Bureau for Public Health to conduct a public health impact statement assessing the health impact of any new air or water rule, or modification of an existing air or water rule, proposed by the Department of Environmental Protection to insure that no air or water rule is promulgated without substantiating independent medical or scientific evidence that there is no detrimental public health impact from the rule.

1563.title: Providing public employees and retirees with certain advanced directives of living wills and medical powers of attorney
1563.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a copy of advanced directives in the form of living wills, medical powers of attorney and combined medical powers of attorney and living wills to public employees and retirees covered by the PEIA.

1564.title: Authorizing Commissioner of Banking enter into contracts for providing loan reviews
1564.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of Banking to enter into contracts with federally insured depository institutions to provide loan review services by Division of Banking employees.

1565.title: Increasing public employees retirement annuity multiplier
1565.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the multiplier for a retirement annuity in the public employees retirement system from two to two and one-quarter percent.  The bill also deletes language found to be void by the Supreme Court of Appeals.

1566.title: Increasing penalties for underage use or possession of tobacco
1566.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for use or possession of tobacco or tobacco products by a person under eighteen years of age.  The bill increases fines and community service requirements, and upon a second offense, provides for revocation of the person's junior or graduated driver's license until eighteen years of age, or if the person does not yet have a junior or graduated driver's license, the person is ineligible to apply for any type of driver's license until eighteen years of age.

1567.title: Relating to income withholding in child support matters
1567.description: The purpose of this bill is allow the issuance of an income withholding by the Bureau for Child Support Enforcement to toll the running of the statute of limitations in child support cases and to provide that the statute of limitations begins to run when the last child included in the order emancipates.

1568.title: Increasing certain Division of Corrections' employees salaries and increment pay
1568.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the incremental salary for Division of Corrections; to provide salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections; and to provide a $2008.00 salary increase for every employee of the Division of Corrections.

1570.title: Relating to castle doctrine generally
1570.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of force, including deadly force, against an intruder or attacker in a dwelling, residence, or vehicle under certain circumstances.

1571.title: Applying consumers sales and service tax to commercial laundries and linen and garment rental services
1571.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the persons, firms and corporations defined as "commercial laundry" and "linen and garment rental services" conducting business in this state within the definition of manufacturing for consumer sales and use tax purposes.  This bill will insure that "commercial laundry" and "linen and garment rental services" are treated, for consumer sales and use tax purposes, the same as other manufacturing activities.

1572.title: Requiring certain lenders register with Commissioner of Banking
1572.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons engaged in making consumer credit sales and certain other consumer related activities to register with the Commissioner of Banking instead of filing a notification with the Tax Department.  The bill sets forth registration form requirements and provides a registration fee.  Under the bill, certain other organizations and individuals are exempted from the registration requirements.

1573.title: Requiring continuing education of certain consumer lenders
1573.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a license for entities that only take assignment of regulated consumer loans or for entities that only service regulated consumer loans; and require seven hours of continuing education annually for loan originators employed by regulated consumer lender licensees.

1574.title: Limiting mortgage recording tax
1574.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit each county commission imposing a mortgage recording tax of not more than one dollar per thousand dollars.

1575.title: Setting time limitation on enforcement of certain real estate liens
1575.description: The purpose of this bill is to set a ten-year limitation on the enforcement of certain liens on real estate assessed by municipalities.

1576.title: Relating to sale of beverages in public schools
1576.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the serving of soft drinks in elementary, middle or junior high schools during the school day; to require high schools selling or serving soft drinks during the school day to sell and make equally accessible to students healthy beverages; to prohibit the sale or serving of soft drinks in high schools during breakfast and lunch periods; to require that the sale of soft drinks and healthy beverages be administered by the West Virginia Department of Education; requiring profits from the sale of healthy beverages to the benefit of the nutrition program; and prohibiting competitive sales of foods and beverages of minimal nutritional value in the food service areas during meal service periods, pursuant to 7 CFR §210.11(2006)

1577.title: Requiring advance notice of negative credit reports
1577.description: The purpose of this bill is to compel consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of negative credit reports to allow consumers an opportunity to correct any discrepancies before the report is relied upon by a potential creditor.  The bill provides for a cause of action for violations and subjects consumer reporting agencies violating the provisions of the bill to a civil penalty.

1578.title: Adding magistrate deputy clerk for Braxton County
1578.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase, by one, the number of magistrate court deputy clerks that may be appointed and provide that the deputy clerk be appointed in Braxton County.

1579.title: Preventing reduction of disability pensions for certain Public Employees Retirement System members
1579.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five.

1580.title: Relating to false reports of domestic violence or child abuse in child custody matters
1580.description: The purpose of this bill is to add if a parent has made two or more unsubstantiated or false reports of domestic violence or child abuse, then upon the request of either parent, the court may determine if limitations should be imposed upon the allocated responsibility.

1581.title: Relating to criminal invasion of privacy generally
1581.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect the privacy rights of an individual by making it a criminal offense to engage in voyeurism where an individual has expectation of privacy.  This bill makes an exception for law-enforcement and security surveillance.  This bill also limits a criminal prosecution for a misdemeanor pursuant to the section to three years.

1582.title: Providing methods for contesting biological parentage under certain circumstances
1582.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a method in which males may contest allegations or presumptions of biological parentage under certain circumstances.

1583.title: Allowing federal adjusted gross income deduction for cost of high deductible health plan
1583.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a federal adjusted gross income deduction for the amount spent on a high deductible health plan purchased in conjunction with a health savings account.

1584.title: Placing Science and Cultural Center under General Services Division's authority
1584.description: The purpose of this bill is to place the West Virginia Science and Cultural Center under the authority and control of the General Services Division of the Department of Administration.

1585.title: Increasing fees for certain higher education students
1585.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize each higher education governing board to increase fees of students taking more hours of course work than the number of hours of course work defined as full-time.

1586.title: Prohibiting ATMs in video lottery establishments
1586.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the placement of Automated Teller Machines (ATM) in establishments that contain video lottery terminals.

1587.title: Providing certain correctional officers full retirement benefits
1587.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service.

1588.title: Expanding political party definition
1588.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the ability of political parties to obtain ballot access by expanding the scope of the definition of political party.

1589.title: Authorizing Supreme Court Administrator to oversee bail bondsmen
1589.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Administrator of the Supreme Court to oversee bail bondsmen; and to promulgate rules if necessary.

1590.title: Prohibiting fire department closing without State Fire Marshal's approval
1590.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a municipality to obtain a permit from the State Fire Marshal prior to closing a municipal fire department.  The bill also provides that the State Fire Marshal receives the moneys from the sale of vehicles purchased by the State Fire Marshal's office.  This does not apply to fleet vehicles, but only to specialized vehicles, such as bob trucks, which were actually purchased with State Fire Marshal funds.

1591.title: Relating to states' agreement to elect president by popular vote
1591.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote.  Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all fifty states and the District of Columbia.  The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

1592.title: Increasing exemption on retirement income for certain retirees
1592.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income taxes for state and federal retirees by increasing the exemption on retirement income in calculating the adjusted gross income for state personal income tax purposes.

1593.title: Providing one-time supplements to annuitants at age 70
1593.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a supplement of three percent to be paid to all annuitants of the Public Employees' Retirement and Teachers' Retirement Systems at the time they reach the age of seventy.

1594.title: Increasing time period for lien creditors to release liens
1594.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a longer period of time for lien creditors to provide releases of liens, and to provide a penalty for failure to release a lien within the time period.

1595.title: Providing fee waivers for certain higher education students
1595.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that state institutions of higher learning shall waive all fees for resident students who successfully complete the health sciences and technology academy affiliated programs.

1596.title: Allowing county boards of education to enter into certain lease-purchase agreements
1596.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a county board of education to enter into a lease-purchase agreement for land, buildings and equipment.

1597.title: Removing certain exceptions in minimum wage law
1597.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove certain exceptions in the definitions of employer and employee covered by the West Virginia minimum wage law.

1598.title: Expanding prescriptive authority of advanced nurse practitioners
1598.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand prescription authority for advanced nurse practitioners and to remove the requirement for a collaborative relationship between the advanced nurse practitioner and a physician.

1599.title: Relating to threat of use of firearm or other deadly weapon as element of first-degree robbery
1599.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the presenting of a firearm or other deadly weapon as an element of robbery in the first degree.

1600.title: Relating to theft of certain utility services
1600.description: The purpose of this bill is to require restitution when sentencing individuals found guilty of the theft of oil, natural gas, water, telecommunications, electric or solid waste service. The bill also makes it a misdemeanor to acquire or make use of a solid waste disposal service fraudulently, without the knowledge and consent of the service provider and with the intent to avoid or evade payment for the service.

1601.title: Removing exemption for certain salvage yards from screening provisions
1601.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the exemption for salvage yards licensed before 1988 from the screening requirements of the section.

1602.title: Prohibiting subsidies to entities performing abortions
1602.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit subsidies to entities that perform abortions.

1603.title: Prohibiting dispensing of public moneys within ninety days of election
1603.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit distribution, handing out or otherwise dispensing of public moneys by elected officials within ninety days of elections.

1604.title: Establishing school uniforms incentive plan pilot program
1604.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the school uniforms incentive plan pilot program to provide funding for certain public elementary schools which adopt and implement school uniform policies.

1605.title: Establishing relocation assistance program for certain correctional officers
1605.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Executive Director of the West Virginia Regional Jail and Correctional Facility Authority to establish a relocation assistance program for nonprobationary correctional officers who volunteer to relocate from an adequately staffed regional jail to a regional jail that is understaffed.

1607.title: Providing one-time option for certain Defined Contribution Retirement System members to opt in to State Teachers Retirement System
1607.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time option to members of the Defined Contribution Retirement System to opt into the State Teachers Retirement System.

1608.title: Increasing state employees' annual increment pay
1608.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of annual incremental salary increases for eligible state employees from fifty dollars to seventy-five dollars.  The bill also requires the State Auditor to provide a benefits statement with a state officer's or employee's net wages.

1609.title: Providing temporary detention of certain criminal suspects
1609.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the temporary detention of criminal suspects by law-enforcement officers to inquire on commission of a crime where probable cause appears to exist.

1610.title: Requiring jobs impact statement for certain proposed legislation
1610.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a jobs impact statement to be completed by the West Virginia Development Office for certain proposed legislation which may impact both short-term and long-term jobs in this state.

1611.last_action: Senate adopted conference report and rejected bill (Roll No. 84)
1611.title: Expanding Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority territory
1611.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the counties covered by West Virginia Route 2 and Interstate 68 Authority to include Cabell, Mason and Jackson counties.

1612.title: Requiring defendants pay certain costs of incarceration
1612.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a court to conduct a hearing at the time it sentences a defendant to jail to determine the defendant's ability to pay the costs of the defendant's incarceration.  The bill requires the court to require the defendant to pay for up to 30 days of incarceration in jail if it finds the defendant is or will be able in the foreseeable future to pay.

1613.title: Providing tax credit to certain medical providers
1613.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to medical providers in an amount equal to their investment in electronic medical record technology.

1614.title: Regulating use of automobile event data recorders
1614.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the use of automobile event data recorders, commonly known as "black boxes."

1615.title: Creating Office of Family and Foster Child Protection Ombudsman
1615.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Office of Family and Foster Child Protection Ombudsman.  The bill, additionally, authorizes the Ombudsman to hire staff; requires the Ombudsman to investigate and monitor the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Child Protective Services; sets forth powers and duties of the Ombudsman; defines terms; sets forth qualification for the position and terms and provides for access to information and sets forth the confidentiality requirements for that information.

1616.title: Providing supplemental benefit to certain public employee and teacher retirees
1616.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a cost-of-living increase to certain annuitants under the Public Employees and Teachers' Retirement Systems.  The supplement is equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index or three percent, whichever is less, multiplied by the first eighteen thousand dollars of the retiree's annual annuity.  The supplemental benefit is restricted for two thousand eight and two thousand nine.

1617.title: Prohibiting issuance of new business registration certificate under certain circumstances
1617.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the Tax Commissioner from issuing a new business registration certificate to any new business owned, managed, operated by or in which any person participated as a member of a board of directors, partner, manager or member director of a business that is delinquent in the payment of personal property taxes.

1618.title: Subtracting Social Security benefits from federal adjusted gross income
1618.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract Social Security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

1619.title: Providing adjoining landowners notice of timbering operations
1619.description: The purpose of this bill is to require verification of notice to adjoining landowners of timbering operations and notification of duration of these operations by certified mail.

1620.title: Prohibiting nursing services' insurers from limiting definition of scope of practice for benefit determination purposes
1620.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit insurers offering nursing services coverage from limiting the definition of scope of practice for purposes of benefit determination.

1621.title: Allowing advanced nurse practitioners sign do-not-resuscitate orders
1621.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow advanced nurse practitioners to sign do-not-resuscitate orders.

1622.title: Allowing advanced nurse practitioners sign death certificates
1622.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow advanced nurse practitioners to sign death certificates.

1623.title: Creating misdemeanor offense of interference with treatment of injured railroad employee
1623.description: The purpose of this bill is to create criminal penalties for a railroad company or employee who denies, delays or interferes with medical treatment or first-aid to a railroad employee injured on the job, or who threatens discipline to an injured employee who requests medical treatment or first aid to a job injury.

1624.title: Relating to information technology donations
1624.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Treasurer to donate surplus information technology to political subdivision, educational, nonprofit, and charitable organizations.  Recipients of donated technology are liable for all matters associated with the donated information technology.

1625.title: Increasing maximum weight for six-axle tractor trailers
1625.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the maximum weight amount for trucks equipped with six axles and two additional brakes to ninety-seven thousand pounds.

1626.title: Creating Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers
1626.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a system to assist farmers to make the transition from growing tobacco to growing other crops or pursuing other agricultural endeavors.  The bill includes provisions which create the "Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers" as well as the "Transition Program for Tobacco Farmers' Fund."  The bill also provides for use of the Tobacco Settlement Fund for the program.

1627.title: Creating brownfield economic development districts
1627.description: The purpose of this bill is to create brownfield economic development districts in areas involved in the extraction and processing of coal, limestone or other natural resources and that are currently designated as brownfield or voluntary remediated sites by the state.

1628.title: Requiring medical means to preserve life of fetus aborted alive
1628.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that when, during the course of an abortion procedure, a fetus is aborted alive, that all available medical means be used to preserve its life.  The bill would make a violation of the section a felony.

1629.title: Exempting certain insurance agents from continuing education requirement
1629.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt insurance agents with twenty or more years' experience who are sixty-five years of age or older from being required to obtain continuing education.

1630.title: Reducing ratio of school nurses to school children
1630.description: The purpose of this section is to provide a student-to-school nurse ratio of 1:750 in the school year 2008-2009 and to eliminate contracts between county boards of education and county health departments for equivalent nursing services.

1631.title: Relating to parental notification for unemancipated minor obtaining abortion
1631.description: The purpose of this bill is relative to parental involvement in the minor's decision to obtain an abortion.  The bill requires physicians to obtain proof of age prior to the performance of an abortion on a pregnant woman.  The bill provides for a constructive notice to parents of minors, and maintains information for a specified period in the minor's medical file.  The bill creates penalties.  The bill also provides for collection of fetal tissue in instances when the minor alleges sexual assault.  Finally, the bill mandates specific reporting requirements.

1632.title: Relating to handicapped parking violations
1632.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that accessible parking (formerly referred to as handicapped parking) violations will be considered motor vehicle violations and criminal offenses for certain penalty and record keeping purposes.

1633.title: Relating to mortgage loan procedures generally
1633.description: The purpose of this bill is to make changes to the disclosure requirements regarding fees in a mortgage loan, grant the commissioner the authority to issue a provisional mortgage license and to change time frame for hearings.

1634.title: Providing public employees retirement credit for armed forces service
1634.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that any service in the United States Armed Forces up to five years is credited service toward retirement for members of the Public Employees Retirement System.

1635.title: Prohibiting smoking in motor vehicle when child under 14 present
1635.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of lit tobacco products in a motor vehicle while individuals fourteen years of age or under are present.

1636.title: Requiring sheriff post notice on delinquent real estate
1636.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the sheriff to post on the door or entrance of any improvement on delinquent real estate, or post on a placard pounded into the ground of any unimproved delinquent real estate the above notice on or before the tenth day of September of each year.

1637.title: Relating to gambling and lottery losses
1637.description: The purpose of this bill is to specify that gambling and lottery winnings are taxable and that gambling and lottery losses are tax deductible. The bill also requires the taxpayer to keep detailed records showing losses.

1638.title: Allocating funding for transporting students to certain activities
1638.description: The purpose of this bill is to allocate $15,000 to each county to be used for transporting students to school related activities within the state; requires approval in advance from superintendent of schools for the county making the request; forfeiture of unused funds.

1639.title: Providing personal income tax adjustment for certain retirees
1639.description: The purpose of this bill to extend the termination of a personal income tax adjustment to the gross income of certain retirees receiving pensions from defined pension plans that terminated and are being paid a reduced maximum benefit guarantee from two thousand seven to two thousand thirteen.

1640.title: Exempting nonprofit companies providing electricity from property tax
1640.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from property taxation for property used by nonprofit corporations to provide electricity to residents of this state.

1641.title: Relating to Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp Checkoff Program
1641.description: The purpose of this bill is to include on the state personal income tax return a checkoff option to donate some or all of any tax refund to the "Jackson's Mill 4-H Camp Checkoff Program" for the operation of the camp.

1642.title: Granting municipal courts jurisdiction over juveniles violating tobacco use laws
1642.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant municipal courts jurisdiction over juveniles who violate laws and ordinances relating to tobacco use.

1643.title: Relating to limited arrest powers for day report officers
1643.description: The purpose of this bill is to give limited arrest powers to day report officers employed by a day report center.

1644.title: Relating to stalking offense generally
1644.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the offense of stalking generally, establish offenses, enhance penalties and define terms.

1645.title: Disclosing employers in default of unemployment compensation payments
1645.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Bureau of Employment programs to disclose the names of employers who have defaulted on their unemployment premiums and the amounts of the defaults.

1646.title: Prohibiting use of credit score in casualty insurance rates
1646.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

1647.title: Requiring background checks on real estate licensing applicants
1647.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the criminal history check of applicants for real estate licenses.

1648.title: Setting imprisonment term for malicious assault of certain officers
1648.description: The purpose of this bill is to set the term of incarceration for a person convicted of malicious assault on a police officer and other officers who are acting in an official capacity at ten years.

1649.title: Providing automatic court-ordered transfer of marital property upon divorce decree
1649.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the automatic court-ordered transfer of title to marital property upon a decree of divorce.

1650.title: Exempting certain professional and personal services from consumers sales and service tax
1650.description: The purpose of this bill is to list certain professional and personal services that are exempt from the payment of the consumers sales tax.

1651.title: Prohibiting driving in passing lane of highway in certain circumstances
1651.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit a person from driving in the passing lane of a highway if the speed limit is sixty-five miles per hour unless the person is passing other vehicles, turning left or the volume of traffic does not permit the vehicle to safely merge into the nonpassing lane. A misdemeanor penalty for violations is provided.

1652.title: Allowing county commissions to regulate and restrict locations of video lottery establishments
1652.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a county commission to provide by ordinance for regulation and restriction of the location of any premises in which a limited video lottery retailer holds a license.

1653.title: Excluding horses from farm livestock exemption  to prohibition against animal cruelty
1653.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that horses are not included under the definition of "farm livestock" for purposes of an exemption to the prohibitions against animal cruelty.

1654.title: Allowing pharmacists to refuse to dispense certain abortion-related prescriptions
1654.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow pharmacists and other individuals involved in dispensing medicines to refuse to fill prescriptions or dispense any substance that can be used as an abortifacient or that can be used as part of an abortion-related procedure.

1655.title: Requiring nonresident hunters provide proof of hunting license in resident state
1655.description: The purpose of this bill is to require nonresident applicants for hunting licenses to provide proof they are holders in good standing of equivalent hunting licenses in their resident states prior to being eligible for a nonresident hunting license in this state.

1656.title: Creating Small Tourism Business Development Act
1656.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a tax incentive for the creation, construction or enlargement of tourism attractions or amenities.  The credit operates to allow the taxpayer to recover up to 25% or, in the case of bed and breakfast facilities, 50%, of qualified investment in a tourism attraction or amenity by offsetting up to 80% of consumers sales and service tax collected by the taxpayer from customers over a period of either five or ten years at the election of the taxpayer.

1657.title: Relating to reasonable force in defense of self, real and personal property
1657.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of proportionate force by a person in any place the person has a legal right to be against an intruder or attacker.  The bill also provides that the use of proportionate force is a full defense, civilly or criminally.

1658.title: Authorizing Public Service Commission to order acquisition of failed water and sewer utilities
1658.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect the consumers of failed water or sewer utilities by authorizing the Public Service Commission to order a capable water or sewer public utility to acquire the failed utility system.

1659.title: Requiring quarterly safety inspections of propane tanks
1659.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Service Commission to conduct quarterly safety inspections of propane tanks.

1660.title: Standardizing preferred drug lists and formularies
1660.description: The purpose of this bill is to develop a standard format for preferred drug lists or drug formularies and to make all preferred drug lists or drug formularies available in an electronic format.

1661.title: Providing nonrefundable earned income tax credit for certain taxpayers
1661.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a nonrefundable earned income tax credit from the state personal income tax for taxpayers with qualifying children.  The earned income tax credit is equal to 15% of the federal credit.

1662.title: Creating Infection Control Advisory Panel
1662.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a voluntary program to control and prevent infections in hospitals, ambulatory surgical centers and other health care facilities in this state.  The bill provides for the appointment of the Infection Control Advisory Panel.  The panel, along with the Bureau for Public Health, is responsible for developing and implementing the program.

1663.title: Prohibiting timbering operations near native brook trout streams
1663.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit timbering operations within five hundred feet of any stream in this state that harbors native brook trout.  Towards this goal the bill creates criminal penalties.

1664.title: Requiring PEIA Finance Board provide retirees' medical and prescription coverage in certain circumstances
1664.description: The purpose of this bill is to require PEIA Finance Board to assume responsibility for medical and prescription coverage of retirees in the event any Medicare Advantage Program contract is not renewed or is otherwise terminated.

1665.title: Requiring state-subsidized employers remain neutral in labor disputes
1665.description: The purpose of this bill is to require employers receiving fifty percent of their revenues or greater from state funds, must remain neutral in labor issues.

1666.title: Limiting certain asbestos claims
1666.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit certain asbestos claims, provide for the fair and efficient judicial consideration of personal injury and wrongful death claims arising out of asbestos or silica exposure, to ensure that individuals who suffer impairment, now or in the future, from illnesses caused by exposure to asbestos or silica, receive compensation for their injuries, and for other purposes.

1667.title: Prohibiting fractional pricing of retail gasoline sales
1667.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit fractional pricing in the retail sale of gasoline and to define it as an unfair or deceptive practice.

1668.title: Designating English official state language
1668.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate English as the official language of West Virginia.

1669.title: Requiring health insurance plans cover smoking cessation services
1669.description: The purpose of this bill is to require insurers to cover the cost of smoking cessation services acquired by covered persons, just as it would for any other medication.

1670.title: Imposing taxes on certain illegal substances
1670.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose excise taxes on certain unauthorized substances, including cocaine, certain low-street-value drugs, marijuana, certain controlled substances, illicit alcoholic liquor, certain beer, certain wine and mash.

1671.title: Requiring principals take responsibility and control over teacher's classroom performance
1671.description: The purpose of this bill is to require principals to take on greater authority and control over teachers' classroom teaching performance.  Toward this goal the bill requires the State Board of Education to propose rules for legislative approval designed to develop and implement a program to train principals to act with greater control and authority over the teachers in their schools in a manner similar to corporate CEO's in order to maintain higher standards in the classroom and promote constant professional improvement of teachers.

1672.title: Relating to payment in lieu of property tax agreements
1672.description: The purpose of this bill is to prescribe uniform minimum reporting and content requirements for payment in lieu of tax agreements, to require that all local levying bodies approve a payment in lieu of tax agreement and to provide for allocation and distribution of payments in lieu of property tax.  These rules would apply to payment in lieu of property tax agreements executed after June 30, 2008.

1673.title: Providing penalties for failure to report to Alzheimer's Disease Registry
1673.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide penalties for failure to report under the provisions of this section.

1674.title: Establishing returnable beverage container deposit program
1674.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a program to recycle beverage containers and reduce litter.  The bill requires the use of returnable containers for many beverages and requires the use of a 10 cent deposit; exempts deposits on containers from sales taxes and excludes deposits from business and occupation taxes; prescribes the powers and duties of DEP; and prescribes penalties and remedies.

1675.title: Deleting provision banning weapons on State Capitol property
1675.description: The purpose of this bill is to delete the provision of law that makes it unlawful for any person to bring a weapon on State Capitol property.

1676.title: Prohibiting use of handheld cell phone while driving
1676.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of handheld cellular telephones while driving and to provide a penalty for violations.  Under the bill, a person may be fined for a violation, but no points may be assessed against his or her driver's license.

1677.title: Prohibiting sale of candy- or fruit-flavored cigarettes
1677.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the sale of candy or fruit-flavored cigarettes in this state.

1678.title: Creating fund to reimburse National Guard group life insurance premiums
1678.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a fund to reimburse group life insurance premiums paid by members of the National Guard while they are serving periods of active duty in combat areas.

1679.title: Creating Physicians' Lien Act
1679.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a Physicians Lien Act to allow physicians and other providers to place liens on claims and causes of action by injured parties.

1680.title: Increasing tax on alcohol purchases outside corporate municipal limits
1680.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the tax on purchases of intoxicating liquors outside corporate limits of municipalities from five percent to ten percent.

1681.title: Relating to limited expungement of certain criminal records
1681.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the limited expungement of certain criminal records for a nonviolent crime committed by a person between the ages of eighteen and twenty-six.

1682.title: Relating to abandoned vehicles generally
1682.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor offense to abandon a motor vehicle which is unlicensed or inoperable or both, upon any private property for a period of more than thirty days, unless the vehicle is in an enclosed building, with certain exceptions.

1683.title: Allowing federal adjusted gross income deduction for health insurance expenses
1683.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a federal adjusted gross income deduction of up to $15,000 for the amount spent on health insurance.

1685.title: Requiring insurers provide full autism spectrum disorder coverage
1685.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health insurers to provide full coverage for the prevention, early detection, diagnosis and treatment of autism spectrum disorder.

1686.title: Relating to Management of Pain Act
1686.description: The purpose of this bill is to describe nonpunishable management of pain by physicians, eliminate the definition of "intractable pain" and defining the word "pain" and make conforming amendments to the Management of Pain Act.

1687.title: Increasing distance beer and video lottery retailer licensees must be located from school or church
1687.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the distance that a beer licensee must be located from a school or church from three hundred to one thousand feet and includes public playgrounds and day care facilities as locations requiring a one thousand foot distance for a beer licensee business and to provide that a limited video lottery retailer licensee, a retail liquor licensee, and a private club licensee may not be located within one thousand feet of a public playground, day care facility, school or church.

1688.title: Prohibiting certain state medical facilities from performing abortions
1688.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit abortions at state college or university medical facilities, except when the abortion is necessary to save the life of the woman receiving the abortion.

1690.title: Increasing basic compensation of legislators
1690.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the increased compensation and expense reimbursement for members of the Legislature.

1691.title: Requiring certain law-enforcement officers receive nationwide concealed firearm's certification
1691.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all law-enforcement agencies in this state to certify qualified law-enforcement officers to carry concealed firearms nationwide as provided by the federal Law-Enforcement Officers Safety Act of 2004 and require law-enforcement agencies to provide qualified retired law- enforcement officers the opportunity to be certified to carry concealed firearms nationwide as provided in said act.

1692.title: Creating GED incentives
1692.description: The purpose of this bill is to create incentives to encourage West Virginia workers to obtain the GED and incentives to encourage West Virginia employers to allow their employees to study for and obtain a GED.

1693.title: Creating life insurance reimbursement fund for National Guard members
1693.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a fund to reimburse group life insurance premiums paid by members of the National Guard in exchange for and in recognition of their  service in this state and their assumption of extended periods of active duty in combat areas.

1694.title: Creating Volunteer Firefighter Length of Service Act
1694.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "West Virginia Volunteer Firefighter Length of Service Act"; and to provide that the State of West Virginia would have to provide for the administration costs during the first five years of the plan, after this time the plan should be self-sufficient to handle any associated administration costs.

1695.title: Providing tuition waivers for children and spouses of certain National Guard and active duty military personnel
1695.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for tuition waivers for the children and spouses of National Guard and active military duty personnel who are killed in the line of duty.

1696.title: Requiring employees selling alcohol take alcohol awareness course
1696.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all employees of licensed private clubs and retail outlets selling alcoholic beverages to take the Techniques for Education and Alcohol Management (TEAM) course provided by the Alcoholic Beverage Commission.

1697.title: Prohibiting convicted murderer from living near victim's family
1697.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit a convicted murderer from living within one thousand yards of the victim's family.

1698.title: Establishing Voluntary Retirement Accounts Program
1698.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide every worker in the state with access to a voluntary retirement savings account through the state.

1699.title: Creating felony offense of intrastate employee transfer of child sex offender
1699.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a criminal offense for employers who facilitate  employment of any employee to other intrastate employment when such employee is known by the employer to have had sexual relations with an individual under the age of eighteen years.

1700.title: Relating to payment of certain GED fees
1700.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for payment of General Educational Development (GED) exam fees for certain individuals.

1701.title: Creating DUI court program alternatives
1701.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the creation of DUI court programs along with drug court programs as an alternative to sentencing for certain persons guilty of driving under the influence of alcohol offenses.

1702.title: Establishing Criminal Justice Policy Council
1702.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a State Criminal Justice Policy Council.

1703.title: Relating to humane officers' seizing certain cats
1703.description: The purpose of this bill is to empower county humane officers to pick up domestic and feral cats that are abandoned or otherwise in need of rescue thus alleviating the burden from private individuals presently taking on this responsibility.

1704.title: Relating to school employees' donated personal leave days
1704.description: The purpose of this bill is to lay out the procedure for county school boards to return unused donated personal leave days back to the donors.

1705.title: Providing whistle-blower protection for reporting unsafe mine conditions
1705.description: The purpose of this bill is to further protect whistleblowers for reporting the unsafe working conditions in mines.

1706.title: Authorizing municipalities to enter into energy-saving contracts
1706.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize municipalities to enter into contracts for energy-saving contracts.  Current law only allows the state and its agencies to do this.

1707.title: Relating to municipality land annexation without election
1707.description: The purpose of this bill is to insert additional language to make it harder for there to be an annexation of land without an election.

1708.title: Relating to predatory lending practices
1708.description: The purpose of this bill is to address the causes of the current foreclosure crisis and generally protect consumers from losing their homes as a result of the subprime and other lenders' overreaching practices and contract provisions, the significance of which consumers cannot be expected to understand.

1709.title: Creating additional early voting locations
1709.description: The purpose of this section is to enable the county clerk to create additional early election voting locations for the convenience of the citizens and to advertise such locations adequately to all voters.

1710.title: Setting new age requirements for automobile insurance premium reductions
1710.description: The purpose of this bill is to lower the age from fifty-five years of age to fifty years of age concerning the requirement that automobile insurers provide for premium reductions.

1711.title: Authorizing allocated revenues to fund volunteer firemen pensions
1711.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain revenues may be allocated to fund pensions for volunteer firemen in order to improve recruitment and retention of volunteer firemen.

1712.title: Creating Food Security Act
1712.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Food Security Act.  It will provide a tax credit for a qualified donation or bargain sale of a fee interest in real property or a conservation or preservation easement located in West Virginia, by a landowner taxpayer to a public or private conservation agency.

1713.title: Removing scholarship funds' cap for dependent children of deceased State Police
1713.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the cap on scholarship funds for surviving dependent children of certain deceased members of the West Virginia State Police.

1714.title: Increasing relocation expense allocation for State Police
1714.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the relocation expense allocation for members of the West Virginia State Police when the transfer necessitates relocation of the member's family.

1715.title: Authorizing municipalities to provide free parking for certain veterans
1715.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow municipalities to provide for free parking for certain veterans.

1716.title: Providing criminal penalty for parental controlled substance activity with child present
1716.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a criminal penalty for a parent who engages in the manufacture, possession or distribution of a controlled substance while a child is present in the home.

1717.title: Relating to concealed handgun licenses generally
1717.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure for issuing concealed handgun licenses to nonresidents and protect the privacy of concealed handgun licensees' social security numbers by removing social security numbers from concealed handgun licenses.

1718.title: Relating to Patriot Guard Riders license plate
1718.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue "Patriot Guard Riders" license plates for passenger vehicles and motorcycles.

1719.title: Relating to Wheeling Jesuit University license plate
1719.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue a license plate featuring Wheeling Jesuit University with the educational institution's insignia displayed on it.

1720.title: Providing funding for programs discouraging tobacco use
1720.description: The purpose of this bill is to promote better health among the citizens of West Virginia by providing for funding for programs to discourage tobacco use, giving preference in state bidding procedures to employers who offer health insurance to employees, requiring health insurance plans to cover the cost of smoking cessation programs; to allow personal and corporate tax credits for smoking cessation programs and providing for or paying for exercise programs; prohibiting the advertisement of tobacco products at certain events; limiting sponsorship by tobacco interest; increasing the tobacco excise tax on all tobacco products; and, creating a special revenue account to cover the expenses of tobacco cessation advertising.

1721.title: Relating to coal mine health and safety generally
1721.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement that battery-powered strobe lights be affixed to caches of self-contained self-rescue devices, to expand criminal penalties related to the theft and destruction of certain coal mine equipment and property, and to establish criminal penalties for the illegal entry onto mine property to commit a felony or larceny.

1722.title: Updating meaning of certain terms used in WV Personal Income Tax Act
1722.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of "federal adjusted gross income" and certain other terms used but not defined in the West Virginia Personal Income Tax Act by bringing them into conformity with their meanings for federal income tax purposes.

1723.title: Updating meaning of certain terms used in WV Corporation Net Income Tax Act
1723.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the meaning of "federal taxable income" and certain other terms used but not defined in the West Virginia Corporation Net Income Tax Act by bringing them into conformity with their meaning for federal income tax purposes.

1724.title: Clarifying mental conditions which prohibit firearms' possession and creating state registry of such persons
1724.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the disclosure of certain mental health records to the National Instant Criminal Background Check System.

1725.title: Relating to Small Business Linked Deposit Program
1725.description: The purpose of this bill is to renew the West Virginia Small Business Linked Deposit Program.

1726.title: Relating to child abuse and neglect generally
1726.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit parents, guardians or custodians from allowing registered sexual offenders access to children in their custody.  The bill also defines key terms and makes technical changes for purposes of consistency.

1727.title: Requiring retired law-enforcement recertify firearm license
1727.description: The purpose of this bill is to require retired law-enforcement officers to be recertified from time to time to continue to carry firearms.

1728.title: Exempting senior citizens from home heating fuels' sales tax
1728.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt senior citizens from the sales tax imposed on purchases of heating oil and propane.

1729.title: Relating to DUI laws
1729.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that driving under the influence includes doing so while under the influence of any controlled substance, other drugs, or a combination of alcohol, any controlled substance or other drugs and makes the language herein consistent with other sections of this article; provides for evidentiary breath testing of impaired drivers when reasonable cause exists to believe that they have committed an offense involving the operation of a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol and for the testing of their blood or urine when they are unable to submit to a breath test because of injury, illness, disease, physical infirmity or physical incapacity or when receiving medical treatment; provides for a secondary chemical testing of the blood or urine of impaired drivers where there is probable cause to believe that they have committed the offense while under the influence of controlled substances, other drug, or any combination of alcohol, controlled substance or other drug; clarifies the definition of "law-enforcement officer"; clarifies that nothing in this section prohibits the use of search warrants; and to require mandatory blood, breath or urine tests from drivers involved in motor vehicle crashes that result in death or bodily injury from the crash; and also allows for the expansion of and use of drug recognition experts in the State of West Virginia.

1730.title: Allowing districts' certain substitute teacher hiring flexibility in critical need areas
1730.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow school districts flexibility in hiring specialty substitutes for critical need areas.

1731.title: Allowing county school boards' substitute service personnel placement flexibility
1731.description: The purpose of this bill is to give county school superintendents more flexibility and ease in placing service personnel workers in positions of need on a day-to-day basis.

1732.title: Allowing lenders' sale of membership plans
1732.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow consumer lenders to sell home and automobile membership plans to their customers.

1733.title: Providing electronic instructional materials to certain students
1733.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide electronic instructional materials to visually disabled students.

1734.title: Imposing certain penalties for Freedom of Information Act noncompliance
1734.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose civil penalties for failure to comply with freedom of information requests.  The penalty is in increments of $100 for each month a custodian fails to comply or until a court orders compliance.

1735.title: Requiring certain colorectal screening and third-party reimbursement
1735.description: The purpose of this bill is to require colorectal cancer screening based on A-level guidelines of the American Cancer Society; and requiring third party reimbursement for this testing.

1736.title: Requiring county residence on driver's license
1736.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the county of residence to be contained on  driver's license.

1737.title: Exempting certain amounts of state pensions and Social Security benefits from state income tax
1737.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $20,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax.

1738.title: Rescinding student financial assistance due to certain alcohol violations
1738.description: The purpose of this bill is to rescind state financial assistance from students who receive two or more citations for an open container violation, DUI, underage consumption, public intoxication or contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

1740.title: Providing terms for certain public retirement benefits disqualification
1740.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the termination of retirement benefits in any and all plans of a member who renders less than honorable service, to add the definition of "former participant", and to provide for the retention of employer contributions in the plan of members of the Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System whose benefits have been terminated for less than honorable service.

1741.title: Requiring certain acupuncture treatment insurance coverage
1741.description: The purpose of this bill is to require health insurance policies to cover acupuncture treatment performed by a licensed acupuncturist.

1742.title: Updating trust deed foreclosure process
1742.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the trust deed foreclosure process.  These statutes have not been significantly amended since their adoption in the nineteenth century.  These changes are in response to the complete restructuring of the mortgage lending market and resulting failure of the current statutes to curb abuses in foreclosure processing by out-of-state mortgage lenders and their collection agents who are routinely substituted as trustees at the time of foreclosure in the place of the trustee agreed upon by the parties.  The bill sets out the parameters of the fiduciary duties of the trustees to both parties.  The bill sets out the needed information to be contained in the notice to the consumer.  The bill designates the West Virginia Housing Development Fund to review mortgage company loans headed for foreclosure for alternative financing or other remedies prior to initiation of foreclosure.  The bill requires the lender to provide adequate documentation to the trustee to carry out the trustee's fiduciary duties to the consumer and the lender.  The bill remedies the lack of a procedure for exercising reinstatement.  The bill gives the banking commissioner the authority to disqualify a trustee that has engaged in malfeasance.

1743.title: Creating Indigent Defense Commission
1743.description: The purpose of the bill is to create the Indigent Defense Commission to assist Public Defender Services with regard to the general policies and procedures of the agency and to provide additional oversight of the costs and administration of the public defender corporations; to require corporations to submit monthly reports on billable and nonbillable time to the agency; to authorize the agency to create additional corporations in a judicial circuit with an active corporation, activate corporations, and require the merger of existing corporations; to establish an order of preference for the appointment of panel attorneys; to modify requirements for funding applications; to modify compensable expenses; and to authorize the executive director to establish guidelines for submission of vouchers and claims.

1744.title: Establishing driver's license denial or suspension for students who fail or withdraw from school
1744.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the denial or suspension of a driver's license for any student who withdraws from school or fails to receive passing grades.

1745.title: Providing allocated Fire Protection Fund revenue to Fire Chief's and Fireman's Associations for certain expenses
1745.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide State Treasury, Fire Protection Fund revenue to the West Virginia State Fire Chiefs' Association and the West Virginia State Fireman's Association, to be used for both associations' administration and training expenses, and to exempt both associations from eligibility and spending requirements under §8-15-8a and §8-15-8b.

1746.title: Relating to Deputy Sheriff Retirement System Act
1746.description: The purpose of this bill is to make technical and other changes to the Deputy Sheriff Retirement System; to provide for the correction of errors; to permit rollovers of any dollar amount; to provide for an onset date for disability retirement benefits; to provide for the termination of disability retirement benefits of a retirant who refuses to submit to a medical examination or provide a certification statement by his or her physician of continued disability; to remove option to purchase declining term insurance for members with loans; to provide procedure for subsequent loans; to clarify the eligibility requirements of certain sheriffs; and, to permit the collection of fees for late payment from employers.

1747.title: Clarifying all Consolidated Public Retirement Board systems are included in employer pick-up provisions
1747.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that all retirement systems administered by the Consolidated Public Retirement Board are included for employer pick-up provisions for federal tax purposes.

1748.title: Creating Smoke Free West Virginia Act
1748.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit smoking in public places of employment and government vehicles.

1749.title: Exempting military retirement pensions from state income tax
1749.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt military retirement pensions from income tax.

1750.title: Providing state income tax exemptions to retirees
1750.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a state income tax exemption to retirees beginning in 2009 on the first $5000 of their retirement income, and then increasing the tax exemption in increments of $5000 each year until 2012 when the total exemption shall equal $20,000.

1751.title: Requiring vision screening for driver's license renewal
1751.description: The purpose of this bill is to require persons applying for renewal of a driver's license to pass a vision screening administered by the Division of Motor Vehicles.

1752.title: Requiring Promise Scholarship repayments under certain circumstances
1752.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a legislative rule requiring repayment, in whole or in part, of a PROMISE scholarship award if the recipient chooses to work outside of West Virginia following graduation.

1753.title: Authorizing State Police to enforce immigration laws
1753.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide state police with power to enforce United States immigration laws.

1754.title: Reducing behavioral health care provider's severance tax
1754.description: The purpose of this bill is the references to behavioral health from the severance tax section to the section of tax on provider of psychological services.

1755.title: Eliminating certain coalbed methane tax exemptions under Severance and Business Privilege Tax Act
1755.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the taxation of natural gas and coalbed methane equal and uniform, to dedicate certain amounts of tax revenue to the West Virginia Infrastructure Fund, and to grandfather certain entitlements to the exemption previously applicable to coalbed methane production.

1756.title: Reducing compliance time for nonresident traffic violations
1756.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the time period for magistrate courts and municipal courts to notify the Division of Motor Vehicles of unsatisfied traffic-related tickets of nonresidents.  This change is necessary to remain in compliance with the Non-Resident Violator Compact (NRVC).

1757.title: Relating to nonpartisan election of Supreme Court justices and circuit court judges
1757.description: The purpose of this bill is to elect all justices to the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals and all circuit court judges on a nonpartisan basis.

1758.title: Relating to county development fees
1758.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for additional fees and those fees for county development.

1759.title: Creating Asbestos Claims Transparency Act
1759.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a procedure that requires a claimant that files an asbestos case after the effective date of this bill to provide information to all defendants about all claims filed or anticipated to be filed by that claimant against asbestos bankruptcy trusts, a mechanism for the defendant to challenge those claims, a procedure for sanctions by the court, and for set-offs for those claims.

1760.title: Creating Uniform Maternal Screening Act
1760.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish an advisory council on maternal risk assessment within the Office of Maternal, Child and Family Health and to grant legislative rule-making authority to the Bureau for Public Health to develop a uniform maternal risk screening tool to serve as an alert to medical care providers of the need for greater evaluation and assessment of high-risk pregnancies.

1761.title: Permitting only healthy beverages and snacks in schools
1761.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that only healthy beverages and healthy or nutritional snacks may be sold in the county school system.

1762.title: Creating Teacher Shortage Incentive Pilot Program
1762.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a recruitment bonus for new math, science and special education teachers, or teachers filling positions that have remained vacant for one year or more.

1763.title: Authorizing Jefferson County commission to create joint emergency services agency
1763.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to create a joint emergency service agency in lieu of an emergency ambulance service authority, county fire association or county fire board.

1764.title: Establishing supplementary salary schedule for certain teachers
1764.description: Establishing supplementary salary schedule for certain teachers

1765.title: Relating to Public Employees Retirement System
1765.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify which contributions can be transferred from the State Police Death, Disability and Retirement Fund ; to make minor technical changes by changing the term "employee" to "member"; and, to permit rollovers of any dollar amount from the Public Employees Retirement System.

1766.title: Relating to State Teachers Retirement System
