2074.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the interlock program available to first time offenders while also increasing incentives for participation in the program; increased periods on the interlock program for aggravating circumstances involving a second or subsequent DUI offense; reducing the administrative penalties for driving with a suspended license; permitting administrative hearing decisions to be based on the arresting officer's affidavit; and requiring a mandatory blood alcohol content test for all drivers involved in a motor vehicle crash resulting in death or serious bodily injury.

2075.title: Exempting Supreme Court probation officers' vehicles from certain registration requirements
2075.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt vehicles operated by the Supreme Court of Appeals from registration requirements for state cars.

2076.title: Increasing State Police compensation
2076.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the compensation  of the membership of the West Virginia State Police.

2077.title: Allowing service personnel association teachers to count certain service toward retirement credit
2077.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow teachers employed by a statewide service personnel association to count this service towards retirement credit.

2078.title: Restoring licensure exemption for certain contractors
2078.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore the West Virginia Manufactured Housing Construction and Safety Standards the power to allow subcontractors to work on manufactured housing installation.

2079.title: Providing certain volunteer emergency medical services' personnel license waiver
2079.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a waiver of certain physical requirements of emergency medical services personnel who work on a volunteer basis when certain other minimum requirements are met; then a license may not be denied.

2080.title: Continuing personal income tax adjustment to certain retirees' gross income
2080.description: The purpose of this bill is to continue providing a personal income tax adjustment to the gross income of certain retirees receiving pensions from defined pension plans that terminated and are being paid a reduced maximum benefit guarantee.  The original enactment of this section contained a sunset provision that terminated the tax adjustment on January 1, 2007.

2081.title: Providing certain corrections officers full retirement benefits after twenty years
2081.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers, parole officers and juvenile corrections officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service.

2082.title: Exempting farm vehicles from certain regulations when crossing state lines
2082.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt farm vehicles from commercial motor vehicle regulations when farmers drive farm vehicles across state lines, but within 150 miles of their qualifying farms, and when farmers drive farm vehicles carrying materials not required to be placarded under subpart F of 49 C.F.R. Part §172 as "hazardous materials."

2083.title: Establishing electronic health information data-sharing pilot program
2083.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a pilot program within the West Virginia Health Information Network to establish electronic data sharing for clinical decision support.

2084.title: Relating to tax administration efficiency
2084.description: The purpose of this bill is to require electronic filing of tax returns for taxpayers that satisfy the threshold requirements; to authorize the combining of tax assessments resulting from one audit; to authorize the Tax Commissioner to promulgate rules to determine the application of partial tax payments; to apply the statute of limitations separately to all taxes in a combined assessment; to authorize the recordation of one lien for all taxes in a combined assessment, to authorize health care providers to assert the exemption from consumers sales and service tax for purchases of drugs, durable medical goods, mobility enhancing equipment, prosthetic devices and insulin for use in providing professional or personal services through direct pay permits; to eliminate the periodic biennial renewal requirement for business registration certificates granted on or after the first day of July, two thousand ten; to impose a penalty for the involuntary cancellation, revocation or suspension of such certificates for any cause specified by statute, payable upon reinstatement, or issuance of a business registration certificate after the involuntary cancellation; revocation or suspension of a prior business registration certificate; to require the Tax Commissioner to design a new tax return form that combines the reporting of both Consumers Sales and Service Tax and Use Tax, and to require taxpayers to use the form required by the Tax Commissioner, and to simplify the annual West Virginia Withholding Tax imposed under the code by adopting the federal schedule and procedures.

2085.title: Clarifying charitable bingo and raffle operators' compensation
2085.description: The purpose of this bill is to update the code sections affected to reflect modern federal minimum wage requirements and to clarify language.

2086.title: Providing one-time supplement for certain public employee and teacher annuitants and survivor beneficiaries
2086.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement of $500 for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years.  The supplement is exempt from State income tax.

2087.title: Requiring U. S. and state flags purchased with public funds be manufactured in U. S.
2087.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the purchase of United States flag or flags of the State of West Virginia by the state, counties or boards of education using public funds only be made from manufacturers in the United States.

2088.title: Requiring health care insurance for public improvement projects' workers
2088.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that workers on public improvement projects be provided health care insurance as a benefit of employment.

2089.title: Exempting certain amount of state pensions and Social Security benefits from state income tax
2089.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the first $10,000 of state pensions and social security benefits from West Virginia personal income tax with an increase to $10,000 for retirees who are sixty-five years old or older.

2090.title: Requiring certain dwellings' installation, maintenance or service of fuel gas system comply with State Fire Code
2090.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the installation, maintenance or service of fuel gas systems in one or two family dwellings be done in accordance with the state fire code.

2091.title: Relating to prepaid wireless calling taxes, fees and charges
2091.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an alternative means of equitably collecting and remitting telecommunications taxes, fees and charges applicable to prepaid wireless calling arrangements.

2092.title: Creating Permitting and Licensing Information Act
2092.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the permitting information ombudsman in the Governor's Office of Technology; to establish the ombudsman's authority; establishing the duty of agencies to provider permitting information; development of permitting information repository available to the public; providing procedures for an agency's failure to provide permitting information; the reporting of status of the permitting information repository to the Legislature and the Governor; and allowing for the promulgation of rules by the permitting information ombudsman.

2093.title: Relating to osteopathic physician and surgeon licensing requirements
2093.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove inconsistent and outdated provisions concerning osteopathic physicians and surgeons; the bill clarifies and updates the licensing requirements for osteopathic physicians and surgeons; and the bill also sets forth  additional causes for revoking or suspending a license.

2094.title: Limiting real property classification of managed timberland
2094.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit classification of real property as managed timberland to prevent county property tax revenues from decreasing by more than 5%.

2095.title: Relating to towing unlawfully parked vehicles
2095.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for prior written authorization for the towing of motor vehicles without the consent of the owner or operator, and to provide for criminal background checks for drivers of tow vehicles.

2096.title: Replacing corporate license tax with one-time fee
2096.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal the complicated and confusing corporate license tax, and to replace the resulting loss of revenues by the Office of the Secretary of State by creating a new one-time $100 filing fee, and by permitting the Secretary of State to keep all of the $25 annual attorney-in-fact fees paid by corporations and limited partnerships.

2098.title: Increasing certain Cultural Facilities and Capitol Resources Matching Grant Program Fund allocations
2098.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of net terminal income allocated to the Cultural Facilities and Capitol Resources Matching Grant Program Fund.

2099.title: Regulating feral cat care and management
2099.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate and control the management of feral and abandoned cats.

2100.title: Modifying circumstances which relieve certain directors from civil liability
2100.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the circumstances under which a qualified director is relieved from civil liability. The bill specifies that the protection from liability does not apply to a qualified director if he or she is found to have intentionally caused damage or injury to another in the performance of his or her duties.

2101.title: Prohibiting certain raffle boards and games sales and possession
2101.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the possession of certain gambling devices by persons not authorized by law to sell or possess such devices, by declaring them contraband and extending the authority of the State Tax Department Criminal Investigation Division to seize such games.

2102.title: Providing certain volunteer fire department members state income tax exemption
2102.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption on state personal income tax to members of volunteer fire departments who meet certain qualified service requirements.

2103.title: Relating to higher education tuition and fee waivers
2103.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the age limitation for spouses of deceased service men and women to be eligible for special education benefits; to repeal unclear language on granting tuition and fee waivers; change method of calculation limits on percentage of tuition and fee waivers; and to exempt all statutorily-authorized tuition and fee waivers, including those granted to higher education employees, their spouses, and dependents, from limits on percentage of tuition and fee waivers granted by state institutions of higher education.

2104.title: Relating to increased real property assessment notice
2104.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the required notice period for a notice of increased assessed valuation of real property, from at least 15 to 10 days prior to the first meeting in February at which the county commission meets as the board of equalization and review.  The bill also provides that the increase in the assessed valuation must be at least $1,000 before the notice is required to be sent.

2105.title: Creating felony offense for animal fighting ventures involvement
2105.description: The purpose of this bill is to make wagering at animal fighting ventures and conducting, financing, managing, supervising, owning or leasing any part of an animal fighting venture or the premises on which it takes place with knowledge that wagering is occurring a felony.

2106.title: Regulating all-terrain vehicles
2106.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose regulations on the use and operation of all-terrain vehicles.  The bill prohibits operation on paved roads or highways and provides for regulation of all-terrain vehicles by local government authorities.

2107.title: Creating Green Buildings Act
2107.description: The purpose of this bill is for the adoption of green building standards for the construction or renovation of public buildings over fifty thousand square feet in size.

2108.title: Relating to compulsory school attendance directors
2108.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the ratio of pupils per attendance director, waive additional certification for attendance directors who hold certain social work degrees, and provide salary increases for attendance directors who hold social work degrees.

2109.title: Allowing county commissions' involvement in joint development efforts
2109.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county commissions to be involved in joint development efforts.

2110.title: Relating to certain firefighters' workers' compensation benefits
2110.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a presumption of compensability for cardiovascular injury or disease of professional firefighters employed by municipal fire departments.

2111.title: Issuing driver's license to persons using bioptic telescopic lenses
2111.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the issuance of drivers' licenses to persons using bioptic telescopic lenses.  The bill sets conditions, restrictions and limitations for licensing. The bill further authorizes the Division of Rehabilitation Services to promulgate the criteria for applicant  enrollment in low vision driving courses, and the criteria for establishing low vision driving courses. The bill also makes technical and stylistic changes to the section.

2112.title: Increasing public school teachers' and service personnel annual salaries
2112.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase annual salaries for public school teachers, provide salary bonuses for classroom teachers, and increase annual salaries for school service personnel.

2114.title: Creating Discount Medical Plan Organizations and Discount Prescription Drug Plan Organizations Act
2114.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a mechanism for the regulation and licensing by the Insurance Commissioner of discount medical plan organizations and discount prescription drug plan organizations.

2115.title: Exempting military retirement pensions from income tax
2115.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt military retirement pensions from income tax.

2116.title: Relating to barbers' and cosmetologists' fees and licensing
2116.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the terminology to current usage and raise fees for licenses and renewals.

2117.title: Relating to Severance and Business Privilege Tax Act
2117.description: The purpose of this bill is to simplify the taxation and clarify the regulation and treatment under the law of the production, marketing and delivery of natural gas and oil.

2118.title: Appointing additional nonresident members to Bluefield's sanitary board
2118.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the appointment of additional members of a West Virginia community's sanitary board who are nonresidents, when the sanitary sewer system serving the community borders another state and sanitary sewer system serving that community is located in the other state.

2119.title: Authorizing magistrate courts to accept unsigned citation payments
2119.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize magistrate courts to accept payments when persons mail or deliver such payments to the court to pay citations.

2120.title: Allowing flashing lights on certain vehicles
2120.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow blue flashing lights to be used on vehicles operated by the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety and its divisions for homeland security.  The bill also allows red flashing lights to be used on emergency management vehicles, homeland security response vehicles, Class A vehicles of emergency management personnel and other vehicles designated by the Director of the Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Management.

2121.title: Imposing corporate net income tax on certain entities
2121.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose corporate net income tax on certain regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts used as tax sheltering vehicles.

2122.title: Requiring certain nonprofit board members and directors attend training
2122.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all directors and members of the board of directors of nonprofit corporations that receive money from state agencies or that receive federal money through state agencies to participate in three hours of training.

2123.title: Expanding membership of boards of zoning appeals
2123.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the expansion of the number of members of boards of zoning appeal from five to seven.

2124.title: Updating real and personal property assessment procedures
2124.description: The purpose of this bill is to modernize procedures and timeframes for assessments of real and personal property, notices of assessments, and appeals of assessments.  It provides special timeframes for assessment of industrial and natural resources property.  It provides for appeal of an assessor's decision directly to the Office of Tax Appeals if the value in controversery is $50,000 or more.  For taxes levied after December 31, 2008, the bill provides that appeals taken to circuit court from a decision of the Office of Tax Appeals may not be appealed to the Supreme Court of Appeals unless the value in controversery is $50,000 or more.  The bill establishes procedures for election of arbitration of disputed decisions of a board of equalization and review (county commission).

2125.title: Authorizing pharmacists to dispense prescriptions remotely and administer immunizations
2125.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the scope of practice of pharmacists to allow them to remotely dispense and deliver prescription drugs and to administer certain specified vaccinations.

2126.title: Limiting civil action deliberate intent to certain injuries
2126.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit deliberate intent in civil actions to traumatic injuries only, to exclude occupational pneumoconiosis and other occupational diseases as a basis for deliberate intent actions and to require that "deliberate intent" can only be satisfied with a showing of an actual, specific intent.

2127.title: Preventing excess spoil or overburden near certain streams
2127.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent placement of excess spoil or overburden in or within one hundred feet of an intermittent or perennial stream.

2128.title: Relating to towing providers
2128.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure that towing services and their vehicles and operators are covered by safety rules. The bill also limits the information towing services provide on invoices.

2129.title: Protecting health care workers
2129.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend to health care workers the same protections afforded other persons who serve the public and are thereby regularly exposed to the threat of physical violence in the course of performing their jobs, by establishing enhanced criminal penalties for crimes committed against licensed and certified health care professionals.

2130.title: Requiring smoke-free medical facilities
2130.description: This bill provides that medical facilities shall be free of tobacco smoke and imposes posting requirements upon the medical facilities.  Additionally, it sets forth penalties.

2131.title: Providing one-time supplement for certain annuitants and survivor beneficiaries
2131.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time supplement for certain annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired at least three consecutive years.

2132.title: Transferring library funding obligation to excess levy
2132.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify how payment of the library funding obligation of a "special act library" is made from the local share.

2133.title: Establishing Bill of Rights and Responsibilities for Students and School Personnel
2133.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce acts of student violence and disruptive behavior through the implementation of a Bill of Rights, School Discipline Committee, series of county-wide meetings and increased penalties for chronically disruptive students.

2134.title: Establishing education goals and objectives for 2020
2134.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish goals and objectives for 2020 for both public and higher education, to focus and clarify elements of the accountability system for public higher education and to create a committee to study capital projects and facilities maintenance needs in higher education.

2135.title: Relating to Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
2135.description: The purpose of this bill is to conform the provisions of the West Virginia Streamlined Sales and Use Tax statute, West Virginia Code §11-15B, to the current provisions of the Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement as amended, to provide certain definitions of terms and to make certain technical and typographical corrections.

2136.title: Creating Sesquicentennial Committee and Fund
2136.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Sesquicentennial Committee and Fund to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the State of West Virginia; establish membership and compensation; provide the powers and duties of the committee provide for continuation of the committee; and provide for special registration plates to be issued by the Division of Motor Vehicles.

2137.title: Providing circulating registered nurse during surgery
2137.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a circulating registered nurse during every surgical procedure.

2138.title: Requiring greyhounds' six-month grace period before racing training
2138.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that greyhounds be kept with the state for six months before it may be trained as a racing dog.

2139.title: Adding certain terms to Human Rights Act and Fair Housing Act
2139.description: The purpose of this bill is to add "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Human Rights Act, prohibiting discrimination in employment and places of public accommodations.  This bill also adds "age" and "sexual orientation" to the categories covered by the Fair Housing Act prohibiting discrimination in housing.  It defines "sexual orientation" as "heterosexuality, bisexuality, homosexuality or gender identity or expression, whether actual or perceived"; and adds to §5-11A-3 a definition of "age" as meaning the age of forty or above.

2140.title: Appointing additional circuit court judge to Wayne County
2140.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Governor to appoint an additional judge to the 24th Judicial Circuit consisting of Wayne County to alleviate case load.

2141.title: Appointing additional circuit court judge to Mercer County
2141.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Governor to appoint an additional judge to the 9th Judicial Circuit consisting of Mercer County.

2142.title: Granting Legislative Initiative For the Elderly spending oversight
2142.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow an organization receiving funding from a service established by the legislative initiatives for the elderly (LIFE)to spend them as they think reasonably appropriate.

2144.title: Clarifying library funding obligation from local share
2144.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that if a county board of education moved the library funding obligation of a "special act library" from the regular tax levy to the excess levy, the library funding obligation under the special act would cease in the fiscal year in which the excess levy became effective or would have become effective if it had been passed by the voters.

2145.title: Requiring hiring preference for summer school program positions
2145.description: The purpose of this bill is to give applicants who are regularly employed on a full-time basis employment preference over other applicants when filling summer school program positions.

2146.title: Relating to teachers' professional development and preparation days
2146.description: The purpose of this bill is to add two days to the employment term for teachers to be used for professional development; change instructional support and enhancement days into professional development days; and allow more of certain days to be scheduled prior to the twenty-sixth day of August for the purposes of preparing for the opening of school and staff development.

2148.title: Creating Innovation and Development Act
2148.description: This purpose of this bill is to establish a West Virginia innovation and development program, to  attract and support capital investment in innovation-driven enterprises in West Virginia through a combination of direct annual investment by the state in seed capital, venture capital and other equity and debt investments in West Virginia; technical support and assistance to entrepreneurs in the state; and recoverable revenue credits to private investors to encourage private investment in seed capital, venture capital and other private equity funds, such program to be run and such funding to be awarded through a competitive selection process to be managed by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority.

2149.title: Eliminating Saturday school prohibition
2149.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the prohibition against opening school on Saturday and to remove the requirement that special classes conducted on Saturday be conducted on a voluntary basis.

2150.title: Relating to teachers' alternative education
2150.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement for a minimum of eighteen hours of course work for alternative routes to certification.

2151.title: Increasing number of Racing Commission board members
2151.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase from three to five the number of members on the Racing Commission board and sets forth who the members may be.

2152.title: Relating to liquefied petroleum gas-consuming equipment and appliances
2152.description: The purpose of this bill is to require certification of correctness as to design, construction and performance of domestic and commercial liquefied petroleum gas-consuming equipment and appliances. The bill would also:

2153.title: Limiting certain land use in growth counties for nonenergy purposes
2153.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of some lands for nonenergy related purposes in "growth counties."

2154.title: Allowing optometrists to prescribe drug-dispensing vision correction devices
2154.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow optometrists to prescribe vision correction devices which dispense drugs or dangerous drugs.

2155.title: Establishing Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board
2155.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Convention and Visitors Bureau Accreditation Board, establish its duties and responsibilities, and require accreditation standards for convention and visitors bureaus operating in this state.

2156.title: Exempting manufacturing inventory from ad valorem property taxation
2156.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt manufacturing inventory from ad valorem property taxation in this state.

2157.title: Relating to Public Employees Insurance Act
2157.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the PEIA Finance Board may make optional plans available as an IRS plan or as part of the preferred provider benefits.

2158.title: Defining certain external defibrillators' user terms
2158.description: The purpose of this bill is to add definitions for anticipated and unanticipated users of external defibrillators and limiting liability toward unanticipated users who render aid.

2159.title: Creating Taxpayer and Citizen Protection Act of 2008
2159.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate illegal immigration in West Virginia.

2160.title: Prohibiting lottery ticket sales during certain hours on Sundays
2160.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the sale of lottery tickets on Sundays from six a.m. till one p.m.

2161.title: Creating Voluntary Rural and Outdoor Heritage Conservation Act
2161.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for land conservation and stewardship through a newly-created Outdoor Heritage Conservation Fund to provide grants to certain state agencies and qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations.  An enhanced fee for the recording of deeds will be divided equally between the existing Farmland Protection Fund and the Outdoor Heritage Conservation Fund.  The Board of Trustees of the new Fund may direct the Economic Development Fund to issue revenue bonds to be secured by a portion of the recording fee.

2162.title: Modifying educators' professional or first class certificate renewal
2162.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend one of the requirements for renewing a professional or first class certificate based upon a bachelor's degree by allowing an electronic equivalent in lieu of an actual official transcript of six semester hours of approved credit.

2163.title: Limiting certain paraprofessionals' and interpreters' transfers
2163.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the application of provisions limiting the transfer of autism mentors and aides working with autistic students to also apply to paraprofessionals and interpreters working with students with any exceptionality.

2164.title: Requiring school principal make personnel recommendations
2164.description: The purpose of this bill is to require each school principal to make recommendations regarding the appointment, assignment, promotion, transfer and dismissal of all personnel assigned to the school under the principal's control; to add the principal's recommendations to the seven existing criteria to be considered when hiring professional personnel; and to increase the principal's increment by five percentage points.

2165.title: Relating to air pollution control permits
2165.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the expedited review of complete permit applications for sources, other than major sources.  It would allow all facilities with complete permit applications and who have received written permission from the secretary, to construct an altered or expanded source provided that operations of the altered or expanded source could not commence until its permit or permit modification was issued.  It also sets timelines for permitting actions, makes other clarifications of the secretary's duties in minor source air permitting and would require the promulgation of legislative rules to implement this bill by the first day of August, two thousand eight.

2167.title: Relating to motor vehicle accident reports
2167.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim.

2168.title: Creating Religious Freedom Restoration Act
2168.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the West Virginia Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

2169.title: Relating to racetrack table game licenses
2169.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the licensing requirements and licensing fee requirements for obtaining a racetrack table games license.

2170.title: Redefining "antique motor vehicle" to include antique trucks
2170.description: The purpose of this bill is to include antique trucks as antique motor vehicles; and creating special registration fee for antique trucks that is double the fee for antique cars.

2171.title: Creating Healthy Lifestyles Restaurant Calorie Posting Program
2171.description: The purpose of this bill is to initiate the Healthy Lifestyles Restaurant Calorie Posting Program; to encourage private restaurants to participate in this program and to provide that any restaurant participating in and advancing this program will be issued a universally recognized logo, suitable for public display by the business, and will benefit from the marketing of this program through all state agencies, as described in subdivision (d) of this section.

2172.title: Reducing certain temporary employees' service credit requirements
2172.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the number of days required for service credit of temporary employees of the Legislature's Joint Committee on Government and Finance and the Legislature from fifty five days to fifty days.

2174.title: Authorizing State Board of Education to set and collect review fees from certain publishers
2174.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the state board to set and collect review fees from publishers participating in the state instructional materials adoption procedures.

2175.title: Requiring Bureau for Public Health license free clinics
2175.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Office of Health Facility Licensing and Certification to license free clinics within West Virginia.

2176.title: Requiring CPR and first aid training in secondary school curriculum
2176.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the addition of CPR and First Aid training to the health education curriculum in secondary schools to further protect the safety of children in our schools.

2177.title: Requiring information collection from catalytic converter purchasers
2177.description: The purpose of this bill is to require purchasers of catalytic converters or any material derived from catalytic converter to require additional information from the sellers.  The bill sets penalties for knowing failures to collect and provide information relating to the sale of catalytic converters or any material derived from catalytic converters.

2178.title: Requiring abortion-related statistics' collection
2178.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the collection of statistics relative to abortions performed in the state.

2179.title: Prohibiting state-funded family planning centers from discussing abortion or abortion referrals
2179.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit family planning centers in West Virginia that receive state funding from discussing abortion or abortion referrals.

2180.title: Creating Water Resources Protection and Management Act
2180.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the continuation of the water resources survey; authorize DEP to develop a state water resources management plan; and authorize designation of regional and critical area water resources planning areas and plans.

2181.title: Allowing transfer of assets from Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System to State Teachers Retirement System
2181.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the voluntary  transfer of assets from the Teachers' Defined Contribution Retirement System ("TDC") to the State Teachers Retirement System ("TRS"); to provide an election on the question of actively contributing members of the TDC voluntarily transferring assets to the TRS; requiring seventy percent of actively contributing members of the TDC to vote in the affirmative; to permit the voluntary transfer of assets upon affirmative vote; providing for transferring members to receive service credit in TRS for an amount equal to seventy-five percent of the members' service credit to the TDC; and providing transferring members the option to receive full credit in TRS by paying the Actuarial Reserve.

2182.title: Creating Public-Private Transportation Facilities Act of 2008
2182.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Public-Private Transportation Facilities Act of 2008 within the Division of Highways.

2183.title: Prohibiting state or county reimbursement for abortion-related transportation costs
2183.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the state or any county from reimbursing any person the cost of transportation for an abortion.

2184.title: Exempting city and county hospitals from certain audit requirements
2184.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt city and county hospitals from audit requirements for local government offices.

2185.title: Relating to certain teachers' sanctions
2185.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the imposition of lesser sanctions rather than revocation of certificates upon a teacher for certain causes; and to authorize the State Superintendent to issue subpoenas and subpoenas duces tecum in certain instances.

2186.title: Allowing sheriffs' access to Board of Pharmacy database
2186.description: The purpose of this bill is to give sheriffs and their designee's the right to view the information contained in the State Board of Pharmacy's database.

2187.title: Prohibiting gender-based abortions
2187.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the performance of any abortion when the woman seeking it is doing so solely on account of the gender of the fetus.  The bill also prescribes a criminal penalty for violations of the section.

2188.title: Providing certain fetuses anesthesia
2188.description: The purpose of this bill is to require medical facilities that provide abortions to administer anesthesia to an unborn fetus when aborted, if it is older than seven weeks.  It also provides that when, during the course of an abortion procedure, a fetus is aborted alive, all available medical means must be used to preserve its life.  The bill provides criminal penalties for violations.

2189.title: Relating to Emergency Medical Services Retirement System
2189.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the definitions of "early retirement age","full time employment", and "political subdivision"; specify the date contributions are due the fund and provide for delinquency fees; clarify language relating to  the purchase of prior service and provide for delinquency fees; make a correction to the heading in section ten of this article; eliminate the minimum amount required for eligible direct rollover distributions; allow for rollover distributions totaling less than two hundred dollars; clarify language relating to the benefit awarded for a duty disability; add provisions for payment of additional death benefits; clarify the language relating to the effective date for receipt of a duty disability benefit; and make a correction to the time period for which an Interim study shall be conducted on the potential effects of the implementation of this plan.

2190.title: Accepting emergency medical services professionals' signature on prisoners' medical clearance forms
2190.description: The purpose of this bill is to include the acceptance of an emergency medical services (EMS) professional's signature on medical clearance forms for prisoners being accepted in jail.

2191.title: Relating to private investments in Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park
2191.description: The purpose of this bill is to attract private investment for financing, construction and operation of additional public cottages at Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park.  The bill authorizes and directs the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate rules regarding the granting of long-term lodging unit usage and related rights and privileges to private parties on commercially reasonable terms that are deemed appropriate, desirable or necessary by the Director to attract additional private investment for such purposes.

2192.title: Permitting internet sales of life, accident and sickness insurance
2192.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit Internet sales of life and accident and sickness insurance.

2193.title: Finding and declaring certain claims against state
2193.description: The purpose of this bill is for the Legislature to find and declare the existence of a moral obligation to pay, with public moneys, each of the claims herein against specified state agencies and the State of West Virginia, by the named claimants, payable from the specified funds, and in the amounts of the awards made.

2194.title: Providing certain coverage to state employees' pregnant dependents
2194.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide maternity benefit coverage and post-delivery care for pregnant dependants of state employees.

2195.title: Providing single hunting, fishing and trapping resident license
2195.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a single resident license for all hunting, fishing and trapping. The bill also would dedicate each fiscal year one percent of all revenue in the General Revenue Fund to DNR.

2196.title: Creating Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Act
2196.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Act, to require public improvement contractors to have and implement a drug-free workplace program that requires drug and alcohol testing be conducted by a contractor.

2197.title: Relating to Stop Domestic Violence, Sesquicentennial and "In God We Trust" license plates
2197.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Division of Motor Vehicles to create and issue "Stop Domestic Violence" license plates for passenger vehicles and motorcycles.

2198.title: Increasing certain crime victims' benefits
2198.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount of certain benefits for crime victims.

2199.title: Establishing penalties for manufacturing, selling, or dispensing certain controlled substances causing deaths
2199.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish penalties for any person who manufactures, sells or dispenses controlled drugs classified in Schedules I, II or II where a death results from the injection, inhalation or ingestion of the controlled substance.

2200.title: Increasing certain criminal trespassing penalties
2200.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase penalties for certain criminal trespassing offenses.

2201.title: Requiring hospitals report charity policies to Board of Health
2201.description: The purpose of this bill is to require hospitals to report to the State Board of Health their charity policies, how the hospital publicizes their charity care policy, and their collection policies for bad debt; and requiring the State Board of Health to adopt a charity care policy for free charity care to certain uninsured citizens by January 1, 2009.

2202.title: Relating to school cafeteria managers' pay grade
2202.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the pay grade of cafeteria managers.

2203.title: Exempting family court judges and magistrates from concealed weapon licensing requirements
2203.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt family court judges and magistrates from the licensing requirements for carrying a concealed weapon.

2204.title: Including true compensation on state employee paycheck stubs
2204.description: The purpose of this bill is to show state employees their true compensation which includes payments for health and retirement benefits.

2205.title: Permitting fraternal organizations certain use of charitable raffle proceeds
2205.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit fraternal organizations to use proceeds from charitable raffles in any manner consistent with its charter and not contrary to law.

2206.title: Relating to policemen's and firemen's pension and relief funds
2206.description: The purpose of this bill is to strengthen the financial condition of municipal policemen's and firemen's pensions and relief funds. The bill provides for new revenue by increased contributions by active members and municipalities, by increased insurance premium tax revenue dedicated to the funds, by eliminating requirement of duplicate actuarial studies and by improving investment returns by modifying investment flexibility and oversight.  All plans would be placed on an actuarially sound payment scheme.  State oversight would be enhanced by the creation of The West Virginia Municipal Pensions Oversight Board, which would be empowered to facilitate standardized procedures among all plans, assist in training and advising local boards of trustees, monitor investments, guard against fraud, provide physicians for disability examinations, and report to the Legislature.  Additional revenue from insurance premium surcharge to be distributed among the plans would be invested for five years with the West Virginia Investment Management Board in an attempt to maximize investment return for pension funds.  The plans are authorized to make short-term investments with the West Virginia Board of Treasury Investments.

2207.title: Requiring DUI offenders' community service
2207.description: The purpose of this bill is to require mandatory community service upon conviction of a misdemeanor offense of driving under the influence and creation of a central registry of persons convicted of driving under the influence.

2208.title: Relating to private investments for Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park
2208.description: The purpose of this bill is to attract private investment for financing, construction and operation of additional public cottages at Stonewall Jackson Lake State Park.  The bill authorizes and directs the Director of the Division of Natural Resources to promulgate rules regarding the granting of long-term lodging unit usage and related rights and privileges to private parties on commercially reasonable terms that are deemed appropriate, desirable or necessary by the director to attract additional private investment for such purposes.

2209.title: Relating to special district excise taxes
2209.description: The purpose of this bill is to prescribe the base and rate of tax for purposes of the special district excise taxes imposed pursuant to the authorizing code sections, and to grant the state Tax Commissioner discretion to require electronic filing of returns and prescribe rules relating to the electronic filing of returns related to such taxes, and to require the electronic payment of such taxes and prescribe rules relating to payment of such taxes, and prescribing what such rules shall contain, and to authorize sharing of tax information with bond trustees and authorize secondary sharing of such information with the bond issuers, bondholders and bond counsel and to make such trustees, bondholders and bond counsel subject to the confidentiality requirements for tax information set forth in West Virginia Code.

2210.title: Increasing compensation of Court of Claims' judges
2210.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the compensation of the presiding judge of the Court of Claims by an additional fifty dollars for each day serving as presiding judge.

2211.title: Allowing health care providers' discretionary reporting of individuals' driving competence
2211.description: The purpose of this bill is to promote public safety on the roadways of West Virginia by providing a mechanism by which health care providers may report when an individual they have treated has a condition that renders them incompetent to operate a motor vehicle.

2212.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Health and Human Resources
2212.description: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Health and Human Resources

2213.title: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Administration and Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety
2213.description: Making supplementary appropriation to Department of Administration and Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety

2214.title: Requiring boards of education hire best qualified candidate for extracurricular activities
2214.description: The purpose of this bill is to require boards of education to hire the best qualified person for extracurricular activities.

2215.title: Limiting certain park and recreation owners' liabilities
2215.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the liability of the section of Parks and Recreation of the Division of Natural Resources, county parks and recreation commissions, boards of park and recreation commissioners and owners of land used for public parks and recreation purposes under an agreement with any of the foregoing entities.

2216.title: Modifying certain firearm use restrictions
2216.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify restrictions relating to shooting and discharging firearms near residences, parks and certain other public places.  The bill would allow the shooting and discharging firearms within five hundred feet of any dwelling house, if written consent by all residents within five hundred feet is obtained and on or near any park or other place where persons gather for purposes of pleasure in an established shooting range.

2217.title: Authorizing Board of Risk and Insurance Management to provide certain airports' insurance
2217.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Board of Risk and Insurance Management to provide insurance to county and regional airport authorities and municipal airports.

2218.title: Redefining "all-terrain vehicle" to include all-terrain utility vehicles
2218.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the definition of all-terrain vehicle to include all-terrain utility vehicles.

2219.title: Relating to corporate net income tax and business franchise tax
2219.description: The purpose of this bill is to make technical and policy refinements to combined tax reporting requirements for the West Virginia corporate net income tax and business franchise tax, and to reduce the Corporation Net Income Tax rate starting January 1, 2009.

2220.title: Creating Beckley-Raleigh County Building Code Authority
2220.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Beckley-Raleigh County Building Code Authority to oversee operations of the Beckley-Raleigh County Code Enforcement Department and to adopt and enforce the state building code in Beckley and Raleigh County.  This bill also create a Building Code Authority Board of Appeals.

2221.title: Creating Community and Technical College Capital Improvement Fund
2221.description: Creating Community and Technical College Capital Improvement Fund

2222.title: Authorizing certain Alcohol Beverage Control employees arrest powers and to carry concealed weapons
2222.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner and certain employees to have arrest powers; and to authorize the  carrying of a concealed weapon while performing his or her official duties.

2223.title: Requiring gaming facilities issue monthly statements
2223.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the State Lottery Commission to require gaming facilities to issue monthly statements to patrons that list patrons' gaming winnings and losses, when a card or other data collecting method is used for this information.

2224.title: Reaffirming Legislature's constitutional authority to appropriate public moneys
2224.description: The purpose of this bill is to reaffirm the Constitutional authority of the Legislature to appropriate public moneys; to establish procedures for appropriation of moneys received in certain actions; and to require reporting expenses in these actions in order to provide the Legislature with information necessary for it to properly exert its authority to appropriate.

2225.title: Relating to Infrastructure and Jobs Development Council
2225.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the planning, construction, and expansion of new or existing water, sewer, gas, telecommunication lines or facilities and other infrastructure in conjunction with the  the construction of the new roads projects and to provide a tax credit for taxpayers assisting in the completion of projects recommended by the council and associated roads.

2226.title: Relating to War on Terrorism Service Medal license plate
2226.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a "War on Terrorism Service Medal" license plate displaying the "War on Terrorism Service Medal" logo.

2227.title: Requiring athletic trainers' presence at certain school games
2227.description: The purpose of this bill is to require all public schools to have an athletic trainer present at football and basketball games.

2228.title: Allowing State Auditor to fulfill certain tax lien requirements
2228.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Auditor to fulfill the requirements of tax liens on these properties sold to individuals.

2229.title: Allowing teachers to determine what classroom material may be posted on internet
2229.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a teacher to determine what classroom material the teacher posts on the Internet

2230.title: Regulating accountancy practices
2230.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow more firms and accountants to practice accountancy in West Virginia.

2231.title: Exempting certain State Teachers Retirement System retirement benefits from state income tax
2231.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt the retirement benefits of certain annuitants under the State Teachers Retirement System from state income tax.

2232.title: Creating senior resident lifetime hunting, fishing and trapping license
2232.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a senior resident lifetime hunting, fishing and trapping license that will cost fifteen dollars Persons who are sixty-five years of age before the first day of January, two thousand nine, are grandfathered in.

2233.title: Relating to crime victim's rights
2233.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact federal standards of crime victims rights.

2234.title: Creating Community Defense Act
2234.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the secondary effects of sexually oriented businesses, establishing regulations governing sexually oriented businesses and penalties.

2235.title: Providing appraisal methods for certain multifamily rental properties
2235.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the method of appraising certain affordable multifamily rental property for property tax assessment purposes.

2236.title: Authorizing Chief Medical Examiner to determine blood tester's qualifications
2236.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable the Chief Medical Examiner to determine qualifications for persons who may obtain samples and conduct blood tests.

2237.title: CLERK'S NOTE: Bill was submitted in error by Legislative Services
2237.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a modification to  income subject to personal income tax for the spaying and neutering of cats and dogs that are family pets.

2238.title: Establishing OxyContin Asset Forfeiture Fund
2238.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the OxyContin Asset Forfeiture Fund.

2239.title: Requiring coal prospectors to record and report certain geological information
2239.description: The purpose of this bill is to require coal prospectors to record certain geological information and to report said information to the department of environmental protection.  The bill also provides for the sharing of geological information recorded by coal and well operators with the state geological and economic survey.  Finally, the bill provides for the filing of core samples taken by coal prospectors and well operators and the submission of said samples to the state geological and economic survey.

2240.title: Creating Broadband Deployment Council
2240.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Broadband Deployment Council and to develop a strategy and mechanism to be employed in extending broadband to every West Virginian by stimulating demand for broadband services and by constructing the necessary infrastructure to meet that demand.

2241.title: Providing Economic Opportunity Tax Credit to certain businesses
2241.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a tax credit to taxpayers which do not satisfy the new jobs percentage requirement prescribed for the credit allowed under chapter eleven, article thirteen Q.

2242.title: Reducing solid waste assessment fees
2242.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce all solid waste assessment fees in West Virginia effective after the date the solid waste facility in McDowell County receives forty-five thousand tons of solid waste in any month.

2243.title: Regulating viatical life insurance settlements
2243.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the business of viatical settlements between insureds and viatical settlement companies with respect to life insurance policies. This bill will regulate how the company will operate its business; will require licensing of the company, as well as its brokers; and help to limit fraudulent practices.

2244.title: Creating Consent to Health Care of Minor's Act
2244.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Consent to Health Care of Minors Act, allowing for a caregiver who is not a parent, legal custodian or guardian of a minor to consent to health care for a minor through an affidavit.  The bill provides for revocation and termination of consent, good faith reliance on the affidavit, exceptions to an affidavit's applicability, penalties for a false statement in an affidavit of consent, and rule making authority.

2245.title: Providing for liner placement through mined-out coal horizons
2245.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the procedures for the placement of a liner through mined-out coal horizons.

2246.title: Legalizing and regulating fireworks' sale
2246.description: The purpose of this bill is to legalize and regulate the selling of fireworks; to impose a special ten per cent fee on the sale of fireworks; and to use those proceeds for pensions for qualified volunteer firefighters.

2247.last_action: On second reading to Government Organization
2247.title: Changing Division of Veterans' Affairs to Department of Veterans' Assistance
2247.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the name of the Division of Veterans Affairs to the Department of Veterans Assistance.

2249.title: Eliminating spacing consent from certain coal entities
2249.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement for spacing consent from coal entities along horizontal sections of coalbed methane wells while requiring the coalbed methane well permit applicant to plug the well, in a manner that meets state and federal requirements for mine-through of the targeted coal seam.

2250.title: Clarifying State Police responsibility for certain medical expenses
2250.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the circumstances under which the West Virginia State Police is responsible for the payment of medical expenses associated with injuries received in the performance of official duties.

2251.title: Authorizing Coalbed Methane Review Board to propose legislative rules
2251.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Coalbed Methane Review Board to propose legislative rules and issue spacing orders.

2253.title: Awarding National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to certain school leaders
2253.description: The purpose of this bill is to pay the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards salary bonus to the holders of certificates awarded to them during employment as a classroom teacher if they are subsequently employed as a school principal, assistant school principal or in another position in an instructional leadership capacity.

2254.title: Defining certain Public Employees Insurance Agency eligibility
2254.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the Director of the Public Employees Insurance Agency to define certain non-state retirees eligible for coverage.

2255.title: Clarifying definitions of "shallow well" and "deep well"
2255.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the definitions of "shallow" and "deep" wells to allow a shallow well to be drilled deeper and provide clarity to both definitions.

2256.title: Creating State Police Higher Education Security Act
2256.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia State Police Higher Education Security Act.

2257.title: Providing certain 911 operator procedure
2257.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure for 911 operators to dispatch emergency calls for service to law enforcement in a fair and equitable manner.

2258.title: Setting school athletic director standards
2258.description: The purpose of this bill is to set standards for school athletic directors. The bill also requires a high school to assign a full-time athletic director if the school has thirteen or more varsity sports, and at least a half-time athletic director if the school has twelve or less varsity sports.

2259.title: Defining who may designate disposition manner of deceased person's body
2259.description: The purpose of this bill is to specifically include the surviving spouse and a designated individual previously chosen by the deceased as a person who may designate the manner of disposition of a deceased person's body.

2260.title: Exempting insurance burial policies from Medicaid assignment
2260.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt insurance burial policies from assignment by Medicaid recipients to the Department of Health and Human Resources.

2261.title: Granting regulatory power to certain Board of Pharmacy facilities
2261.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant regulatory power to the Board of Pharmacy of ambulatory health care facilities and free clinics who dispense pharmaceuticals.

2262.title: Defining "caving"
2262.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "caving" as a recreational purpose and activity for which a landowner's liability for injury is limited.

2263.title: Prohibiting certain bail forfeiture
2263.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the provision allowing a bail posted by someone other than the person under bail to be forfeited for failure to comply with a condition of bail, other than that to appear.

2264.title: Relating to beverage sales in schools
2264.description: The purpose of this bill is regulate the sale of beverages in schools.  It requires the State Board of Education to establish nutrition standards for such sales.  It further provides that proceeds from  sales from federally funded nutrition programs accrue to the benefit of those programs.  Finally, the bill strikes the definitions of "school day" and "healthy beverage".

2265.title: Creating Municipal Roads and Bridges Repair Fund
2265.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a fund for the repair of bridges in Class III and Class IV municipalities when there is an immediate need for the repairs.  The bill provides for administration by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority.

2266.title: Relating to county solid waste assessment fees
2266.description: The purpose of this bill is to change one of the sources of funding for county and regional solid waste authorities from landfill tipping fees to collection fees in recognition of the important services provided by county solid waste authorities and the decreased usage of West Virginia landfills resulting from the federal district court decision Harper v. Pub. Serv. Comm'n. 427 F.Supp.2d 707 (S.D. W.Va. 2006).

2267.title: Prohibiting seizure of lawfully owned firearms during state of emergency
2267.description: The purpose of this bill is to strengthen the prohibition of the taking of lawfully-owned firearms and ammunition in a declared state of emergency or riot.

2268.title: Eliminating Social Security number requirement in securing state services
2268.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the requirement of the use of a social security number in securing any state services or assistance.

2269.title: Eliminating obsolete weapons' licensing statutory language
2269.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove obsolete statutory language pertaining to the carrying of deadly weapons by Department of Administration security officers, county park police officers, and municipal airport police officers. This bill also clarifies references in the trespassing statutes to conform to the present weapons statutes.

2270.title: Relating to certain state, county and municipal depositories
2270.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it easier for banking institutions to maintain the collateral levels needed to serve as depositories of public moneys.  This bill accomplishes this purpose in three ways:  First, depositories for municipal and county deposits already have the ability to place municipal and county deposits in certificates of deposit meeting certain requirements, in lieu of providing a bond or security in lieu of bond and gives depositories of state moneys that same option; Second, this bill permits banking institutions that serve as depositories for public moneys to pool securities in lieu of other bonding and pledging requirements; Finally, this bill permits public depositories to insure public deposits in excess of FDIC limits though a bankers surety bond.

2271.title: Relating to keeping and bearing arms
2271.description: This bill establishes:  Limitations upon the keeping and bearing of arms; defining terms; repeals language concerning county and municipal ordinances restricting firearms or ammunition; creates  additional exceptions to certain restrictions on where deadly weapons may be possessed; declares the provisions of the code to be the sole means by which the keeping and bearing of arms may be regulated; preempts any ordinance, rule, policy or administrative action inconsistent with the provisions of the code; sets forth exceptions; authorizes public property owners to prohibit or restrict the possession of deadly weapons to secure restricted access areas; requires all property owners that have legally restricted or prohibited the possession or carrying of weapons on their premises must give notice of such prohibitions or restrictions by posting specified signs; sets forth the format of those signs; and sets forth the effect of failure to properly post signs indicating such prohibition or restriction.

2272.title: Creating Electronic Telecommunication Open Infrastructure Act
2272.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand technology infrastructure to provide broadband Internet access throughout the State of West Virginia; create the Electronic Telecommunication Open Infrastructure Act (ETOPIA); provide definitions for terms used in the article; set forth legislative findings; require an inventory and mapping of the current availability of access to broadband communications in this state; develop coordinated deployment and operation of technology infrastructure within this state; provide for technology infrastructure inventory, local government cooperation and inventory survey reporting requirements; authorizing emergency and legislative rules; prescribe the authority of the Secretary of Department of Administration; describe specific authorized disclosures of confidential information; create Joint Legislative Oversight Commission on Transportation and Infrastructure; providing subpoena powers; providing for enforcement of subpoena power through a court of competent jurisdiction; prescribe the powers and duties of the Secretary of Commerce; establish reporting requirements; authorizing secretary to provide technical and funding assistance to develop technology infrastructure; authorize secretary to engage in consulting services for fee; authorize contractual and joint venture agreements; provide for the liberal construction of article; utilize broadband infrastructure, technology and information to enhance early childhood development; provide for the confidentiality of trade secrets and proprietary information; and provide for criminal penalties for unlawful disclosure of confidential information or data.

2273.title: Creating Herbert Henderson Office of Minority Affairs
2273.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Herbert Henderson Office of Minority Affairs as a cabinet in the Governor's office.

2274.title: Dedicating parts of certain severance taxes to counties and municipalities
2274.description: The purpose of this bill is to dedicate 5% of every million dollars of certain severance taxes for the use and benefit of the counties and municipalities from which those taxes were generated.

2275.title: Relating to real property sales for persons with legal disabilities
2275.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that either a guardian ad litem or a conservator is to be appointed when the property of a legally incompetent person is being sold.

2276.title: Limiting certain companies' use of eminent domain for electric transmission lines
2276.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the use of eminent domain by electronic transmission companies who do not have customers in West Virginia.

2277.title: Redefining "health care provider" to include pharmacist and pharmacy
2277.description: The purpose of this bill is to include pharmacists and pharmacies in the definition of health care provider related to the Medical Professional Liability Act.

2278.title: Redefining "nonintoxicating beer" to include craft beer
2278.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the definition of nonintoxicating beer so that craft beers are included.

2279.title: Reforming Berkeley County commission
2279.description: The purpose of this bill is to reform the county commission of Berkeley County by increasing the number of members from three to five and, approving such reformation by the assent of a majority of the voters of such county voting at an election, all pursuant to the provisions of section thirteen, article IX of the Constitution of West Virginia.

2280.title: Relating to Tax Increment Financing Act
2280.description: The purpose of this bill is to bring the West Virginia Tax Increment Financing Act up to current regulations and provide for financing regulations for development of infrastructure.

2281.title: Relating to Department of Administration's Purchasing Division
2281.description: This bill clarifies the purpose of the Purchasing Division by omitting the reference to leasing; requires bids to be based on written specifications; permits director to effectively negotiate; repeals the requirement for the director to establish a central duplicating office; clarifies resident, veteran, small and minority vendor preferences; provides a preference for vendors which use products manufactured in West Virginia; and permits the state agency for surplus property to sell commodities to the general public at the posted price.

2282.title: Leasing school buses for voter transportation
2282.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for the leasing of  school buses for the transportation of voters to the polls for general and special elections.

2283.title: Relating to certain law-enforcement officers' spouses license plate
2283.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit surviving spouses of law-enforcement officers killed in the line of duty to have a special license plate.  The bill also expands the definition of  those individuals who qualify as a law-enforcement officer.

2284.title: Relating to qualified continuing care retirement community
2284.description: The purpose of this bill is related to definitions of qualified continuing care retirement community and designated common areas.

2285.title: Establishing takeback program for certain electronics
2285.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a convenient and environmentally sound recovery program for the collection, recycling and reuse of covered electronic devices that have reached the end of their useful lives, maximize recovery of resources contained in discarded covered electronic devices and prevent improper disposal of materials in electronic devices in state landfills.

2286.title: Creating PROMISE Scholarship Summer Internship Program
2286.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Promise Scholar Summer Internship Program.

2287.title: Authorizing salary increase for certain state hospital workers
2287.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a $2,000 salary increase for socials workers and nurses at state hospitals that did not receive a $2,000 salary increase in 2007.

2288.title: Providing Medicaid coverage for certain ventilator patients
2288.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide Medicaid coverage for ventilator patient care at health facilities and to update the certificate of need standards applicable to ventilator services.

2289.title: Relating to continuing education requirements for insurance producers
2289.description: The purpose of this bill is to require waiting periods after three failures on examinations for adjuster and insurance producer licenses; allowing for continuing education credit for active annual membership in professional organizations or associations; requiring nonresidents licensed in another state who move to West Virginia to complete prelicensing education and pass the appropriate examination when their prior state will not grant waivers to individual licensed in West Virginia who move to that state; establishing penalties for failure to pay annual continuation fees; and permitting nonresident adjusters to not maintain offices in this state.

2290.title: Relating to Surface Coal Mining and Reclamation Act
2290.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the Surface Coal Mining and Reclamation Act by implementing the recommendations of the secretary, in consultation with the Special Reclamation Advisory Council and supported by academic and actuarial findings, to provide for the continued fiscal viability of the Special Reclamation Fund and to ensure that, as the coal mining industry matures, adequate funds are nonetheless reserved in trust to reclaim and restore water treatment systems on former mine sites where the reclamation bond has been forfeited.

2291.title: Authorizing Public Employees Insurance Agency to charge interest on late payments
2291.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit the Public Employees Insurance Agency to charge interest to employers upon amounts not paid on time.

2292.title: Permitting nonintoxicating beer sales near certain churches
2292.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit a beer licensee to locate within three hundred feet of a church if agreed to by the church under certain circumstances.

2293.title: Granting minimum amount of paid sick leave to certain state employees
2293.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant a minimum amount of paid sick leave to almost all employees working within the State of West Virginia.

2294.title: Establishing Track and Lottery Oversight Committee
2294.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a track and lottery oversight committee and sets forth how its three members are selected.  The bill also sets forth the qualifications of members, terms of office and compensation and bonding requirements.

2295.title: Relating to greyhound ownership
2295.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the amount from the Breeder Development Fund that can be used for construction and maintenance at two training track facilities, encourage participation in the sport from nonmembers of the association, and increase participation for whelped greyhound.

2296.title: Requiring Public Service Commission promulgate wind power projects' rules
2296.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Service Commission to promulgate rules relating to wind power projects.

2297.last_action: Removed from calendar by Rules Committee
2297.title: Specifying certain terms of Public Employees Insurance Agency participation
2297.description: Specifying certain terms of Public Employees Insurance Agency participation

2298.title: Authorizing chief technology officer's access to certain confidential information
2298.description: The purpose of this bill is authorize the chief technology officer to receive confidential records and have access to agencies' databases which may contain confidential information, while accepting the responsibility to safeguard this information as defined by applicable law.

2299.title: Relating to Municipal Home Rule Pilot Program
2299.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that pilot municipalities or metro governments may not pass ordinances contrary to the provisions of Chapter 5G of the West Virginia Code, relating to procurement of architect or engineering services.

2300.title: Modifying ISE schedule
2300.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the months for scheduled ISE days to September, November, January, March and May.

2301.title: Creating Juvenile Services Status Offender Fund
2301.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a special revenue account in the State Treasury known as the Juvenile Services Status Offender Fund to facilitate reimbursement of expenses incurred by the Division of Juvenile Services in housing juvenile status offenders.

2302.title: Relating to certain school coaches' requirements
2302.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons to continue as athletic coaches or coaches of other extracurricular activities in the public schools if they have served in the same position for three years and have received satisfactory evaluations.

2303.title: Specifying certain Public Employees Insurance Agency participation terms
2303.description: Specifying certain Public Employees Insurance Agency participation terms

2304.title: Extending certain driver license periods
2304.description: The purpose of this note is to allow the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles to extend the period of certain licenses under extenuating circumstances.

2305.title: Increasing certain state employee's incremental salary
2305.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase an eligible state employee's annual salary increase from fifty dollars for each year of service to one hundred dollars per year. The bill also reduces the qualifying length of service required to receive a salary increase from three years to one year.

2306.last_action: Recommitted to Government Organization on 3rd reading
2306.title: Reducing Director of Personnel's experience requirements
