2306.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the requirement that the Director of Personnel must have five years experience in personnel management in order to better the state's recruitment abilities for the position.

2307.title: Designating Pearl Harbor Day as legal state holiday
2307.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate the seventh day of December, "Pearl Harbor Day," as a legal state holiday.

2308.title: Appropriating certain moneys to Bureau for Medical Services
2308.description: This bill would continue the permissible appropriation of Public Employees Insurance Reserve Fund moneys to the bureau for medical services of the Department of Health and Human Resources.

2309.title: Reducing certain landfill solid waste assessment fees
2309.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce landfill solid waste assessment fees in West Virginia effective on the first day of a calendar month that begins 60 days after a three consecutive month period during which the average tonnage of solid waste disposed of in West Virginia landfills exceeds 185,000 tons per month during that consecutive three month period.

2310.title: Creating Nontraditional Career Development Centers Act
2310.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the secretary of education and the arts to enter into contracts with public and nonprofit private entities to support Nontraditional Career Development Centers in assisting displaced homemakers or single parents in receiving job counseling, job training, job placement services and other support services leading to high-skill, high-wage jobs.

2311.title: Creating Marriage and Family Therapy Board
2311.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate the practice of marriage and family therapy by establishing the Marriage and Family Therapy Board.

2312.title: Creating Senior Citizen Property Tax Payment Stabilization and Relief Act

2460.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Fair and Equal Citizenship Amendment
2460.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to clarify who is eligible for a seat in the Legislature.

2461.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Government Improvement Amendment
2461.description: The purpose of this resolution is to reduce the size of the House of Delegates to fifty members and to reduce the size of the Senate to seventeen members.  The resolution also limits the term of Governor to one six-year term.

2462.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Amendment Recognizing Right to Privacy
2462.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to recognize the right of the people to privacy.

2463.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Legislative Compensation Reform Amendment
2463.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to provide that the Citizens Legislative Compensation Commission determines increases in legislators' pay and expense allowances.  It eliminates the Legislature's authority to vote to increase or decrease members' compensation and expense allowances.

2464.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Inventory Exemption Amendment
2464.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to authorize the exemption from property taxation, as determined by the Legislature by law, of personal property inventory in the form of raw materials, goods in process and finished goods employed exclusively in or resulting exclusively from manufacturing.

2465.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Merit Selection of Justices and Judges Amendment
2465.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide that Justices of the Supreme Court and circuit court judges are appointed based on merit.

2466.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Homestead Exemption Increase Amendment
2466.description: The purpose of this resolution is to increase the homestead exemption from $20,000 to $50,000.

2468.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution clarifying Constitution does not require state pay for abortion
2468.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to clarify that the Constitution does not require the state to pay for an abortion.

2469.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Senatorial District Amendment
2469.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to increase the number of senatorial districts to thirty-four districts and provide that one senator is elected from each such district.

2470.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution clarifying Constitution does not require state pay for abortion or secure right to abortion
2470.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution to clarify that the Constitution does not require the state to pay for an abortion and to provide that nothing in the Constitution secures or protects a right to abortion.

2471.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Manufacturing Inventory and Tangible Personal Property Tax Exemption Amendment
2471.description: The purpose of this resolution is to authorize the exemption from property taxation of manufacturing inventory and other tangible personal property, as determined by the Legislature.

2472.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Dedication of Funding to Natural Resources Amendment
2472.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide constitutionally that the Legislature appropriate one percent of the State's General Revenue Fund to the Division of Natural Resources each fiscal year to be used to promote and preserve the State's natural resources and to fund law-enforcement activities associated with DNR.

2475.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Marriage Protection Amendment
2475.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the State Constitution in order to prohibit the State from recognizing same sex marriages.

2476.title: Proposing amendment to Constitution designated Veto Session Amendment
2476.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to section fourteen, article VII of the West Virginia Constitution, relating to creating a veto session of the Legislature to consider bills vetoed by the Governor.
